member.name: M:Alien.Start
member.summary: Initializes the alien unit with enhanced mobility settings for wall climbing and jumping
member.remarks: Sets specialized alien parameters: - JUMP_TIME to 0.215f for quick, precise jumps - hangGraceTime to 0.6f for extended ceiling/wall hang duration - maxWallClimbYI to 250f for fast vertical wall climbing speed - playerNum and firingPlayerNum to -2 (alien faction identifier) These settings enable the alien's signature acrobatic movement style

member.name: M:Alien.Update
member.summary: Updates the alien's behavior including panic-inducing presence that affects nearby enemy units
member.remarks: When the alien is alive, alert, and not impaired (blind/burning), it periodically causes panic in surrounding mooks within a 36-unit radius. This panic effect: - Only triggers when enemyAI is in Alerted mental state - Has a 0.2 second cooldown between panic pulses (panicSurroundingMooksDelay) - Calls Map.PanicUnits to frighten nearby enemy units - Creates a psychological warfare effect unique to alien enemies

member.name: M:Alien.AnimateActualJumpingFrames
member.summary: Animates jumping frames while maintaining proper vertical scale during acrobatic movements
member.remarks: Resets yScale to 1f before calling base jumping animation. This ensures the alien maintains correct orientation during jumps, preventing visual distortion that could occur from wall climbing or ceiling hanging states

member.name: M:Alien.GetEnemyMovement
member.summary: Processes enemy AI movement unless the alien is performing tumbling or somersault maneuvers
member.remarks: Disables normal AI movement processing when backTumbling or backSomersaulting flags are active. This prevents AI movement conflicts during special acrobatic states, allowing physics-based tumbling to complete naturally

member.name: M:Alien.NotPressingJump
member.summary: Handles wall climbing state transitions based on directional input when not jumping
member.remarks: Complex wall interaction logic: - When NOT wall dragging: calls base jump release behavior - When wall dragging without directional input: disables wall climbing - When pressing down while wall dragging: enables wall climbing and resets wallDragTime - When pressing up while wall dragging: enables wall climbing and resets wallDragTime This allows aliens to seamlessly transition between wall dragging and climbing states

member.name: P:Alien.WallDrag
member.summary: Gets or sets wall dragging state with automatic wall climbing activation based on input
member.remarks: Enhanced property that: - Get: Returns base WallDrag value unchanged - Set: Applies base value, then checks conditions for auto-climbing: * If pressing up/down AND not already climbing AND can climb AND anticipating climb * Automatically enables wallClimbing and sets lastKnifeClimbStabY position This creates responsive wall interaction where directional input during wall contact initiates climbing

member.name: M:Alien.Death(System.Single,System.Single,DamageObject)
member.summary: Handles alien death while ensuring proper sprite scaling is maintained
member.param: Horizontal force applied to the corpse
Vertical force applied to the corpse
The damage object that caused death
member.remarks: Resets yScale to 1f and applies it to transform.localScale to ensure the death animation displays correctly. This fixes any inverted or distorted scaling from wall climbing or ceiling hanging states

member.name: M:Alien.FallDamage(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies fall damage effects based on fall speed and current acrobatic state
member.param: The vertical impact velocity (negative values indicate downward motion)
member.remarks: Implements two-tier fall damage system: - Severe falls (yI < maxFallSpeed + 100f) during tumbling: Inflicts lethal damage - Moderate falls (yI < maxFallSpeed + 50f): Stuns for 0.4 seconds via AI action queue - Always resets yScale to 1f to fix any visual distortion The tumbling check ensures aliens take extra damage when out of control

member.name: M:Alien.CanPassThroughBarriers
member.summary: Determines that aliens can always pass through barrier blocks
member.returns: Always returns true, granting aliens unrestricted barrier passage
member.remarks: This ability allows aliens to move through barriers that would block other units, enabling more dynamic pathfinding and surprise attacks. Essential for alien AI navigation in complex level layouts

member.name: M:Alien.Inseminate(AlienFaceHugger,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Prevents face hugger insemination of alien units
member.param: The AlienFaceHugger attempting insemination
Horizontal force component (unused)
Vertical force component (unused)
member.returns: Always returns false, making aliens immune to face hugger attacks
member.remarks: Provides immunity to face hugger insemination, preventing alien-on-alien parasitic attacks. This maintains game balance and prevents recursive alien spawning scenarios

member.name: M:Alien.IsAboveLadder
member.summary: Determines that aliens never detect ladders below them
member.returns: Always returns false, preventing downward ladder detection
member.remarks: Prevents aliens from detecting or attaching to ladders below, ensuring they rely exclusively on wall climbing mechanics for vertical movement

member.name: M:Alien.IsNearbyLadder(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Determines that aliens never detect nearby ladders regardless of position
member.param: Horizontal offset for proximity check (unused)
Vertical offset for proximity check (unused)
member.returns: Always returns false, preventing all ladder proximity detection
member.remarks: Completes the ladder immunity system by preventing any form of ladder detection. This ensures aliens exclusively use their superior wall climbing abilities

member.name: M:Alien.IsOverLadder(System.Single,System.Single@)
member.summary: Determines that aliens never interact with ladders when checking overhead positions
member.param: Horizontal offset for ladder detection (unused)
Output parameter for ladder X position (not set)
member.returns: Always returns false, preventing overhead ladder detection
member.remarks: Part of the alien's ladder immunity system. Aliens use wall climbing instead of ladders, so this prevents unintended ladder interactions during ceiling movement

member.name: M:Alien.UnpackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Deserializes network state and applies death state if the unit was dead
member.param: The network stream containing serialized state data
member.returns: The stream after unpacking for potential further processing
member.remarks: After unpacking base state data, checks if actionState equals Dead and triggers Death() method with zero forces. This ensures proper death state synchronization across networked games

member.name: F:Alien.lastActionState
member.summary: Stores the previous action state for state transition detection
member.remarks: Protected field used by derived alien classes to track state changes. Enables detection of state transitions for triggering appropriate animations or behaviors

member.name: F:Alien.lastWallClimbing
member.summary: Tracks the previous frame's wall climbing state for transition detection
member.remarks: Protected field that stores whether the alien was wall climbing in the previous update. Enables derived classes to detect climbing state changes for animation or behavior adjustments

member.name: F:Alien.lastWallDragging
member.summary: Tracks the previous frame's wall dragging state for transition detection
member.remarks: Protected field that stores whether the alien was wall dragging in the previous update. Used by derived classes to detect when wall dragging starts or stops

member.name: F:Alien.panicSurroundingMooksDelay
member.summary: Countdown timer controlling the panic aura effect frequency in seconds
member.remarks: Private field that prevents panic spam by enforcing a 0.2 second cooldown between Map.PanicUnits calls. Decremented each update when alien is alert and unimpaired, reset to 0.2f after each panic pulse

member.name: M:Block.DoEnabling
member.summary: Updates the enabled state of this component based on ShouldEnable result. Optimizes performance by disabling blocks that don't need updates.

member.name: M:Block.FirstFrame
member.summary: Performs one-time initialization on the first frame after spawning. Caches sprite component and pixel data, deactivates all blood spray GameObjects, checks if the block should be destroyed based on collider state or health, hides broken edge visuals, gets sound instance, and stores initial state values (destroyed, collider enabled, health).

member.name: M:Block.FixedUpdate
member.summary: Unity FixedUpdate method for physics-timestep operations. Runs burn damage logic if the block is not destroyed.

member.name: M:Block.OnSpawned
member.summary: Called when the block is spawned into the game world. Initializes random generators, attachment lists, burn counter, layer masks, health values, grid position from transform position, and clears slime coverage. Also caches blood drip particle spawners if present.

member.name: M:Block.SecondFrame
member.summary: Placeholder for second frame initialization. Currently only sets a flag to prevent repeated execution but performs no other operations.

member.name: M:Block.SetupRandomGenerators
member.summary: Initializes the block's random number generators using the block's position as a seed. Creates separate generators for general randomness, collapse behavior, burning effects, and visual effects, all seeded with position and networking random seed for deterministic behavior.

member.name: M:Block.ShouldEnable
member.summary: Determines if this block component should be enabled based on current state. Returns true if burning, in destroy countdown, or being pushed.
member.returns: True if the block needs active updates (burning, destroying, or being pushed)

member.name: M:Block.Update
member.summary: Unity Update method that handles time-based block behavior. Processes destroy countdown after block is destroyed, manages oil particle unsticking, runs push force decay logic, and enables/disables the component based on current state.

member.name: F:Block.hasDoneFirstFrame
member.summary: Tracks whether the block has completed its first frame of initialization. Set to true in FirstFrame method. Used to ensure one-time setup operations are performed.

member.name: F:Block.isSetup
member.summary: Tracks whether the block has completed its initialization through SetupBlock method. Set to true at the end of SetupBlock after neighbor references, position, and bounds are configured.

member.name: F:Block.startColliderEnabled
member.summary: Stores the initial enabled state of the block's collider during FirstFrame initialization. Used by ResetBlock to restore the collider to its original state when resetting the block.

member.name: F:Block.startDestroyed
member.summary: Stores the initial destroyed state of the block during FirstFrame initialization. Used by ResetBlock to determine whether to restore the block as destroyed or active.

member.name: F:Block.startHealth
member.summary: Stores the initial health value of the block during FirstFrame initialization. Used by ResetBlock to restore the block to its original health value. Default value is 5.

member.name: M:Block.Burn(DamageObject)
member.summary: Processes fire damage to the block. Explosive blocks detonate immediately, flammable/oily blocks accumulate burn damage over time, heatable blocks increase temperature. Collapses block if burn damage exceeds threshold.
member.param: The fire damage information (note spelling in parameter)

member.name: M:Block.BurnCollapsePoint
member.summary: Virtual method that calculates the burn damage threshold for collapse. Returns 3 times the block's health in base implementation.
member.returns: The amount of burn damage needed to collapse this block

member.name: M:Block.BurnSurroundingBlocks
member.summary: Spreads fire to adjacent blocks and oil particles. Calls Map.BurnBlocksAround to ignite neighboring blocks and BurnSurroundingOil for attached oil.

member.name: M:Block.BurnSurroundingOil
member.summary: Ignites all oil particles stuck to this block. Iterates through stuckParticles list and calls SetAlight on each particle.

member.name: M:Block.CheckForMine
member.summary: Checks if this block has an attached mine and detonates it if the mine hasn't already exploded or been detonated. Uses RPC to ensure the detonation is synchronized across all clients in multiplayer.

member.name: M:Block.Damage(DamageObject)
member.summary: Applies damage to the block from various damage sources. Handles special damage types (DestroyBackground, InstaGib, Fire, Plasma), creates blood effects for alien blocks, triggers burning for flammable blocks, plays defend sounds for projectile impacts, and processes standard damage.
member.param: The damage information including type, amount, and forces (note spelling in parameter)

member.name: M:Block.DamageInternal(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies damage to the block's health internally, potentially causing it to collapse if health reaches zero. Called by damage methods to handle the actual health reduction and collapse triggering.
member.param: The amount of damage to apply to the block's health.
The horizontal force/impulse from the damage source, passed to the collapse method.
The vertical force/impulse from the damage source, passed to the collapse method.

member.name: M:Block.ForceBurn
member.summary: Forces the block to burn immediately, bypassing normal ignition conditions. If the block is not destroyed and is burnable (flamable or oily), it starts burning with a random duration of 6-10 seconds. Increments burn damage and triggers collapse when burn damage exceeds BurnCollapsePoint(). For destroyed blocks, still processes heat buildup if heatable or triggers damage if explosive. Always calls DoEnabling() at the end.

member.name: M:Block.PlayDeathSound
member.summary: Plays the appropriate death sound effect when the block is destroyed. Volume varies based on the last damage type: 15% volume for Unholy damage, 60% for InstaGib damage, and full volume for all other damage types. Uses the soundHolder's deathSounds array and plays at the block's position. Initializes the sound instance if needed.

member.name: M:Block.RunBurnLogic
member.summary: Executes per-frame burning behavior for blocks on fire. Handles flame particle spawning, damage accumulation over time, burning nearby units and doodads, spreading fire to adjacent blocks, and automatic collapse when burn threshold reached. Different logic for flammable, oily, and heatable blocks.

member.name: M:Block.SetAlight_Local
member.summary: Sets this block on fire locally without networking. Only affects flammable or oily blocks that aren't destroyed. Initializes burn time and increments burn damage counter.

member.name: M:Block.Weaken
member.summary: Reduces the block's health to 1, making it extremely fragile and susceptible to destruction from any damage. Used to create weakened blocks that will collapse from minimal damage.

member.name: F:Block.burnCounter
member.summary: Timer for spawning fire spread effects to nearby blocks. When it exceeds threshold (1f for normal, 0.1f for oily blocks), triggers fire spread.

member.name: F:Block.burnDamage
member.summary: The accumulated damage from burning. Increments when the block catches fire. When this exceeds BurnCollapsePoint minus 2, the block is destroyed.

member.name: F:Block.burnDurationCounter
member.summary: Tracks the total elapsed time since the block started burning. Increments while burnTime is positive for flamable blocks.

member.name: F:Block.burnTime
member.summary: The remaining time in seconds that the block will continue burning. Decreases each frame while burning. When it reaches zero, burning stops.

member.name: F:Block.burnUnitsCounter
member.summary: Timer for burning damage to nearby units. When it exceeds 0.25f, calls Map.BurnUnitsAround to damage units near the burning block.

member.name: F:Block.collapseBlocksAround
member.summary: Flag controlling whether this block should trigger collapse of neighboring blocks when it collapses. Set to false temporarily during certain operations to prevent cascade effects. Defaults to true and is reset to true after collapse operations.

member.name: F:Block.collapseChance
member.summary: Probability multiplier for collapse propagation to the above block. Value between 0 and 1 that determines the chance of the above block collapsing when this block is destroyed. Used in conjunction with collapseRandom to determine collapse propagation. Defaults to 1.0 (100% chance).

member.name: F:Block.collapseChanceMultiplier
member.summary: Multiplier applied to the collapse chance when this block collapses blocks above it. Default is 0.5. Used in DelayedCollapseAbove to reduce the cascade probability as collapses propagate upward.

member.name: F:Block.collapseDelayTime
member.summary: Time in seconds to wait after destruction before allowing collapse effects. Default is 0.2 seconds. Used in ShouldEnable and Update to control when destroyed blocks trigger collapse of blocks above them.

member.name: F:Block.destroyCounter
member.summary: Timer that tracks the delay before a destroyed block actually collapses. Counts up from 0 to collapseDelayTime after destruction. When it reaches collapseDelayTime, the block performs its actual collapse. Set to 100f for indestructible blocks to prevent collapse.

member.name: F:Block.explosive
member.summary: Indicates whether this block explodes immediately when catching fire. When true, fire damage instantly triggers DamageInternal instead of gradual burning.

member.name: F:Block.flamable
member.summary: Indicates whether this block can catch fire and burn when exposed to fire damage. When true, fire damage starts the burning process and increases burn damage over time.

member.name: F:Block.flameCounter
member.summary: Timer for spawning visual flame effects. When it exceeds 0.05f, creates flame particles via EffectsController.

member.name: F:Block.heatable
member.summary: Indicates whether this block spreads heat/fire to surrounding blocks when burning. When true and burning, the block calls Map.BurnBlocksAround to ignite adjacent blocks.

member.name: F:Block.lastDamageObject
member.summary: Stores information about the most recent damage dealt to this block. Used to determine special behaviors based on damage type and source, affect visual and audio effects, and propagate damage information to attached doodads and collapsing blocks above.

member.name: F:Block.shrapnelBitPrefab
member.summary: Reference to the smaller Shrapnel prefab for minor debris effects. Set in Unity editor to define secondary debris particles.

member.name: F:Block.shrapnelPrefab
member.summary: Reference to the Shrapnel prefab to spawn when this block is destroyed. Set in Unity editor to define what type of debris this block creates.

member.name: M:Block.CheckDestroyed(UnityEngine.Collider)
member.summary: Checks if the block should be marked as destroyed based on its collider state or health. Sets destroyed flag and destroyCounter if the collider is null/disabled or health is 0 or less, then calls DoEnabling to update the block's state.
member.param: Optional collider to check. If null, retrieves the collider from this GameObject.

member.name: M:Block.ReplaceBlockWith(GroundType)
member.summary: Replaces this block with a new block of the specified ground type while preserving position and connections. Creates a new block at the same grid position, sets up its connections to neighboring blocks, marks it as the persistent replacement, registers it in the network registry, and moves the current block forward in Z space. Updates the GameObject name to indicate the replacement.
member.param: The type of ground/terrain the new block should be.

member.name: M:Block.ResetBlock
member.summary: Resets the block to its initial state for level restart or pooling. Restores health, clears burn/damage states, resets position, hides all blood effects, clears attachments, and re-enables components based on starting configuration.

member.name: M:Block.SetPosition(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the block's position in the world based on its grid coordinates. Converts row/column grid coordinates to world position (multiplying by 16 units per grid cell) and updates both the transform position and internal X/Y values via SetXY.
member.param: The row index in the block grid.
The column index in the block grid.

member.name: M:Block.SetupBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32,Block,Block)
member.summary: Initializes the block with its grid position and neighbor references. Sets up the block's row/column coordinates, links it to adjacent blocks above and below, updates the GameObject name to include coordinates, and calculates world position bounds.
member.param: The grid row position
The grid column position (note spelling)
Reference to the block above this one, can be null
Reference to the block below this one, can be null

member.name: M:Block.UseLargePieces(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configures the block to use large tile pieces for visual variety. Sets parameters for window and mural pieces that span multiple blocks.
member.param: The leftmost column of the large piece group.
The bottom row of the large piece group.
Total number of columns the large piece spans.
Total number of rows the large piece spans.
Random offset value for visual variation in tiling.
Whether to use large window piece variations.
Whether to use large mural piece variations.

member.name: F:Block.IsADestroyableDoodad
member.summary: Indicates whether this block is actually a destroyable doodad rather than a standard terrain block. When true, special doodad destruction logic is used instead of normal block destruction.

member.name: F:Block.IsAlien
member.summary: Indicates whether this block is an alien-themed block. Affects visual appearance and behavior. Used to determine special alien block properties and interactions.

member.name: F:Block.IsBouncy
member.summary: Indicates whether this block has bouncy properties. When true, units that land on or hit this block will bounce off it. Used for special block types like trampolines.

member.name: F:Block.aboveBlock
member.summary: Cached reference to the block directly above this one in the grid. Set during SetupBlock and used for collapse propagation, terrain matching, and determining if this block is exposed on top. When this block collapses, it propagates the collapse to the above block if conditions are met.

member.name: F:Block.belowBlock
member.summary: Cached reference to the block directly below this one in the grid. Set during SetupBlock and maintains the bidirectional relationship between vertically adjacent blocks. Used for support checks and visual edge determination.

member.name: F:Block.bounds
member.summary: The rectangular bounds of this block in world space. Set during Setup to a 16x16 unit rect at the block's position. Used for collision and spatial queries.

member.name: F:Block.canHaveWaterDrips
member.summary: Flag indicating whether this block can spawn water drip particle effects. When true and the block has no block below it, water drips can be created. Defaults to true. Used to control visual water drip effects on the underside of blocks.

member.name: F:Block.canPersist
member.summary: Determines whether this block can be saved and restored during persistence operations. Default is true. Set to false for temporary or non-saveable blocks.

member.name: F:Block.collumn
member.summary: The current column position of this block in the grid. Represents the X coordinate in the block grid system. Set during initialization based on the block's transform position using Map.GetRow (sic). Used extensively for neighbor lookups, position calculations, and grid-based operations. Note the misspelling of "column" is consistent throughout the codebase.

member.name: F:Block.groundLayer
member.summary: Layer mask used for physics raycasts to detect ground and solid objects. Initialized in Awake to include "Ground", "LargeObjects", and "IndestructibleGround" layers. Used for collision detection and determining nearby solid objects.

member.name: F:Block.groundType
member.summary: The type of terrain this block represents. Determines visual appearance, behavior, and interactions. Used extensively for terrain matching checks with neighbors, collapse behavior determination, and special case handling for different block types like bridges, alien eggs, barrels, etc. Defaults to GroundType.Earth.

member.name: F:Block.height
member.summary: Defines the vertical grid size of the block in rows. Default value is 1. Used for multi-row blocks that span more than one grid position vertically.

member.name: F:Block.initialColumn
member.summary: The original column position when the block was first initialized. Stores the column value at initialization time for reference. Set during Awake to preserve the original grid position.

member.name: F:Block.initialRow
member.summary: The original row position when the block was first initialized. Stores the row value at initialization time for reference. Set during Awake to preserve the original grid position.

member.name: F:Block.originalPosition
member.summary: The original world position of the block when first initialized. Cached during Awake from the transform position. Used during the Reset method to restore the block to its initial position.

member.name: F:Block.persistThisBlockInstead
member.summary: Reference to an alternative block that should be persisted instead of this one. Used for block substitution during save/load operations. Hidden in inspector.

member.name: F:Block.replaceOnCollapse
member.summary: Whether this block should be replaced with replacementBlockType when it collapses. When true, the block transforms into the specified type during collapse instead of being destroyed. Set to false after replacement occurs.

member.name: F:Block.replacementBlockType
member.summary: The type of block that should replace this block when it collapses or is destroyed. Defaults to GroundType.Empty. Used with replaceOnCollapse to transform blocks during destruction sequences.

member.name: F:Block.row
member.summary: The current row position of this block in the grid. Represents the Y coordinate in the block grid system. Set during initialization based on the block's transform position using Map.GetRow. Used extensively for neighbor lookups, position calculations, and grid-based operations throughout the block system.

member.name: F:Block.size
member.summary: Defines the horizontal grid size of the block in columns. Default value is 1. Used for multi-column blocks that span more than one grid position horizontally.

member.name: F:Block.soundHolder
member.summary: Container for sound effects associated with this block. Used to play defend sounds when hit by certain damage types (bullets, blades) and death sounds when destroyed. The volume and specific sounds played depend on the context and damage type.

member.name: P:Block.AboveBlock
member.summary: Gets the block above this block in the grid. Uses the Map.GetBlock method to retrieve the block at same column, row + 1.
member.returns: The neighboring block above, or null if no block exists at that position.

member.name: P:Block.AboveIsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if the above neighbor position is empty. A position is considered empty if the AboveBlock is null or destroyed, and also verifies the row is not at the top edge of the map (row < Map.MapData.Height - 1).
member.returns: True if there is no block above or if the above block is destroyed (and not at map edge), false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.BelowBlock
member.summary: Gets the block below this block in the grid. Uses the Map.GetBlock method to retrieve the block at same column, row - 1.
member.returns: The neighboring block below, or null if no block exists at that position.

member.name: P:Block.BelowIsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if the below neighbor position is empty. A position is considered empty if the BelowBlock is null or if the below block's destroyed flag is true.
member.returns: True if there is no block below or if the below block is destroyed, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.IsAboveTheSame
member.summary: Determines if the block above has the same ground type as this block. Compares the ground types using Map.IsTerrainTheSame.
member.returns: True if the above neighbor exists and has the same groundType as this block, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.IsBelowTheSame
member.summary: Determines if the block below has the same ground type as this block. Compares the ground types using Map.IsTerrainTheSame.
member.returns: True if the below neighbor exists and has the same groundType as this block, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.IsLeftTheSame
member.summary: Determines if the block to the left has the same ground type as this block. Compares the ground types using Map.IsTerrainTheSame.
member.returns: True if the left neighbor exists and has the same groundType as this block, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.IsRightTheSame
member.summary: Determines if the block to the right has the same ground type as this block. Compares the ground types using Map.IsTerrainTheSame.
member.returns: True if the right neighbor exists and has the same groundType as this block, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.IsTopLeftTheSame
member.summary: Determines if the block diagonally above and to the left has the same ground type as this block. Checks the position at column - 1, row + 1.
member.returns: True if the diagonal top-left neighbor exists and has the same groundType as this block, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.IsTopRightTheSame
member.summary: Determines if the block diagonally above and to the right has the same ground type as this block. Checks the position at column + 1, row + 1.
member.returns: True if the diagonal top-right neighbor exists and has the same groundType as this block, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.LeftBlock
member.summary: Gets the block to the left of this block in the grid. Uses the Map.GetBlock method to retrieve the block at column - 1, same row.
member.returns: The neighboring block to the left, or null if no block exists at that position.

member.name: P:Block.LeftIsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if the left neighbor position is empty. A position is considered empty if the LeftBlock is null or if the left block's destroyed flag is true.
member.returns: True if there is no block to the left or if the left block is destroyed, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Block.RightBlock
member.summary: Gets the block to the right of this block in the grid. Uses the Map.GetBlock method to retrieve the block at column + 1, same row.
member.returns: The neighboring block to the right, or null if no block exists at that position.

member.name: P:Block.RightIsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if the right neighbor position is empty. A position is considered empty if the RightBlock is null or if the right block's destroyed flag is true.
member.returns: True if there is no block to the right or if the right block is destroyed, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Block.ActuallyCollapse(System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the actual collapse of the block. Can be called via RPC from network. Handles protection checks, destroyable doodad special cases, visual effects based on collapse chance, and triggers block destruction. Protected blocks are ignored.
member.param: The horizontal force/impulse for collapse effects.
The vertical force/impulse for collapse effects.
Whether to trigger collapse checks on neighboring blocks.

member.name: M:Block.Collapse(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Initiates the collapse process for the block with a given chance. Handles network synchronization, special damage source cases (helicopter chaingun, Satan force field skip RPC), and execution delays for crush damage. Only collapses if not already destroyed and chance is greater than zero.
member.param: The horizontal force/impulse causing the collapse.
The vertical force/impulse causing the collapse.
The probability of collapse (0-1). Values less than 1 may cause partial collapse effects.

member.name: M:Block.CollapseForced
member.summary: Forces the block to collapse with default parameters. Convenience method that calls CollapseForced with zero forces and 100% collapse chance.

member.name: M:Block.CollapseForced(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Forces the block to collapse with specified parameters. Simply delegates to the standard Collapse method, used when collapse must happen regardless of normal conditions.
member.param: The horizontal force/impulse for the collapse.
The vertical force/impulse for the collapse.
The collapse chance (typically 1.0 for forced collapse).

member.name: M:Block.DestroyBlockInternal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handles the internal destruction process of the block. Disables colliders, clears health, updates visuals, handles parachute deactivation, destroys water drips, notifies statistics, triggers mine detonation if present, destroys attached slime, unsticks oil particles, and optionally informs surrounding blocks.
member.param: Whether to inform surrounding blocks of this block's destruction, potentially triggering their collapse.

member.name: M:Block.EffectsCollapse(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates visual and audio effects when the block collapses but isn't completely destroyed. Spawns appropriate particle effects (alien, dirt, or custom colored) based on block type, plays collapse sound effects, and creates alien-specific collapse effects when applicable.
member.param: The horizontal force/impulse causing the collapse, affects particle direction.
The vertical force/impulse causing the collapse, affects particle direction.

member.name: M:Block.EffectsDestroyed(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates visual and audio effects when the block is completely destroyed. Similar to EffectsCollapse but with more particles and force, indicating complete destruction rather than just collapse.
member.param: The horizontal force/impulse from the destruction source.
The vertical force/impulse from the destruction source.
The overall force of the destruction, affects particle velocity and spread.

member.name: M:Block.InformAboveBlockOfCollapse
member.summary: Specifically notifies the block above that this block has collapsed. Uses both grid lookup and raycast fallback to find blocks directly above. Shows the bottom edge of the above block and triggers special behavior for oil tank blocks.

member.name: M:Block.InformSurroundingBlocksOfCollapse
member.summary: Notifies all neighboring blocks that this block has collapsed, triggering appropriate visual updates. Shows edges on adjacent blocks that are now exposed and specifically informs the block above which may need to collapse.

member.name: M:Block.IsEdgeBlock
member.summary: Determines if this block is at the edge of a structure by checking how many neighboring positions are occupied. Counts neighbors (including map boundaries as "occupied") and returns true if fewer than 4 sides have blocks.
member.returns: True if the block has less than 4 occupied neighbor positions, indicating it's an edge block.

member.name: M:Block.IsSolid
member.summary: Virtual method that determines if this block is solid for collision purposes. Returns true in base implementation, can be overridden by non-solid blocks.
member.returns: True indicating the block is solid, false for non-solid variants

member.name: M:Block.IsSupported
member.summary: Checks if this block is structurally supported and shouldn't fall. For falling structure blocks, verifies support by checking up to 3 blocks in each horizontal direction for solid blocks or blocks with support. Returns false if destroyed, damaged, or no supporting blocks are found within range.
member.returns: True if the block has structural support, false if it should fall

member.name: M:Block.NotBroken
member.summary: Checks if this block is still intact (not broken). Returns true if health is above 0 and the destroyed flag is false.
member.returns: True if the block has health and is not destroyed, false otherwise

member.name: M:Block.NotRolling
member.summary: Virtual method that checks if the block is not rolling. Always returns true in base implementation, can be overridden by rolling block types.
member.returns: True in base implementation, indicating the block is not rolling

member.name: M:Block.SetActive(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the active state of this block's GameObject. Virtual method that directly calls SetActive on the base GameObject. Derived blocks can override to perform additional activation/deactivation logic.
member.param: True to activate the GameObject, false to deactivate

member.name: M:Block.SetBelowBlockCollapsedVisuals
member.summary: Updates visual state of the block below when this block collapses. Virtual method intended for override by derived classes that need special below-block handling. Base implementation is empty.

member.name: M:Block.SetCollapsedAboveVisuals
member.summary: Updates this block's visual state when the block above it has collapsed. Virtual method for derived classes to implement special visual changes. Base implementation is empty.

member.name: M:Block.SetCollapsedVisuals
member.summary: Sets the visual state of the block after it has collapsed. Disables the main renderer, hides all edge pieces and center, shows broken background visuals, hides side broken edges, and deactivates all added block pieces to show the block as destroyed.

member.name: M:Block.SetParachuteActive(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parachute active state for this block. Virtual method that updates the IsParachuteActive property. Derived blocks can override to add visual or physics effects when parachute state changes.
member.param: True to activate the parachute, false to deactivate

member.name: M:Block.UnstickOilParticles
member.summary: Removes all oil particles that are stuck to this block. Called when the block is destroyed to ensure particles become unstuck and can fall/move freely. Maintains list integrity by removing invalid references.

member.name: M:Block.AttachAboveBlock(Block)
member.summary: Sets the reference to the block positioned above this one in the grid. Used for neighbor tracking and collapse mechanics.
member.param: The block positioned above this one.

member.name: M:Block.AttachBelowBlock(Block)
member.summary: Sets the reference to the block positioned below this one in the grid. Used for neighbor tracking and support mechanics.
member.param: The block positioned below this one.

member.name: M:Block.AttachMe(UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Attaches a transform's gameObject to this block's list of other attachments. Overrides the base class method to add the object to the otherAttachments list for tracking attached entities.
member.param: The transform whose gameObject should be attached to this block.

member.name: M:Block.AttachMe(SlimeGroundCover)
member.summary: Attaches a slime ground cover entity to this block. The slime is added to the block's slimeCover list for tracking and will be destroyed when the block is destroyed.
member.param: The slime ground cover entity to attach to this block.

member.name: M:Block.AttachMe(Doodad)
member.summary: Attaches a doodad to this block. Handles special cases for JiggleDoodads (added to separate list) and Spikes (stored in dedicated field). All doodads are added to the general doodadAttachments list.
member.param: The doodad to attach to this block.

member.name: M:Block.CrumbleBridge(System.Single)
member.summary: Override of base class crumble bridge method. Simply calls the base implementation.
member.param: The crumble chance passed to base method

member.name: M:Block.CrumbleBridges(System.Single)
member.summary: Sends crumble messages to adjacent bridge blocks. Raycasts left and right to find connected blocks, sends "CrumbleBridge" message, or directly calls method on adjacent grid blocks.
member.param: The probability that adjacent bridges will crumble (0-1)

member.name: M:Block.DelayedCollapseAbove
member.summary: Triggers collapse of the block above this one based on collapse chance and block type compatibility. Checks extensive type matching rules, transfers damage source, and initiates collapse with multiplied chance. Skips alien eggs.

member.name: M:Block.Push(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a horizontal push force to the block. Accumulates force over time and enables the block for updates. Base implementation doesn't move blocks but stores force.
member.param: The normalized horizontal push force to apply
member.returns: Always returns false in base implementation

member.name: M:Block.RemoveMe(SlimeGroundCover)
member.summary: Removes a slime ground cover entity from this block's attachment list. Called when slime needs to be detached without destroying the block.
member.param: The slime ground cover entity to remove from this block.

member.name: M:Block.RunCollapseLogic
member.summary: Executes post-destruction collapse behavior. Triggers collapse of block above if enabled, disturbs block below, crumbles adjacent bridges, and ensures collapseBlocksAround flag is set.

member.name: M:Block.RunPushLogic
member.summary: Gradually reduces push force over time. Decays positive and negative forces toward zero at 0.3 units per second, used for visual wobble effects.

member.name: M:Block.SupportedByDoodad(Doodad)
member.summary: Sets the doodad that is supporting this block. Used when blocks are held up by doodads rather than other blocks.
member.param: The doodad object that is supporting this block.

member.name: F:Block.attachedObjects
member.summary: Array of GameObjects attached to this block that move or are destroyed with it. General attachment array for objects not specific to a particular side.

member.name: F:Block.attachedObjectsBelow
member.summary: Array of GameObjects attached below this block. These objects are positioned relative to the block's bottom edge.

member.name: F:Block.attachedObjectsLeft
member.summary: Array of GameObjects attached to the left side of this block. These objects are positioned relative to the block's left edge.

member.name: F:Block.attachedObjectsRight
member.summary: Array of GameObjects attached to the right side of this block. These objects are positioned relative to the block's right edge.

member.name: F:Block.disturbed
member.summary: Indicates whether this block has been disturbed from its stable state. Used by IsSupported method for fallingStructure blocks to determine stability.

member.name: F:Block.doodadAttachments
member.summary: List of doodad objects attached to this block. Stores references to decorative or functional doodads that are attached to this block. When the block collapses, it iterates through this list to set the lastDamageObject on each doodad and calls their Collapse method. The list is cleared when the block is reset via the Reset method.

member.name: F:Block.fallingStructure
member.summary: Indicates whether this block is part of a structure that can fall when unsupported. When true, IsSupported checks for structural integrity and support conditions.

member.name: F:Block.mine
member.summary: Reference to a Mine object attached to this block. Checked in DestroyBlockInternal() and CheckForMine() methods. When block is destroyed, calls Detonate(true) on the mine if it hasn't already exploded or been detonated. Uses RPC for networked detonation.

member.name: F:Block.spikes
member.summary: Reference to a Spikes doodad specifically attached to this block. Set when AttachMe(Doodad) is called with a Spikes type doodad. Stored separately from general doodadAttachments list for quick access to spike-specific functionality.

member.name: F:Block.supportedBy
member.summary: Reference to a doodad that is supporting this block. Used to track support relationships between blocks and doodads. When this block collapses and has a supporting doodad, it calls the doodad's Collapse method and clears this reference. This field is checked in the IsSolid method to determine if the block counts as solid terrain.

member.name: M:Block.AddBlockPiece(BlockPiece[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Instantiates and configures a block piece based on its type. Background meshes are placed 12 units forward, centre tiles at 0.01 + foregroundCentreZOffset forward, and edge pieces 3 units backward. Applies forced materials if configured. Randomly selects from the provided prefab array and parents the piece to this block.
member.param: Array of BlockPiece prefabs to randomly select from.
If true, creates a background mesh piece.
If true, creates a centre tile piece.
member.returns: The instantiated BlockPiece (backgroundMesh, centreObject, or a regular edge piece).

member.name: M:Block.AddEdgePiece(BlockPiece[])
member.summary: Creates an edge piece positioned 6 units forward. Applies forced edge materials if configured, including special bloody material for BloodSeepage components. Edge pieces are typically used for broken block borders.
member.param: Array of BlockPiece prefabs to randomly select from.
member.returns: The instantiated edge BlockPiece with configured materials.

member.name: M:Block.AddForegroundDecorationPiece(BlockPiece[])
member.summary: Creates a foreground decoration piece positioned 3 units backward. Default wrapper that calls the overloaded version with -3f Z offset.
member.param: Array of BlockPiece prefabs to randomly select from.
member.returns: The instantiated decoration BlockPiece.

member.name: M:Block.AddForegroundDecorationPiece(BlockPiece[],System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a foreground decoration piece at a specified Z offset. Randomly selects from the prefab array and parents to this block. Virtual method that can be overridden by derived classes.
member.param: Array of BlockPiece prefabs to randomly select from.
The Z-axis offset for positioning the piece.
member.returns: The instantiated decoration BlockPiece.

member.name: M:Block.AddForegroundPiece(BlockPiece[])
member.summary: Creates a foreground decoration piece with a random Z offset between 1.94 and 2.0 units forward. Wrapper method that calls AddForegroundPiece with calculated offset.
member.param: Array of BlockPiece prefabs to randomly select from.
member.returns: The instantiated foreground BlockPiece.

member.name: M:Block.AddForegroundPiece(BlockPiece[],System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a foreground piece at a specified Z offset. Randomly selects from the prefab array and parents to this block. Used internally by other AddForegroundPiece methods.
member.param: Array of BlockPiece prefabs to randomly select from.
The Z-axis offset for positioning the piece.
member.returns: The instantiated foreground BlockPiece.

member.name: M:Block.AddObject(BlockPiece)
member.summary: Adds a BlockPiece to the list of additional objects attached to this block. These objects are managed separately from the standard attached objects arrays and are used for dynamic visual elements.
member.param: The BlockPiece object to add to the block's addedObjects list.

member.name: M:Block.Bloody(DirectionEnum,BloodColor)
member.summary: Applies blood spray visual effects to the block from a specific direction with the specified color. Calls the overloaded method with fully parameter set to false for partial blood coverage.
member.param: The direction from which the blood is applied (Up, Down, Left, or Right).
The color of the blood effect (Red, Oil, Frozen, etc.).

member.name: M:Block.Bloody(DirectionEnum,BloodColor,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies blood spray visual effects to the block from a specific direction with control over full coverage. Handles activating blood spray GameObjects, updating sprite colors, applying blood to attached doodads and block pieces, creating oil pools when appropriate, and managing blood drip particle effects.
member.param: The direction from which the blood is applied (Up, Down, Left, or Right).
The color of the blood effect (Red, Oil, Frozen, etc.).
Whether to apply full blood coverage. For oil, this affects pool creation threshold.

member.name: M:Block.Bloody(UnityEngine.Vector3,BloodColor)
member.summary: Applies blood spray effects based on a normal vector direction. Converts the vector to a cardinal direction and only applies blood if that side isn't already bloodied. Used for directional blood splatter from impacts.
member.param: The normal vector indicating the direction of blood application.
The color of the blood effect.

member.name: M:Block.CanBloody(DirectionEnum)
member.summary: Determines if the block can receive blood spray effects from a specific direction. Blood can only be applied from directions where there is no solid neighboring block, ensuring blood only appears on exposed surfaces.
member.param: The direction from which the blood would be applied (Up, Down, Left, or Right).
member.returns: True if there is no solid block in the specified direction, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Block.CreateDecal(DecalInfo)
member.summary: Creates a decal effect on the block based on the provided decal information. Currently only supports bloody decals, which are applied to both the block and any attached doodads. Checks if the block can be bloodied in the specified direction before applying.
member.param: Contains the type of decal (only Bloody supported), direction, and blood color information.

member.name: M:Block.CreateFlames(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a flame visual effect at the block's position with specified direction offset. Used during burning to spawn fire particles.
member.param: The directional offset for the flame effect, typically randomized within a 6-unit radius

member.name: M:Block.FindBackgroundBlockFirstCollumn(System.Int32,GroundType)
member.summary: Finds the leftmost column of a contiguous group of background blocks with the same ground type. Similar to FindBigBlockFirstCollumn but checks background terrain instead of foreground. Includes a safety counter of 200 iterations to prevent infinite loops.
member.param: The starting column to search from.
The ground type to match.
member.returns: The leftmost column index of the contiguous background block group.

member.name: M:Block.FindBackgroundBlockLastCollumn(System.Int32,GroundType)
member.summary: Finds the rightmost column of a contiguous group of background blocks with the same ground type. Similar to FindBigBlockLastCollumn but checks background terrain instead of foreground. Includes a safety counter of 200 iterations to prevent infinite loops.
member.param: The starting column to search from.
The ground type to match.
member.returns: The rightmost column index of the contiguous background block group.

member.name: M:Block.FindBackgroundBlockTopRow(System.Int32,GroundType)
member.summary: Finds the topmost row of a contiguous group of background blocks with the same ground type. Searches upward in the block's column until it finds a different ground type. Includes a safety counter of 200 iterations to prevent infinite loops.
member.param: The starting row to search from.
The ground type to match.
member.returns: The topmost row index of the contiguous background block group.

member.name: M:Block.FindBigBlockBottomRow(System.Int32,System.Int32,GroundType)
member.summary: Finds the bottommost row of a contiguous group of blocks with the same ground type. Searches downward from the given position until it finds a different ground type. Used for determining large tile piece boundaries. Includes a safety counter of 200 iterations to prevent infinite loops.
member.param: The column to search in.
The starting row to search from.
The ground type to match.
member.returns: The bottommost row index of the contiguous block group.

member.name: M:Block.FindBigBlockFirstCollumn(System.Int32,GroundType)
member.summary: Finds the leftmost column of a contiguous group of blocks with the same ground type. Searches left from the given column until it finds a different ground type or reaches the map edge. Used for determining large tile piece boundaries. Includes a safety counter of 200 iterations to prevent infinite loops.
member.param: The starting column to search from.
The ground type to match.
member.returns: The leftmost column index of the contiguous block group.

member.name: M:Block.FindBigBlockLastCollumn(System.Int32,GroundType)
member.summary: Finds the rightmost column of a contiguous group of blocks with the same ground type. Searches right from the given column until it finds a different ground type or reaches the map width. Used for determining large tile piece boundaries. Includes a safety counter of 200 iterations to prevent infinite loops.
member.param: The starting column to search from.
The ground type to match.
member.returns: The rightmost column index of the contiguous block group.

member.name: M:Block.FindBigBlockTopRow(System.Int32,System.Int32,GroundType)
member.summary: Finds the topmost row of a contiguous group of blocks with the same ground type. Searches upward from the given position until it finds a different ground type. Used for determining large tile piece boundaries. Includes a safety counter of 200 iterations to prevent infinite loops.
member.param: The column to search in.
The starting row to search from.
The ground type to match.
member.returns: The topmost row index of the contiguous block group.

member.name: M:Block.FullBloody(UnityEngine.Vector3,BloodColor)
member.summary: Applies full blood spray effects based on a normal vector direction. Similar to Bloody but ensures full coverage when applied. Converts the vector to a cardinal direction and only applies if that side isn't already bloodied.
member.param: The normal vector indicating the direction of blood application.
The color of the blood effect.

member.name: M:Block.HideAbove
member.summary: Hides all visual elements on the top side of the block, including attached objects, blood sprays, edge pieces, and triggers doodad collapses. Sets hiddenTop flag to true, deactivates attachedObjects array and all top-side blood sprays/edges, calls HideOtherAttachments on base class, and triggers Collapse on all doodadAttachments with the current lastDamageObject.

member.name: M:Block.HideBackgroundMesh
member.summary: Hides the background mesh visual component of this block by deactivating its GameObject. Used when the block needs to hide its background decoration.

member.name: M:Block.HideBelow
member.summary: Hides all visual elements on the bottom side of the block, including attached objects, blood sprays, and edge pieces. Sets hiddenBottom flag to true and deactivates all bottom-side GameObjects including attachedObjectsBelow array, bloodSprayBottom, bloodSprayBottomHidden, and bottomEdge.

member.name: M:Block.HideBottomDecoration
member.summary: Virtual method to hide bottom decorations on this block. Base implementation is empty. Derived block types can override to control visibility of bottom decorative elements.

member.name: M:Block.HideBrokenEdges
member.summary: Hides all broken edge visuals including background and side edges. Deactivates backgroundEdgeBroken, updates its Z offset based on row/column position for visual variety, and calls HideSideBrokenEdges to hide all directional broken edges.

member.name: M:Block.HideCentre
member.summary: Hides the center object visual component of this block by deactivating its GameObject. Used when the block's center visual needs to be hidden.

member.name: M:Block.HideLeft
member.summary: Hides all visual elements on the left side of the block, including attached objects, blood sprays, and edge pieces. Sets hiddenLeft flag to true and deactivates all left-side GameObjects including attachedObjectsLeft array, bloodSprayLeft, bloodSprayLeftHidden, and leftEdge.

member.name: M:Block.HideRight
member.summary: Hides all visual elements on the right side of the block, including attached objects, blood sprays, and edge pieces. Sets hiddenRight flag to true and deactivates all right-side GameObjects including attachedObjectsRight array, bloodSprayRight, bloodSprayRightHidden, and rightEdge.

member.name: M:Block.HideSideBrokenEdges
member.summary: Hides all directional broken edge visuals (top, bottom, left, right). Deactivates the GameObjects for topEdgeBroken, bottomEdgeBroken, leftEdgeBroken, and rightEdgeBroken if they exist.

member.name: M:Block.HideTopDecorationShowTopEdge
member.summary: Virtual method to hide top decorations while showing the top edge. Base implementation is empty. Derived block types can override to manage visibility of decorative elements versus structural edges.

member.name: M:Block.IncreaseDripRate
member.summary: Increases the rate of water drips from this block by reducing the delay between drips. Only works if canHaveWaterDrips is true and there's no block below. If no drip exists, spawns a new water drip. Otherwise reduces the existing drip's delay by 1 second (minimum 0.5 seconds).

member.name: M:Block.MakeAlienBlockCollapseEffects(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates visual effects when an alien block collapses, including green blood gushes, slime particles, and optional alien particles. Spawns two blood gush effects in opposite directions, multiple slime particles with varying velocities, and alien particles if createParticles is true.
member.param: The X position where the effects should spawn.
The Y position where the effects should spawn.
The horizontal velocity influence for the effects.
The vertical velocity influence for the effects.
Whether to create alien particle effects in addition to blood and slime (default true).

member.name: M:Block.MoveBottomEdgeToForeground
member.summary: Virtual method to move the bottom edge visual element to the foreground rendering layer. Base implementation is empty. Derived blocks can override to adjust edge rendering order.

member.name: M:Block.MoveLeftEdgeToForeground
member.summary: Virtual method to move the left edge visual element to the foreground rendering layer. Base implementation is empty. Derived blocks can override to adjust edge rendering order.

member.name: M:Block.MoveRightEdgeToForeground
member.summary: Virtual method to move the right edge visual element to the foreground rendering layer. Base implementation is empty. Derived blocks can override to adjust edge rendering order.

member.name: M:Block.MoveTopEdgeToForeground
member.summary: Virtual method to move the top edge visual element to the foreground rendering layer. Base implementation is empty. Derived blocks can override to adjust edge rendering order.

member.name: M:Block.Rustle(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Virtual method called when foliage or vegetation blocks need to animate rustling movement. Empty in base implementation, typically overridden by grass or bush blocks.
member.param: The vertical rustling strength
The horizontal rustling position
The horizontal rustling impulse/intensity

member.name: M:Block.SetCollapsedVisuals
member.summary: Hides all visual components of the block when it has collapsed. Disables the renderer, hides all edge pieces, shows the broken background mesh, and deactivates any added objects like decorations.

member.name: M:Block.ShowBackgroundMesh
member.summary: Shows the background mesh visual component of this block by activating its GameObject. Used to reveal background decoration when the block's foreground is damaged or destroyed.

member.name: M:Block.ShowBottomEdge
member.summary: Shows the broken edge visual on the bottom side of the block if the block is not destroyed. Only activates bottomEdgeBroken GameObject if the block is still intact.

member.name: M:Block.ShowBrokenBackground
member.summary: Shows the broken background edge visual and hides the main renderer when the block is damaged. Activates the backgroundEdgeBroken GameObject and disables the block's main Renderer component to show damage state.

member.name: M:Block.ShowCentre
member.summary: Shows the center object visual component of this block by activating its GameObject. The center object typically represents the main visual element of the block.

member.name: M:Block.ShowLeftEdge
member.summary: Shows the broken edge visual on the left side of the block if the block is not destroyed. Only activates leftEdgeBroken GameObject if the block is still intact.

member.name: M:Block.ShowRightEdge
member.summary: Shows the broken edge visual on the right side of the block if the block is not destroyed. Only activates rightEdgeBroken GameObject if the block is still intact.

member.name: M:Block.ShowTopEdge
member.summary: Shows the broken edge visual on the top side of the block if the block is not destroyed. Only activates topEdgeBroken GameObject if the block is still intact.

member.name: M:Block.SpawnSlimeDrip
member.summary: Spawns a slime drip particle effect beneath this block. Creates a new slime drip effect using EffectsController if one doesn't already exist. The drip is positioned 8 units below the block with a random horizontal offset between -7 and 7 units, and has a random delay between 0.5 and 4 seconds.

member.name: M:Block.SpawnWaterDrip
member.summary: Spawns a water drip particle effect beneath this block. Creates a new water drip effect using EffectsController if one doesn't already exist. The drip is positioned 8 units below the block with a random horizontal offset between -7 and 7 units, and has a random delay between 0.5 and 4 seconds.

member.name: F:Block._bloodyTopCounter
member.summary: Counts the number of times blood has been applied to the top edge. When greater than 7 and blood color is Oil, triggers oil pool placement below the block.

member.name: F:Block.addedObjects
member.summary: List of additional BlockPiece objects attached to this block for decorative or functional purposes. Initialized with capacity 8 in OnSpawned(). Objects added via AddObject() method. All pieces receive Bump() effects when stepped on and are deactivated when block collapses.

member.name: F:Block.backgroundEdgeBroken
member.summary: SpriteSM component for the broken background edge visual. Shown via ShowBrokenBackground() when block is damaged, hidden in HideBrokenEdges(). Z offset is adjusted based on row/column modulo 4 for visual variety when hiding.

member.name: F:Block.backgroundMesh
member.summary: Protected reference to the background mesh BlockPiece. Created by AddBlockPiece() when isBackgroundMesh is true, positioned 12 units forward in Z. Shown when block is damaged via ShowBackgroundMesh(), hidden via HideBackgroundMesh(). Uses forceCenterTileBackgroundMaterial if configured.

member.name: F:Block.blocksOfTypeCollumns
member.summary: The total number of columns in a group of blocks of the same type. Set by UseLargePieces to define the width of tiled structures like buildings or walls.

member.name: F:Block.blocksOfTypeRows
member.summary: The total number of rows in a group of blocks of the same type. Set by UseLargePieces to define the height of tiled structures like buildings or walls.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayBottom
member.summary: GameObject for blood spray effect on the bottom side of the block. Activated when Bloody() is called with DirectionEnum.Down. Contains ParticleSpawner components cached in bloodSprayBottomBloodDrips for blood drip effects. Creates oil pools when bloodied with BloodColor.Oil.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayBottomBloodDrips
member.summary: Private array of ParticleSpawner components found in bloodSprayBottom's children. Cached during FirstFrame() if bloodSprayBottom exists. Used to create blood drip particle effects when bottom is bloodied, with emission rate and color adjusted based on BloodColor type.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayBottomHidden
member.summary: GameObject for hidden blood spray on bottom side. Deactivated in HideBelow() method along with regular bloodSprayBottom. Provides alternative blood visuals for specific block states or types where standard blood spray needs different positioning.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayBottomPiece
member.summary: BlockPiece component for additional blood effects on the bottom side. Not directly referenced in visible code but follows pattern of other blood spray pieces. Likely used for layered blood visuals on complex blocks.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayLeft
member.summary: GameObject for blood spray effect on the left side of the block. Activated when Bloody() is called with DirectionEnum.Left. Deactivated during FirstFrame() initialization and HideLeft(). Contains SpriteSM component for color changes.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayLeftHidden
member.summary: GameObject for hidden blood spray on left side. Deactivated in HideLeft() method along with regular bloodSprayLeft. Provides alternative blood visuals for specific block states or types where standard blood spray needs different positioning.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayLeftPiece
member.summary: BlockPiece component for additional blood effects on the left side. Receives Bloody() calls with color and fully parameters when left side is bloodied. Cleaned via Unbloody() during blood removal. Used for blocks with complex edge geometry.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayRight
member.summary: GameObject for blood spray effect on the right side of the block. Activated when Bloody() is called with DirectionEnum.Right. Deactivated during FirstFrame() initialization and HideRight(). Contains SpriteSM component for color changes.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayRightHidden
member.summary: GameObject for hidden blood spray on right side. Deactivated in HideRight() method along with regular bloodSprayRight. Provides alternative blood visuals for specific block states or types where standard blood spray needs different positioning.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayRightPiece
member.summary: BlockPiece component for additional blood effects on the right side. Receives Bloody() calls with color and fully parameters when right side is bloodied. Cleaned via Unbloody() during blood removal. Used for blocks with complex edge geometry.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayTop
member.summary: GameObject for blood spray effect on the top side of the block. Activated when Bloody() is called with DirectionEnum.Up. Deactivated during FirstFrame() initialization and when cleaning blood. Contains SpriteSM component for color changes based on BloodColor parameter.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayTopHidden
member.summary: GameObject for hidden blood spray on top side. Deactivated in HideAbove() method along with regular bloodSprayTop. Provides alternative blood visuals for specific block states or types where standard blood spray needs different positioning.

member.name: F:Block.bloodSprayTopPiece
member.summary: BlockPiece component for additional blood effects on the top side. Not directly referenced in visible code but follows pattern of other blood spray pieces. Likely used for layered blood visuals on complex blocks.

member.name: F:Block.bloodyBottom
member.summary: Indicates whether the bottom edge of the block has blood visual effects applied. Set by Bloody() when blood hits from above (direction Down).

member.name: F:Block.bloodyLeft
member.summary: Indicates whether the left edge of the block has blood visual effects applied. Set by Bloody() when blood hits from the right (direction Left).

member.name: F:Block.bloodyRight
member.summary: Indicates whether the right edge of the block has blood visual effects applied. Set by Bloody() when blood hits from the left (direction Right).

member.name: F:Block.bloodyTop
member.summary: Indicates whether the top edge of the block has blood visual effects applied. Set by Bloody() when blood hits from below (direction Up).

member.name: F:Block.bottomEdge
member.summary: Reference to the BlockPiece component representing the bottom edge visual of this block. Used for edge rendering and blood effects on the bottom side.

member.name: F:Block.bottomEdgeBroken
member.summary: GameObject representing the broken bottom edge visual. Activated by ShowBottomEdge() when neighboring blocks are destroyed and this block remains intact. Hidden during HideSideBrokenEdges() and block initialization.

member.name: F:Block.centreObject
member.summary: The main central visual BlockPiece of this block. Created by AddBlockPiece() when isCentreTile is true, positioned at 0.01f + foregroundCentreZOffset forward. Can be shown/hidden via ShowCentre() and HideCentre() methods. Uses forceCenterTileForegroundMaterial if configured.

member.name: F:Block.dropCustomParticleColor
member.summary: When true, uses custom particle colors (particleColor1 and particleColor2) instead of default colors when spawning collapse particles.

member.name: F:Block.dropDirt
member.summary: When true, the block spawns dirt particles when destroyed or collapsed. Checked in EffectsCollapse() and DestroyBlockInternal().

member.name: F:Block.firstBlockOfTypeCollumn
member.summary: The starting column position for a group of blocks of the same type. Set by UseLargePieces for blocks that are part of larger structures. Used to calculate relative position within a tiled pattern.

member.name: F:Block.firstBlockOfTypeRow
member.summary: The starting row position for a group of blocks of the same type. Set by UseLargePieces for blocks that are part of larger structures. Used to calculate relative position within a tiled pattern.

member.name: F:Block.forceCenterTileBackgroundMaterial
member.summary: Optional material override for center background tiles. Applied to backgroundMesh in AddBackgroundPiece() if not null.

member.name: F:Block.forceCenterTileForegroundMaterial
member.summary: Optional material override for center foreground tiles. Applied to centreObject in AddForegroundPiece() if not null.

member.name: F:Block.forceEdgeBloodSeepageForegroundMaterial
member.summary: Optional material override for blood seepage on edge pieces. Applied to BloodSeepage component's bloodyMaterial in AddForegroundPiece() and AddEdgePiece().

member.name: F:Block.forceEdgeForegroundMaterial
member.summary: Optional material override for edge foreground pieces. Applied in AddForegroundPiece() and AddEdgePiece() when not null.

member.name: F:Block.foregroundCentreZOffset
member.summary: Z-axis offset for foreground center pieces when the block is destroyed. Default is 2.0. Used in AddForegroundCentrePiece to position destruction debris in front of the block.

member.name: F:Block.hasBloodPoolAbove
member.summary: Flag indicating whether there is a blood pool effect on top of this block. Currently only set but not used in any game logic within the Block class itself.

member.name: F:Block.hasDoneSecondFrame
member.summary: Tracks whether the block has completed its second frame initialization. Set to true in SecondFrame() to prevent duplicate processing.

member.name: F:Block.hiddenBottom
member.summary: Indicates whether the bottom edge visuals are hidden. Set by HideBelow() to hide attached objects on the bottom edge when block is collapsed.

member.name: F:Block.hiddenLeft
member.summary: Indicates whether the left edge visuals are hidden. Set by HideLeft() to hide attached objects on the left edge when block is collapsed.

member.name: F:Block.hiddenRight
member.summary: Indicates whether the right edge visuals are hidden. Set by HideRight() to hide attached objects on the right edge when block is collapsed.

member.name: F:Block.hiddenTop
member.summary: Indicates whether the top edge visuals are hidden. Set by HideAbove() to hide attached objects on the top edge when block is collapsed.

member.name: F:Block.leftEdge
member.summary: Reference to the BlockPiece component representing the left edge visual of this block. Used for edge rendering when adjacent blocks are empty, blood effects application, and visual hiding when needed. Deactivated in HideLeft() and ShowLeftEdge().

member.name: F:Block.leftEdgeBroken
member.summary: GameObject representing the broken left edge visual. Activated by ShowLeftEdge() when the left neighboring block is destroyed and this block remains intact. Hidden during HideSideBrokenEdges() and block initialization.

member.name: F:Block.lowerLeftPixelX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the lower-left pixel in the sprite's texture. Cached from the sprite component's lowerLeftPixel.x value during Start. Used for sprite rendering calculations.

member.name: F:Block.lowerLeftPixelY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the lower-left pixel in the sprite's texture. Cached from the sprite component's lowerLeftPixel.y value during Start. Used for sprite rendering calculations. Defaults to 16.

member.name: F:Block.particleColor1
member.summary: First custom color for collapse particles when dropCustomParticleColor is true. Passed to EffectsController.CreateDirtWhiteParticles().

member.name: F:Block.particleColor2
member.summary: Second custom color for collapse particles when dropCustomParticleColor is true. Passed to EffectsController.CreateDirtWhiteParticles().

member.name: F:Block.rightEdge
member.summary: Reference to the BlockPiece component representing the right edge visual of this block. Used for edge rendering when adjacent blocks are empty, blood effects application, and visual hiding when needed. Deactivated in HideRight() and ShowRightEdge().

member.name: F:Block.rightEdgeBroken
member.summary: GameObject representing the broken right edge visual. Activated by ShowRightEdge() when the right neighboring block is destroyed and this block remains intact. Hidden during HideSideBrokenEdges() and block initialization.

member.name: F:Block.sprite
member.summary: Reference to the SpriteSM component attached to this block. Cached during Start and used for sprite manipulation, offset calculations, and visual updates throughout the block's lifecycle.

member.name: F:Block.spriteOffset
member.summary: The offset vector for the sprite's position relative to the block's transform. Cached from the sprite component's offset during Start. Used to maintain proper sprite positioning.

member.name: F:Block.tilingOffset
member.summary: Random offset value used for texture tiling variations. Set by UseLargePieces to add visual variety to repeated block patterns. Helps prevent obvious tiling in large structures.

member.name: F:Block.topEdge
member.summary: Reference to the BlockPiece component representing the top edge visual of this block. Used for edge rendering and blood effects on the top side.

member.name: F:Block.topEdgeBroken
member.summary: GameObject representing the broken top edge visual. Activated by ShowTopEdge() when neighboring blocks are destroyed and this block remains intact. Hidden during HideSideBrokenEdges() and block initialization.

member.name: F:Block.useLargeMuralPieces
member.summary: Indicates whether this block should use large mural piece prefabs when destroyed. Set by UseLargePieces method during block initialization. Used by derived classes to select appropriate destruction visuals.

member.name: F:Block.useLargeWindowPieces
member.summary: Indicates whether this block should use large window piece prefabs when destroyed. Set by UseLargePieces method during block initialization. Used by derived classes to select appropriate destruction visuals.

member.name: F:Block.waterDrips
member.summary: Particle spawner component for water or slime drip effects beneath the block. Created on demand when ShowWaterDrips or ShowSlimeDrips is called. Positioned 8 units below the block with a random horizontal offset. Has a random delay between 0.5 and 4 seconds.

member.name: M:Block.AddSlime(SlimeGroundCover)
member.summary: Adds a slime ground cover attachment to this block. The slime object is added to the internal slimeCover list but the base implementation doesn't perform any additional processing.
member.param: The SlimeGroundCover object to attach to this block

member.name: M:Block.AddSlime(System.Int32,DirectionEnum)
member.summary: Adds a specified amount of slime to an existing SlimeGroundCover on the specified side of this block. Searches through the slimeCover list for a slime attachment matching the given direction and adds slime to it if found.
member.param: The amount of slime to add to the existing coverage
The side of the block where the slime should be added

member.name: M:Block.Alert
member.summary: Virtual method to alert this block, typically used to trigger AI awareness or environmental reactions. Base implementation is empty. Derived block types can override to implement alert behaviors.

member.name: M:Block.BounceOn
member.summary: Virtual method called when something bounces on this block. Base implementation is empty. Derived block types can override to implement bounce reactions such as visual effects, sounds, or state changes.

member.name: M:Block.GetSlimeXCentre(DirectionEnum)
member.summary: Gets the X coordinate center position for slime placement on this block. Base implementation returns the block's X position regardless of direction. Derived blocks can override to provide direction-specific slime positioning.
member.param: The direction side of the block where slime is placed
member.returns: The X coordinate for slime center position, defaults to block's X position

member.name: M:Block.GetSlimeYCentre(DirectionEnum)
member.summary: Gets the Y coordinate center position for slime placement on this block. Base implementation returns the block's Y position regardless of direction. Derived blocks can override to provide direction-specific slime positioning.
member.param: The direction side of the block where slime is placed
member.returns: The Y coordinate for slime center position, defaults to block's Y position

member.name: M:Block.HasSlime(DirectionEnum)
member.summary: Checks whether this block has slime coverage on the specified side. Searches through the slimeCover list for any SlimeGroundCover attachment with a matching direction.
member.param: The side of the block to check for slime coverage
member.returns: True if slime coverage exists on the specified side, false otherwise

member.name: M:Block.LandOn(System.Single)
member.summary: Virtual method called when something lands on this block with a specified vertical velocity. Base implementation is empty. Derived block types can override to react to landing impacts based on the landing force.
member.param: The vertical velocity of the object landing on this block

member.name: M:Block.SpreadSteppedOnEffects(DirectionEnum,System.Int32)
member.summary: Spreads step effects to neighboring blocks. Default implementation is empty, designed to be overridden by derived classes that want to propagate step effects across multiple blocks.
member.param: The direction to spread the effect.
The current spread distance from the source.

member.name: M:Block.StandingOnBlock(TestVanDammeAnim,System.Single)
member.summary: Called continuously while a unit is standing on this block. Default implementation is empty, designed to be overridden by derived classes for blocks that react to prolonged contact.
