member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(FlickerFader,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a basic FlickerFader effect at the specified 2D position. This is the simplest effect creation method for FlickerFader-based visual effects with default z-depth of 0.
member.param: The FlickerFader effect prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(Puff,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,BloodColor)
member.summary: Creates a scaled Puff effect with optional blood coloring. Supports different blood types (red, green, oil, frozen, quicksand) and allows independent x/y scaling for stretched effects. Returns the created Puff instance for additional customization.
member.param: The Puff effect prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space
The horizontal scale factor (1 for normal, -1 for flipped)
The vertical scale factor
The blood color type to apply (None for no coloring)
member.returns: The created Puff instance for further configuration

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(Puff,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a delayed Puff effect with initial velocity and scaling. The effect appears after the specified delay and moves according to the velocity vector. Useful for timed or physics-based particle effects.
member.param: The Puff effect prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space
The delay in seconds before the effect appears
The horizontal scale factor
The vertical scale factor
The initial velocity vector for the effect

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(FlickerFader,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a delayed FlickerFader effect with initial velocity and scaling. Similar to the Puff version but for FlickerFader-type effects. The effect appears after the delay and moves with the specified velocity.
member.param: The FlickerFader effect prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space
The delay in seconds before the effect appears
The horizontal scale factor
The vertical scale factor
The initial velocity vector for the effect

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(FlickerFader,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a FlickerFader effect at a specific 3D position. Provides full control over the z-depth for layering effects in the scene. Returns the created instance for additional configuration.
member.param: The FlickerFader effect prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space
member.returns: The created FlickerFader instance for further customization

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(FlickerFader,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a FlickerFader effect at the specified position. This is a convenience overload that delegates to the full version with z-coordinate of 0 for standard 2D positioning.
member.param: The FlickerFader prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The delay before the effect starts
The initial velocity vector for the effect
member.returns: The created FlickerFader component

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(FlickerFader,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a FlickerFader effect with full 3D positioning. Instantiates the prefab and configures its delay and velocity settings. FlickerFader effects are used for various fading animations throughout the game.
member.param: The FlickerFader prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space
The delay before the effect starts
The initial velocity vector for the effect
member.returns: The created FlickerFader component

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(DistortionGrow,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a DistortionGrow effect for visual distortion animations. Instantiates the distortion prefab and sets its delay. Used for heat haze, explosion distortions, and other warping visual effects.
member.param: The DistortionGrow prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The delay before the distortion starts
The z-coordinate in world space (default 0)
member.returns: The created DistortionGrow component

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(Puff,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Vector3,BloodColor)
member.summary: Creates a Puff effect with blood color tinting and scale variations. Supports horizontal flipping for xScale parameter values and applies blood coloring. Configures delay and velocity for the puff animation.
member.param: The Puff prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space
The delay before the puff starts (converted to xScale if not 0)
The initial velocity (y component used as yScale if delay is not 0)
The blood color for tinting the effect
member.returns: The created Puff component

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(PuffTwoLayer,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Vector3,BloodColor)
member.summary: Creates a two-layer Puff effect with blood color support. Instantiates the prefab and applies blood coloring to both layers. Used for more complex puff animations with foreground and background elements.
member.param: The PuffTwoLayer prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The delay before the effect starts (interpreted as xScale)
The initial velocity (y component used as yScale)
The blood color for tinting both layers
member.returns: The created PuffTwoLayer component

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(FaderSprite,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a FaderSprite effect at the specified position. Simple instantiation method for fading sprite effects without additional configuration. Used for basic fade-out animations.
member.param: The FaderSprite prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space
member.returns: The created FaderSprite component

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(Puff,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Vector3,Transform)
member.summary: Creates a Puff effect with optional parent transform attachment. Configures scale based on delay parameter and can parent the effect to a moving object. Used for effects that need to follow characters or projectiles.
member.param: The Puff prefab to instantiate
The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space
The delay (used as xScale when not 0)
The velocity (y component used as yScale when delay is not 0)
Optional transform to parent the effect to
member.returns: The created Puff component

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateEffect(PuffLaserBurn,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Vector3)

The x-coordinate in world space
The y-coordinate in world space
The z-coordinate in world space

The initial velocity vector

The y-coordinate where the blood trail originates

The initial y-velocity component

The y-coordinate where the particle appears
The force applied to the floating particle
The initial x-velocity of the particle
The initial y-velocity of the particle

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateFleshParticles(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a complex mix of flesh particle effects for gore and gibbing. Combines multiple particle types: flesh dust dots at 1.4x force, medium flesh chunks at reduced force and offset, and three types of small flesh particles with the third type using 1.1x force. The most detailed gore effect available.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the flesh origin
The y-coordinate of the flesh origin
The total number of particles to distribute among types
The spread radius for particle placement
The base force multiplier for particle velocity
The initial x-velocity added to all particles
The initial y-velocity added to all particles

member.name: M:EffectsController.CreateSlimeParticles(BloodColor,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates clustered slime particles with drift behavior. Complex positioning algorithm with 60% chance to create new cluster and 40% to continue from previous position. Particles drift inward based on force parameter. Creates half the requested count plus one, with 0.1x multiplier on offset radii for tighter clustering.
member.param: The blood color type for the slime
The x-coordinate of the particle origin
The y-coordinate of the particle origin
The base count (actual is count/2 + 1)
The horizontal spread (multiplied by 0.1)
The vertical spread (multiplied by 0.1)
The inward drift force
The initial x-velocity
The initial y-velocity

member.name: M:EffectsController.OnDestroy
member.summary: Unity lifecycle method called when the EffectsController is destroyed. Clears the static instance reference.

member.name: F:EffectsController.groundLayer
member.summary: Static layer mask used for ground collision detection in various effect placement calculations.

member.name: F:EffectsController.tempOffset
member.summary: Protected static temporary Vector3 storage used internally by shrapnel creation methods to calculate random or circular offset positions without allocating new Vector3 objects each time.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.FirstFrame
member.summary: Initializes the falling block on its first frame of existence. Sets up initial physics values, rotation angles, shake timers, and stores the original position and grid coordinates for later reference. This method ensures proper initialization happens only once.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.HideSurroundingDecorations
member.summary: Hides decorative elements on adjacent blocks that would visually conflict with this falling block. Uses raycasting to find blocks above and below, then hides their bottom and top decorations respectively if the hideSurroundingDecorationsAtStart flag is set.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.ResetBlock
member.summary: Resets the falling block to its original state when the level is restarted or reset. Restores position, rotation, visual state, and all physics properties to their initial values. Clears any disturbance or damage states and re-enables the block for normal operation.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SetupBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32,Block,Block)
member.summary: Overrides the base block setup to clear the setupBlockAtStart flag and delegate to base implementation. Ensures that automatic start setup doesn't occur after manual setup has been called.
member.param: The grid row position
The grid column position
Reference to the block above (if any)
Reference to the block below (if any)

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SetupBlockAtStart
member.summary: Performs initial setup for blocks that need special initialization at level start. Updates position from transform, hides surrounding decorations if configured, sets up the block in the map grid, and ensures no duplicate blocks exist at the same position.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.ShouldEnable
member.summary: Determines whether this block should be enabled for updates. Always returns true for falling blocks, ensuring they remain active to process physics and interactions even when off-screen.
member.returns: Always returns true to keep the block active

member.name: M:FallingBlock.Update
member.summary: Main update loop that handles the entire lifecycle of a falling block. Manages shaking animations when disturbed, physics-based falling with acceleration and collision detection, rolling mechanics when pushed, and various environmental interactions like quicksand and wind. Updates position, rotation, and handles state transitions throughout the block's existence.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.DamageInternal(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Processes damage dealt to the falling block, potentially triggering it to fall. Handles different damage thresholds, applies push forces for horizontal impacts, and initiates collapse when health drops below the collapse threshold. Prioritizes falling for strong downward impacts.
member.param: The amount of damage to apply
The horizontal impact force
The vertical impact force

member.name: M:FallingBlock.HitUnits
member.summary: Damages units and doodads beneath the falling block when it's moving fast enough. Applies crushing damage in an area based on the block's velocity, with special handling for destructible doodads that can slow the block's fall.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.bounceDamage
member.summary: Damage dealt to the block itself when it bounces in sandstorm conditions. Only applied when the value is greater than 0, representing wear from repeated impacts during extended bouncing sequences.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.collapseHealthPoint
member.summary: The health threshold below which the block will collapse and be destroyed. When health drops to or below this value (default -15), the block enters its destruction sequence. Negative values allow the block to take some damage before breaking.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.landDamage
member.summary: The amount of crushing damage dealt to blocks beneath when this block lands after falling. Default value of 1 applies minor impact damage to whatever it lands on.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.otherShrpnelPrefab
member.summary: Optional prefab for creating additional shrapnel effects when the block is destroyed. Can be configured to spawn different visual debris for variety.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.shakeAmountOnLand
member.summary: The intensity of camera shake when the block lands or bounces (default 0.2). Higher values create more dramatic impact effects, with the shake centered on the block's position for proper directional feedback.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.Bounce
member.summary: Processes bouncing behavior when the block hits a surface with sufficient velocity. Reverses and dampens velocity based on bounce settings, triggers camera shake, plays sound effects, and handles special physics for sandstorm conditions or very bouncy blocks.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.ClampToBounds(System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Constrains both horizontal and vertical movement to keep the block within valid bounds. Uses raycasting in opposite directions to detect boundaries and adjusts movement deltas to prevent clipping through obstacles on any side.
member.param: Reference to the horizontal offset, modified if bounds are hit
Reference to the vertical offset, modified if bounds are hit

member.name: M:FallingBlock.ClampToCeiling(System.Single@)
member.summary: Constrains upward movement to prevent the falling block from passing through ceilings. Uses raycasting to detect solid obstacles above and adjusts the vertical movement delta to stop at the ceiling surface, accounting for the block's half-height.
member.param: Reference to the vertical movement delta in pixels, modified if a ceiling is hit
member.returns: True if movement was clamped due to ceiling collision, false if no collision occurred

member.name: M:FallingBlock.ClampToGround(System.Single@)
member.summary: Constrains downward movement to prevent the falling block from passing through ground. Uses raycasting to detect solid surfaces below and adjusts the vertical movement delta to stop at the ground surface. Also handles special interactions with AssMouthOrifice objects that can consume the block and sets up parent transform relationships for moving platforms.
member.param: Reference to the vertical movement delta in pixels, modified if ground is hit
member.returns: True if movement was clamped due to ground collision, false if no collision occurred

member.name: M:FallingBlock.ClampToWalls(System.Single@)
member.summary: Constrains horizontal movement to prevent the falling block from passing through walls. Uses raycasting to detect solid obstacles in the direction of movement and adjusts the movement delta to stop at the wall surface, accounting for the block's half-width on each side.
member.param: Reference to the horizontal movement delta in pixels, modified if a wall is hit
member.returns: True if movement was clamped due to wall collision, false if no collision occurred

member.name: M:FallingBlock.ClearBlock
member.summary: Removes this block from the map grid at its current column and row position. Ensures the grid cell is marked as empty so other objects can occupy the space and collision detection works properly.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.FinishRoll(System.Single)
member.summary: Completes the rolling animation and settles the block in its new position. Adjusts the X coordinate based on roll direction, sends network updates if the local player initiated the roll, and triggers the settling process with appropriate offsets.
member.param: The final rotation angle after rolling (typically a multiple of 90 degrees)

member.name: M:FallingBlock.GetExtraFallSpeed
member.summary: Returns additional fall speed to be added to the base maximum fall speed. Virtual method that can be overridden by derived classes to implement variable falling speeds based on block type or environmental conditions.
member.returns: Extra fall speed to add (default is 0)

member.name: M:FallingBlock.Land
member.summary: Handles the landing sequence when a falling block comes to rest on a solid surface. Resets velocities, updates grid position, assigns the block back to the map, applies landing damage to blocks below, and handles special cases like landing in quicksand or transforming into a boulder.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.RollOverRPC(System.Int32)
member.summary: Network-synchronized method that initiates the block rolling animation in response to a push. Sets up the rolling state, calculates pivot points for rotation, and triggers the animation sequence. Automatically clears the block from its current position and prepares it to move to the adjacent grid cell.
member.param: The roll direction - positive (1) for right, negative (-1) for left

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SetPosition(System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the block's visual position with an optional horizontal offset for shake effects. Sets the transform position and applies the offset to the sprite renderer, rounding to pixel-perfect positions for clean visual presentation.
member.param: The horizontal offset to apply for shake animation

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SetRotation
member.summary: Applies the current rotation angle to the block's transform. Updates the Euler angles to match the internal zAngle value, used during rolling and spinning animations.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SetRotation(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets a new rotation angle for the block and immediately applies it to the transform. Used for instant rotation changes without animation.
member.param: The new rotation angle in degrees

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SetSpeed(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Directly sets the velocity of the falling block and immediately triggers it to start falling. Used when external forces need to launch the block with specific speeds, bypassing the normal shaking phase.
member.param: The horizontal velocity to apply
The vertical velocity to apply

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SetVerticalShakePosition(System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the block's visual position with a vertical offset for chain shake effects. Used when the block is attached to chains and shakes vertically rather than horizontally, applying rounded pixel-perfect offsets to the sprite.
member.param: The vertical offset to apply for shake animation

member.name: M:FallingBlock.Settle(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Completes the settling process after a block finishes rolling or falling. Updates the block's position and rotation, checks for solid ground beneath, assigns it back to the map grid if stable, and triggers appropriate sound effects. If no solid ground is found, the block continues falling.
member.param: The new X coordinate for the block's center position
The new Y coordinate for the block's center position
Column offset applied during settling (-1 for left roll, 1 for right roll, 0 for vertical drop)
The final rotation angle to apply to the block

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SettleBlockAfterRoll(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Double,Networking.PID)
member.summary: Network-synchronized settling method called after a block completes its roll animation. Validates the timestamp to prevent out-of-order updates, settles the block at the new position, and clears the pushing player reference if they initiated the roll.
member.param: The new X coordinate for the block
The new Y coordinate for the block
Column offset from the roll direction
The final rotation angle
Network timestamp for synchronization ordering
The player ID who initiated the roll

member.name: M:FallingBlock.StartFalling
member.summary: Initiates the falling state of the block after the shaking phase completes. Clears the block from its grid position, removes any parent transform relationships, hides attached decorations if configured, and triggers surrounding blocks to potentially collapse.

member.name: P:FallingBlock.Rotation
member.summary: Gets the current rotation angle of the block as an integer. Returns the internal zAngle value cast to int for simplified rotation state checking.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.bounceThreshold
member.summary: The minimum downward velocity required for the block to bounce when hitting the ground. When falling slower than this threshold (default -200), the block will bounce instead of landing solidly. Also bypassed when a parachute is active, allowing bouncing at any speed.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.forceRequiredToRoll
member.summary: The accumulated horizontal push force threshold required to initiate rolling (default 0.1). When pushForce exceeds this value in either direction and there's clear space, the block begins its rolling animation. Lower values make blocks easier to push.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.halfHeight
member.summary: Half of the block's pixel height (default 8), calculated from pixelHeight. Used frequently in collision calculations to determine the block's center-to-edge distances.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.maxFallSpeed
member.summary: The maximum downward velocity the block can achieve while falling (default -1200). This terminal velocity caps the acceleration from gravity to prevent excessive speeds. Can be modified by GetExtraFallSpeed() for special block types.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.minSpinAmount
member.summary: The minimum rotation speed maintained while spinning. Prevents the spin from slowing below this threshold, ensuring continuous rotation for blocks configured to spin during their fall.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.parentedToTransform
member.summary: Reference to a moving platform or object this block is resting on. When set, the block follows the transform's movement to stay attached to moving surfaces like elevators or vehicles.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.parentedToTransformLastPosition
member.summary: The previous frame's position of the parent transform. Used to calculate the delta movement each frame and apply it to the block's position, ensuring smooth following of moving platforms.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.pixelHeight
member.summary: The height of the block in pixels (default 16). Used for collision detection, raycasting distances, and determining the block's physical boundaries.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.rollingPivot
member.summary: The world position point around which the block rotates when rolling. Set to the bottom corner of the block in the direction of roll (8 units horizontally from center, 8 units below center). Used as the rotation center for the rolling animation to simulate realistic physics.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.spinAmount
member.summary: The current rotation speed for spinning blocks. Decreases over time and controls how fast the block rotates around its pivot point when shouldSpin is true. Measured in degrees per second.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.startY
member.summary: The original Y coordinate where the block started, stored during initialization. Used to detect if the block has moved significantly from its starting position when checking if it's still stable.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.xFallingSpeed
member.summary: Horizontal acceleration applied while falling. Allows blocks to drift sideways during their fall, though this value is typically 0 for standard falling blocks unless affected by external forces.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.yFallingSpeed
member.summary: Vertical acceleration rate while falling (default -1000). This gravity value is applied each frame to increase downward velocity until maxFallSpeed is reached. Negative values indicate downward acceleration.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.zAngle
member.summary: The current rotation angle of the block in degrees around the Z-axis. Updated continuously during rolling animations and used to set the transform's rotation. Normalized to stay within reasonable ranges by subtracting 360 when exceeding 180 degrees.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.zAngleI
member.summary: The angular velocity in degrees per second for rotation animations. During rolling, this value accelerates from 420 to 1200 degrees/second to create a realistic rolling motion. Positive values rotate counterclockwise, negative values clockwise.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.zAngleTarget
member.summary: The target rotation angle the block is animating towards during rolling. When rolling left, this is increased by 90 degrees; when rolling right, decreased by 90. The animation completes when zAngle reaches this target value.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.zOffset
member.summary: Z-axis position offset applied to the block's transform. Used to adjust rendering depth, particularly when the block enters quicksand (set to 8) to make it appear partially submerged.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.AssignBlockToMap
member.summary: Assigns this falling block to its current grid position in the map. Virtual method that updates the map's block grid to reference this block at its current column and row coordinates.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.CollapseSurroundingBackgroundBlocks
member.summary: Triggers collapse on all background blocks adjacent to this falling block's position. Affects blocks directly above, below, left, and right to create a more dynamic destruction effect.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.CollapseSurroundingBlocksOnFall
member.summary: Comprehensive method that triggers various collapse effects when the block starts falling. Disturbs blocks above, collapses nearby cages and cage bars, triggers background block collapse if enabled, and crumbles adjacent bridges.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.CrumbleBridge(System.Single)
member.summary: Handles crumble effects when this block is part of a bridge structure. If the chance exceeds 0.4, triggers collapse with 80% of the original chance value to create a weakening cascade effect.
member.param: The crumble chance factor (0 to 1)

member.name: M:FallingBlock.CrumbleSurroundingBridges
member.summary: Sends crumble messages to bridge blocks adjacent to this falling block. Uses both raycasting and direct grid lookups to find bridges to the left and right, applying a reduced collapse chance to create a ripple effect.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.DelayedCollapseAbove
member.summary: Handles delayed collapse effects for blocks above this one. Resets the collapse chance to maximum before delegating to the base implementation, ensuring maximum cascade potential.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.InformSurroundingBlocksOfCollapse
member.summary: Notifies surrounding blocks about this block's collapse, unless it's currently in quicksand. Overrides base behavior to prevent cascade effects when sinking in quicksand.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.RollOnToUnits
member.summary: Checks for and damages units in the path of a rolling block. Called during the rolling animation to crush units that would be hit by the rotating block edge.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.StepOn(TestVanDammeAnim)
member.summary: Handles when a unit steps on this block. Stores reference to the stepping unit and triggers the step-on behavior if the unit belongs to the player or is an enemy, and the block isn't already disturbed, invulnerable, or in edit mode.
member.param: The unit that stepped on the block

member.name: M:FallingBlock.StepOn(Grenade)
member.summary: Handles when a grenade lands on this block. Triggers the step-on behavior if the grenade belongs to the player and the block isn't already disturbed, invulnerable, or in edit mode.
member.param: The grenade that landed on the block

member.name: M:FallingBlock.StepOnBlock
member.summary: Standard step-on behavior that extends the shake time before falling. Only triggers if the block is configured to be disturbed by impacts, increasing shake duration by 42.5% to give players more warning time.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.StepOnBlockForced
member.summary: Forced step-on behavior that bypasses invulnerability. Clears invulnerable state, extends shake time by 42.5%, and always triggers disturbance through network synchronization.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.StepOnBlockImmediate
member.summary: Immediate step-on behavior that triggers instant falling. Clears invulnerability and sets shake time to zero, causing the block to skip the warning phase and fall immediately.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.SupportedByDoodad(Doodad)
member.summary: Handles special support relationships when this block is held up by a doodad. Specifically checks for chain doodads and stores a reference for chain-specific shaking behavior when disturbed.
member.param: The doodad providing support to this block

member.name: F:FallingBlock.chainAttachmentSupport
member.summary: Reference to a chain doodad that's supporting this block. When set, the block exhibits special shaking behavior (vertical instead of horizontal) and can pull on the chain when disturbed before falling.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.collapseBackgroundBlocks
member.summary: Controls whether background layer blocks are affected when this block falls (default true). When enabled, background blocks at and around the falling block's position will also collapse, creating more thorough destruction.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.AboutToHitFloor
member.summary: Checks if the block is within 1 unit of hitting the floor below. Uses downward raycasting to detect imminent ground collision, used for preemptive collision handling.
member.returns: True if ground is detected within 1 unit below

member.name: M:FallingBlock.AboutToHitWall
member.summary: Checks if the block is within 1 unit of hitting a wall on either side. Uses raycasting left and right to detect imminent wall collisions, primarily used for very bouncy blocks to preemptively stop movement.
member.returns: True if a wall is detected within 1 unit to the left or right

member.name: M:FallingBlock.Collapse(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Initiates or updates the collapse sequence for the block. If the block still has health above the collapse threshold, it becomes disturbed (starts shaking). Otherwise, delegates to the base collapse behavior to destroy the block.
member.param: The horizontal force of the collapse trigger
The vertical force of the collapse trigger
The probability factor for collapse (lower values are stored as higher priority)

member.name: M:FallingBlock.CollapseForced(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Forces the block to collapse immediately, bypassing normal health checks. Delegates directly to the base implementation for immediate destruction.
member.param: The horizontal force of the collapse
The vertical force of the collapse
The collapse chance factor

member.name: M:FallingBlock.DestroyBlockInternal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal method that handles the actual destruction of the block. Ensures surrounding blocks are notified to potentially collapse if this is the first destruction call and the parameter allows it.
member.param: Whether to trigger collapse checks on surrounding blocks

member.name: M:FallingBlock.Disturb
member.summary: Triggers the block to enter a disturbed state and begin shaking before falling. Checks various conditions including invulnerability and support status. If supported by chains, triggers chain shaking instead. Plays effort sounds and initiates the shake-to-fall sequence.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.IsBelowBlockSolid
member.summary: Determines if there's a solid, stable block directly below this one. Uses raycasting to find blocks below and verifies they are enabled, not falling, not rolling, and not ladder-type blocks. Also checks for solid falling doodads.
member.returns: True if a solid, stable block exists below

member.name: M:FallingBlock.IsSolid
member.summary: Indicates whether this block acts as a solid obstacle for movement and collision. Always returns false for falling blocks, allowing units to pass through them (though they may take damage).
member.returns: Always returns false as falling blocks are not solid obstacles

member.name: M:FallingBlock.NotBroken
member.summary: Checks if the block is still in a stable, unbroken state. Returns true if the block hasn't been disturbed, is still supported by a solid block below, hasn't moved significantly from its starting position, and hasn't been destroyed.
member.returns: True if the block is stable and unbroken, false otherwise

member.name: M:FallingBlock.NotRolling
member.summary: Checks if the block is currently in a stable state and not rolling in either direction. Used to determine if the block can accept new interactions or forces.
member.returns: True if not rolling left or right, false if currently rolling

member.name: M:FallingBlock.Push(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies horizontal push force to potentially make the block roll sideways. Accumulates force over time and triggers rolling when the threshold is exceeded, checking for clear space and ability to roll onto units in the target direction.
member.param: The normalized horizontal force to apply (positive for right, negative for left)
member.returns: True if the push triggered a roll, false otherwise

member.name: M:FallingBlock.RollOver(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initiates the rolling animation in the specified direction. Clears parent transform relationships and triggers network synchronization if not already being pushed by a player.
member.param: The roll direction (1 for right, -1 for left)

member.name: M:FallingBlock.Rotate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantly rotates the block by 90-degree increments in the specified direction. Updates both the current angle and target angle, then applies the rotation to the transform.
member.param: The number of 90-degree rotations to apply (positive for counterclockwise)

member.name: P:FallingBlock.beingPushedByPlayerTimeStamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the network timestamp when a player started pushing this block to roll. Used for synchronization to ensure proper ordering of roll commands and prevent conflicts when multiple players interact with the same block. Set to double.PositiveInfinity when no player is pushing.

member.name: P:FallingBlock.lastSettleTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the network timestamp of when this block last settled after rolling. Used to track the most recent settle operation and prevent out-of-order network updates from reverting the block to previous positions.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.becomeBoulderOnLand
member.summary: Transforms this falling block into a boulder doodad upon landing. When true, the block is destroyed and replaced with a BoulderBlock at the landing position, already in a disturbed (rolling) state.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.beingPushedByPlayer
member.summary: Network player ID of the player currently pushing this block to roll. Used for network synchronization to ensure the pushing player has authority over the roll action and its completion.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.bounceOffWalls
member.summary: Determines whether the block bounces horizontally when hitting walls. When true, horizontal velocity is reversed and dampened on wall impact. When false, the block stops immediately on wall contact.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.chainShakeTime
member.summary: Separate shake timer used when the block is supported by chains. Creates a vertical shaking effect instead of horizontal, with a shorter duration than normal shaking.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.disturbedByImpact
member.summary: Determines whether this block responds to being stepped on or hit (default true). When false, the block ignores step-on events and won't start shaking from impacts, useful for blocks that should only fall from direct damage.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.hasCollapsedSurroundingBlocks
member.summary: Flag preventing multiple collapse cascade triggers. Set to true after the first collapse of surrounding blocks to ensure the cascade effect only happens once per fall event, preventing infinite collapse loops.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.hideSurroundingDecorationsAtStart
member.summary: Configuration flag that determines whether decorations on adjacent blocks should be hidden during setup. When true, removes visual decorations from blocks above and below to prevent clipping or visual conflicts.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.invulnerable
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the block is currently immune to being disturbed (default true). Prevents the block from shaking or falling due to damage or impacts while active, typically set during initialization.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.invulnerableTime
member.summary: Duration in seconds that the block remains invulnerable to disturbance after certain events (default 0.5). Countdown timer that prevents the block from being triggered immediately after spawning or resetting.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.isInQuicksand
member.summary: Tracks whether the block is currently falling through quicksand. Used to prevent duplicate splash effects and modify physics behavior while in quicksand, including reduced fall speed and special visual effects.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.looseXVelocityOnBounce
member.summary: Controls whether horizontal velocity is reduced when bouncing off the ground. When true, the block loses sideways momentum on each bounce, eventually falling straight down. Particularly relevant for veryBouncy blocks.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.originalCollumn
member.summary: The block's starting grid column position, stored during initialization. Used to restore the block to its original location when the level is reset or restarted.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.originalRow
member.summary: The block's starting grid row position, stored during initialization. Used alongside originalCollumn to restore the block's position during reset operations.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.originalShakeTime
member.summary: The initial shake duration value (default 0.5), stored during initialization. Used to reset shakeTime to its original value and to calculate extended shake times when stepped on.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.rollingLeft
member.summary: Flag indicating the block is currently rolling to the left. When true, the block is in the middle of a 90-degree counterclockwise rotation animation moving one grid space left. Mutually exclusive with rollingRight.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.rollingRight
member.summary: Flag indicating the block is currently rolling to the right. When true, the block is in the middle of a 90-degree clockwise rotation animation moving one grid space right. Mutually exclusive with rollingLeft.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.setupBlockAtStart
member.summary: Flag indicating whether this block needs special setup when the level starts. When true, triggers SetupBlockAtStart() during the first Update() call to handle positioning and decoration hiding.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.shakeCounter
member.summary: Running counter that tracks shake animation progress. Incremented each frame during shaking and used with sine functions to create the visual shake effect before falling.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.shakeTime
member.summary: The duration in seconds that the block shakes before starting to fall (default 0.5). When disturbed, this countdown begins and the block falls when it reaches zero.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.shouldHideAttatchments
member.summary: Determines whether decorative attachments above the block should be hidden when it starts falling (default true). Prevents visual glitches with attached decorations that would otherwise float in the air.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.shouldSpin
member.summary: Enables rotation animation while the block is falling. When true, the block spins around its center based on spinAmount and movement direction, creating a tumbling effect during the fall.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.snapToMap
member.summary: Forces the block to align precisely to the grid after settling. When true, the block's position is snapped to exact grid coordinates (multiples of 16) at the end of each update, ensuring pixel-perfect alignment.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.steppedOnBy
member.summary: Stores a reference to the unit that most recently stepped on this block. Set when a unit triggers the StepOn method, allowing the block to track which specific unit caused it to potentially fall. Used for attribution of the falling trigger.

member.name: F:FallingBlock.veryBouncy
member.summary: Special physics mode for blocks that bounce multiple times before settling. When true, applies different velocity calculations, maintains momentum longer, and allows repeated bouncing with reduced damping compared to normal blocks.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.CalculateAboveBlock
member.summary: Uses raycasting to find and cache a reference to the block directly above this one. Used to trigger cascade effects when this block falls or is destroyed.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.ClearBlockOnRoll
member.summary: Handles cleanup when a block starts rolling, including repositioning oil pools to the new location. Clears the block from its current grid position, updates oil pool positions if present, and triggers collapse on any blocks directly above.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.PlayEffortSound
member.summary: Plays the straining/effort sound effect when the block is disturbed or shaking. Uses the configured effort sounds from the sound holder at 30% volume with 3D positioning.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.PlayHitSound
member.summary: Plays the impact sound effect when the block hits a surface. Uses the configured hit sounds from the sound holder at 30% volume with 3D positioning.

member.name: M:FallingBlock.PlaySplashSound
member.summary: Plays the splash sound effect when the block enters quicksand or liquid. Uses the configured splash gunk sound from the sound holder at 50% volume with 3D positioning.

member.name: M:GameModeController.Awake
member.summary: Unity Awake lifecycle method that initializes the GameModeController singleton, sets up player arrays, and configures initial game mode settings.

member.name: M:GameModeController.Start
member.summary: Unity Start lifecycle method that resets level state, adds mode-specific components (like RaceModeController), and clears deathmatch statistics.

member.name: M:GameModeController.Update
member.summary: Unity Update lifecycle method that handles exhibition mode timeout, monitors level completion conditions, manages victory timers, and processes input for debug commands.

member.name: F:GameModeController.forcePlayLevel
member.summary: Forces the level to play normally even if level editor is active. Used for testing levels in editor mode.

member.name: F:GameModeController.instance
member.summary: Singleton instance of the GameModeController. Provides global access to game mode management.

member.name: F:GameModeController.lastInputTimer
member.summary: Timer tracking seconds since last player input in exhibition mode. Increments each frame and resets on any key press. When exceeding 150 seconds, automatically returns to join screen for exhibition builds.

member.name: F:GameModeController.levelEditor
member.summary: Reference to the LevelEditorGUI component for managing level editing functionality.

member.name: F:GameModeController.maxPlayersJoined
member.summary: Tracks the maximum number of players that have joined the current level. Used to determine if match should end when all players are eliminated in death match modes. Prevents immediate match end if only one player ever joined.

member.name: M:GameModeController.GetLevelResult
member.summary: Gets the final result of the current level.
member.returns: The level result (Success, Fail, ForcedFail, or Unknown if level is not finished or instance is null).

member.name: M:GameModeController.IsHelicopterVictory
member.summary: Determines if the level ended with a helicopter victory (players successfully evacuated).
member.returns: True if the level is finished and at least one player made it to the helicopter, false otherwise.

member.name: M:GameModeController.IsInHardMode
member.summary: Determines if the game is currently in Hard Mode based on campaign type and game state.
member.returns: True if the game is in hard mode, false otherwise. Hard mode can be enabled through world map campaign settings, custom campaign options, or forced by map data.

member.name: M:GameModeController.IsLevelFinished
member.summary: Checks if the current level has been completed.
member.returns: True if the level is finished (victory or defeat has been determined), false if the level is still in progress.

member.name: M:GameModeController.ShowStandardHUDS
member.summary: Determines whether standard HUD elements should be displayed based on the current game mode.
member.returns: True if standard HUD should be shown (Campaign mode without brutality scoring), false for competitive modes or when showing brutality score.

member.name: P:GameModeController.AllowPlayerDropIn
member.summary: Indicates whether players can join mid-game in the current game mode and conditions.

member.name: P:GameModeController.GameMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the current game mode.

member.name: P:GameModeController.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of GameModeController.

member.name: P:GameModeController.IsDeathMatchMode
member.summary: Gets whether the current game mode is Deathmatch.

member.name: P:GameModeController.IsHardcoreMode
member.summary: Gets whether the game is in Hardcore mode (permadeath campaign mode).

member.name: P:GameModeController.SpawnBeforeCountdown
member.summary: Determines whether players should spawn before the countdown starts based on the current game mode.

member.name: P:GameModeController.deathMatchLives
member.summary: Gets the number of lives each player has in Deathmatch mode.

member.name: F:GameModeController.broPlayer
member.summary: In Suicide Horde mode, indicates which player is currently playing as the Bro (cycles through players).

member.name: F:GameModeController.campaignBeforeBrodown
member.summary: Stores the campaign reference that was active before entering a Bro-down, used to restore campaign context after tiebreaker.

member.name: F:GameModeController.cheatsEnabled
member.summary: Static flag indicating whether cheat functionality is enabled. When true, allows debug commands and special key combinations. Always returns true when running in Unity editor regardless of this field's value.

member.name: F:GameModeController.deathmatchHero
member.summary: Stores the hero type selection for each player in Deathmatch mode. Initialized with HeroType.None for all 4 players.

member.name: F:GameModeController.forceDraw
member.summary: Forces a draw/tie outcome during match end determination. When true, forces the match to end in a tie regardless of actual player performance. Used for debugging or special scenarios where a draw result is required.

member.name: F:GameModeController.forceRestartOnDeathInHardcoreThisLevel
member.summary: Forces a level restart on death in Hardcore mode for this specific level. Used by boss fights like Satan that require full restart.

member.name: F:GameModeController.gameModeBeforeBrodown
member.summary: Stores the game mode that was active before entering a Bro-down tiebreaker, used to restore proper mode after tiebreaker.

member.name: F:GameModeController.isPlayerDoingBrodown
member.summary: Tracks which players are participating in a Bro-down tiebreaker round. Used when matches end in a draw.

member.name: F:GameModeController.levelNumBeforeBrodown
member.summary: Stores the level number that was active before entering a Bro-down, used to restore level progression after tiebreaker.

member.name: F:GameModeController.publishRun
member.summary: Indicates whether the current campaign run is for publishing. When true, the game treats successful completion differently, redirecting back to level editor instead of normal victory screens. Used when testing custom campaigns before publishing.

member.name: F:GameModeController.switchSilently
member.summary: Controls whether level transitions display the level over screen. When true, suppresses the normal level completion UI and switches levels immediately. Used for seamless transitions during cutscenes or special sequences.

member.name: M:GameModeController.FinishCampaignFromCutscene(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Completes the current campaign from a cutscene, determining the appropriate next scene based on campaign type.
member.param: If true, forces return to world map regardless of campaign type
member.returns: The name of the scene to load next
member.remarks: Called when campaigns end via cutscenes. If returning to world map or forceWorldMap is true, finishes the campaign progress and returns the world map scene. Otherwise, returns the victory scene and resets arcade progress. Also saves player progress after completion.

member.name: M:GameModeController.HasEveryBodyVotedToSkip
member.summary: Checks if all active players have voted to skip the current level.
member.returns: True if all playing players have voted to skip, false if any active player hasn't voted or no players are active.

member.name: M:GameModeController.InSwitchingScenesPhase
member.summary: Checks if the game is currently in the process of switching between levels or scenes.
member.returns: True if currently switching levels, false otherwise
member.remarks: Used by other systems to prevent actions during level transitions. The switchingLevel flag is set when DetermineLevelOutcome is called and cleared when the new level loads.

member.name: M:GameModeController.LevelFinish(LevelResult)
member.summary: Initiates the level finish sequence with the specified result.
member.param: The result of the level (Success, Fail, ForcedFail, or Unknown).

member.name: M:GameModeController.LevelFinishRPC(System.Int32,LevelResult)
member.summary: RPC method that finalizes the level completion across all clients.
member.param: The level number that finished (used to verify synchronization).
The result of the level.

member.name: M:GameModeController.LoadNextScene(GameState)
member.summary: Loads the next scene immediately without transition effects. Used for quick scene changes.
member.param: The GameState object containing scene and game configuration to apply
member.remarks: Marked with [AllowedRPC] for network synchronization. Calls LoadSceneCore for the loading logic but loads the level directly without fade effects. Used when immediate transitions are needed.

member.name: M:GameModeController.LoadNextSceneFade(GameState)
member.summary: Loads the next scene with a fade transition effect. Used for smooth scene transitions.
member.param: The GameState object containing scene and game configuration to apply
member.remarks: Marked with [AllowedRPC] for network synchronization. Calls LoadSceneCore to handle the actual loading logic, then triggers a fade-to-black transition for visual smoothness. Commonly used for campaign level transitions and returning to menus.

member.name: M:GameModeController.MakeFinishInstant
member.summary: Forces the level to finish immediately by setting the win timer to near zero.

member.name: M:GameModeController.OnDisable
member.summary: Unity callback when the component is disabled. Currently empty but provides hook for cleanup operations.

member.name: M:GameModeController.RequestHostRestartLevel
member.summary: Handles client requests to restart the level. Called via RPC when non-host players request a restart.
member.remarks: This method is marked with [AllowedRPC] to permit network calls. Sets the next scene to the current active scene and initiates the level switch process. Only the host can execute the actual restart.

member.name: M:GameModeController.RestartLevel
member.summary: Restarts the current level by reloading the active scene. Handles host/client logic for multiplayer compatibility.
member.remarks: If the player is the host, immediately switches to the current scene and clears persistent blocks if enabled. If the player is a client, sends an RPC request to the host to restart the level and displays a chat message. This is commonly used by the pause menu restart option and when players fail in certain conditions.

member.name: M:GameModeController.ReturnToWorldMap
member.summary: Initiates a return to the world map scene, saving the scene transition in game state.

member.name: M:GameModeController.SendReady
member.summary: Sends a ready signal from the local player to all other players, used for vote-to-skip functionality.

member.name: M:GameModeController.SetSwitchDelay(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the delay before switching to the next level, allowing UI elements time to display.
member.param: The delay in seconds before the level switch occurs
member.remarks: Used by various game systems to control transition timing. Common values are 1.5-5 seconds depending on what needs to be shown (victory screens, score displays, etc.).

member.name: M:GameModeController.SwitchLevel
member.summary: Switches to the next level or scene, handling all necessary game state updates and synchronization.
member.remarks: Only executed by the host. Performs the following operations: - Stops all controller rumble effects - Updates GameState with new session ID, random seed, campaign info, and level number - Sends the new game state to all other players via RPC - Loads the next scene (stored in nextScene field) - Resets level-specific variables for the new level This is the primary method for transitioning between levels in all game modes.

member.name: M:GameModeController.VoteToSkipRPC(PID)
member.summary: RPC method that registers a player's vote to skip the level.
member.param: The PID of the player voting to skip.

member.name: P:GameModeController.CheatsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cheat codes are enabled. Always returns true in the Unity editor.
member.remarks: Controls access to debug features like instant level completion (Ctrl+F11) and forced draws (Ctrl+F8). Automatically enabled in the Unity editor for testing purposes.

member.name: P:GameModeController.LevelFinished
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the current level has been completed. Used to track level completion state.
member.remarks: This property is checked by many systems to determine if gameplay should continue or if transition sequences should begin. Set to true when victory/defeat conditions are met.

member.name: F:GameModeController.deathMatchRewardCounter
member.summary: Timer controlling ammo box spawn frequency during death match reward phase. Increments each frame and spawns an ammo box every 2 seconds, then decrements by 3.5 to create periodic spawning. Only active when deathMatchRewarded is true.

member.name: F:GameModeController.deathMatchRewarded
member.summary: Indicates whether the death match winner is currently receiving reward ammo boxes. When true, periodically spawns ammo boxes from the top of the screen. Becomes false when the winning player dies.

member.name: F:GameModeController.deathMatchWinnerPlayerNum
member.summary: Player number (0-3) of the death match winner during reward phase. Set to -1 when no winner is determined. Used to check if winner is still alive to continue receiving rewards.

member.name: F:GameModeController.nextScene
member.summary: The name of the next scene to load when transitioning levels. Empty string by default.

member.name: F:GameModeController.playersVotedToSkip
member.summary: Tracks which players have voted to skip the current level results screen. Reset on each level.

member.name: F:GameModeController.resetWinsOnLevelSwitch
member.summary: Controls whether player round wins are reset when switching levels. When true, calls ResetPlayerRoundWins() before switching to the next level. Used to start fresh scoring in new matches.

member.name: F:GameModeController.stillNeedToReady
member.summary: Array tracking which players (0-3) still need to ready up before level transition. Set for all playing players when waiting for ready state. Players signal ready through vote-to-skip mechanism, clearing their flag.

member.name: F:GameModeController.switchLevelDelay
member.summary: Time delay in seconds before switching to the next level. Defaults to 1.5 seconds.

member.name: F:GameModeController.switchingLevel
member.summary: Indicates whether the game is currently in the process of switching levels/scenes.

member.name: F:GameModeController.waitingForAllPlayersToReady
member.summary: Indicates whether the game is waiting for all players to ready before switching levels. When true, level transition is delayed until all players in stillNeedToReady array have signaled ready.

member.name: M:GameModeController.AddPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a round win point to the specified player's score.
member.param: The player number (0-3) to award a point to
member.remarks: Increments the player's round win counter. Used in competitive modes to track match progress toward overall victory conditions.

member.name: M:GameModeController.DoesPlayerNumDamage(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if damage should be applied between two player numbers based on the current game mode.
member.param: The player number dealing damage (negative values for enemies/environment)
The player number receiving damage (negative values for enemies/environment)
member.returns: True if damage should be applied, false if it should be prevented
member.remarks: Implements friendly fire rules per game mode: - Campaign/ExplosionRun/Race: No friendly fire between players (0-3), enemies (-1) damage players - DeathMatch/BroDown/SuicideHorde: Full friendly fire enabled between all players - Special case: -2 and -1 can damage each other (enemy vs enemy) - Values below -5 represent special damage sources that affect their designated targets Critical for implementing proper damage rules in different game modes.

member.name: M:GameModeController.GetBrodownBroCount
member.summary: Gets the number of players currently participating in a Brodown tiebreaker round.
member.returns: The count of players marked for Brodown participation
member.remarks: Iterates through the isPlayerDoingBrodown array to count active participants. Used to set up Brodown rounds when ties occur in competitive modes. Players who tied in the previous round are marked for participation.

member.name: M:GameModeController.GetExplosionRunFailM
member.summary: Calculates the failure rate in Explosion Run mode as a ratio of fails to total attempts.
member.returns: The failure rate as a decimal (0.0 to 1.0), or 0 if no attempts
member.remarks: Divides total failures by total attempts to provide a failure percentage. Used for difficulty scaling and statistics tracking. Returns 0 if no attempts have been made to avoid division by zero.

member.name: M:GameModeController.GetExplosionRunLevelFails
member.summary: Gets the number of consecutive failures in the current Explosion Run session.
member.returns: The count of recent consecutive failures
member.remarks: Tracks recent performance for difficulty adjustment. Reset to 0 on successful completion. High failure counts may trigger encouragement messages or difficulty adjustments.

member.name: M:GameModeController.GetExplosionRunTotalAttempts
member.summary: Gets the total number of Explosion Run attempts in the current session.
member.returns: The total attempt count as an integer
member.remarks: Incremented each time an Explosion Run level starts. Used for statistics and calculating failure rates. Persists across level attempts within a session.

member.name: M:GameModeController.GetExplosionRunWinsInARow
member.summary: Gets the current win streak in Explosion Run mode.
member.returns: The number of consecutive Explosion Run victories
member.remarks: Tracks momentum in Explosion Run mode. Reset to 0 on any failure. Used for special announcements and achievements when players maintain winning streaks.

member.name: M:GameModeController.GetPlayerRoundWins(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the number of round wins for a specific player.
member.param: The player number (0-3).
member.returns: The number of rounds won by the player, or 0 if invalid player number.

member.name: M:GameModeController.GetWinnerNum
member.summary: Gets the player number of the current deathmatch round winner.
member.returns: The winning player number (0-3), or -1 if no winner
member.remarks: Set when a deathmatch round ends with a clear winner. Used during the reward phase to identify who should receive visual feedback and score updates.

member.name: M:GameModeController.IsMatchLeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if a player is currently leading the match in round wins.
member.param: The player number (0-3) to check.
member.returns: True if the player has the most round wins (or is tied for most), false otherwise.

member.name: M:GameModeController.ResetPlayerRoundWins
member.summary: Resets all players' round win counts to zero.

member.name: M:GameModeController.ResetPlayerRoundWins(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resets a specific player's round win count to zero.
member.param: The player number (0-3) to reset.

member.name: M:GameModeController.SetupIntroActions
member.summary: Sets up countdown timers and intro sequences based on the current game mode.
member.remarks: Adds appropriate countdown actions via TriggerManager: - ExplosionRun: 2-second offset if not in level editor - DeathMatch/Race/BroDown: Standard countdown with no offset - SuicideHorde: Immediate countdown start Called during level initialization to ensure proper intro timing for each mode.

member.name: F:GameModeController.campaignLevelFailCount
member.summary: Tracks consecutive failures on the current campaign level. Used to trigger celebration on eventual success after multiple failures.

member.name: F:GameModeController.explosionRunFailCount
member.summary: Static counter tracking consecutive failures in Explosion Run mode for the current level. Increments on failure, resets to 0 on success. Used to calculate fail rate statistics.

member.name: F:GameModeController.explosionRunFailTotalFails
member.summary: Static counter tracking total Explosion Run failures across all sessions. Increments by 1 for each failure. Multiplied by 0.8 when attempts over 4 to decay old data. Used with explosionRunTotalAttempts to calculate fail rate.

member.name: F:GameModeController.explosionRunTotalAttempts
member.summary: Static counter tracking total Explosion Run attempts across all sessions. Increments by 1 for each attempt. Multiplied by 0.8 when over 4 attempts to decay old data. Used to calculate overall success/fail ratio.

member.name: F:GameModeController.explosionRunWinsInARow
member.summary: Static counter tracking consecutive Explosion Run victories. Increments on win, resets to 0 on failure. Displayed to players when reaching streaks of 3 or more wins.

member.name: F:GameModeController.lastPlayerToWin
member.summary: The player number (0-3) of the last player to win a round. -1 if no winner yet.

member.name: F:GameModeController.playerRoundWins
member.summary: Array tracking the number of round wins for each player in multi-round game modes.

member.name: M:GameModeController.DetermineLevelOutcome
member.summary: Determines what happens after level completion based on game mode, player performance, and level results.
member.remarks: This is the core method that decides post-level flow: - For Campaign: Handles success/failure, checkpoint logic, mission screens, and campaign completion - For ExplosionRun/Race: Manages round wins, ties, and transitions to Brodown for ties - For DeathMatch: Calculates winner based on kills minus suicides, handles ties with Brodown - For BroDown: Returns to previous game mode with winner determination - For SuicideHorde: Restarts with random level selection Sets the next scene, switch delay, and handles all mode-specific victory/defeat logic.

member.name: M:GameModeController.InRewardPhase
member.summary: Checks if the game is currently in the deathmatch reward phase where ammo boxes drop from the sky.
member.returns: True if in the reward phase, false otherwise
member.remarks: During this phase in deathmatch, ammo boxes periodically spawn and fall from above as a reward for the round winner. Used to trigger special visual effects and prevent premature level transitions.

member.name: M:GameModeController.LoadSceneCore(GameState)
member.summary: Core scene loading logic shared by LoadNextScene and LoadNextSceneFade. Handles game state setup.
member.param: The GameState to apply before loading
member.remarks: Performs essential pre-load operations: - Runs garbage collection in editor builds - Clears join-through-friend-invite flag - Hides overlay messages - Clears map data - Applies the new game state - Resets time scale to 1 - Manages persistent blocks for optimization - Handles instant fade for certain transitions This centralized method ensures consistent state management across all scene loads.

member.name: M:GameModeController.ReceiveStatsFromMaster(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Receives and applies synchronized statistics data from the host player.
member.param: Serialized statistics data from the host
member.remarks: Marked with [AllowedRPC] for network calls. Deserializes the received stats data and applies it to the local StatisticsController. Ensures all players have consistent statistics for score screens and progression tracking.

member.name: M:GameModeController.ResetForNextLevel
member.summary: Resets internal timers and flags in preparation for the next level.

member.name: M:GameModeController.SyncStats
member.summary: Synchronizes statistics from the host to all other players in multiplayer sessions.
member.remarks: Serializes the current statistics data and sends it to all other players via RPC. Called when the level finishes to ensure all players have consistent stat tracking. Only executed by the host to maintain authoritative stat management.

member.name: M:GameModeController.WaitForAllPlayersToReadyBeforeSwitch
member.summary: Initiates waiting for all players to ready up before switching levels in multiplayer modes.
member.remarks: Sets waitingForAllPlayersToReady flag and marks all currently playing players as needing to ready. Used in competitive modes (DeathMatch, Race) to ensure all players are prepared for the next round. The Update method monitors the stillNeedToReady array until all players are ready.

member.name: F:GameModeController.lastDebugLivesTime
member.summary: Unused timer field likely intended for debug display of player lives. Currently not referenced anywhere in the codebase.

member.name: F:GameModeController.levelFinished
member.summary: Indicates whether the current level has been completed (win/loss determined).

member.name: F:GameModeController.levelHasStarted
member.summary: Tracks whether the current level has officially started gameplay (after countdown and initial setup).

member.name: F:GameModeController.levelResult
member.summary: The outcome of the current level (Success, Fail, ForcedFail, or Unknown).

member.name: F:GameModeController.levelStartCounter
member.summary: Countdown timer at level start before gameplay begins. Defaults to 2 seconds.

member.name: F:GameModeController.winTimer
member.summary: Countdown timer after level completion before transitioning to next scene. Defaults to 2 seconds.

member.name: P:GameState.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of the GameState class, creating it if it doesn't exist. This singleton manages persistent game state across all scenes.

member.name: P:GameState.sessionID
member.summary: Gets or sets the current network session ID. Used to maintain session continuity across scene transitions in multiplayer games.

member.name: F:GameState.instance
member.summary: Private static field holding the singleton instance of GameState. Accessed through the Instance property.

member.name: F:GameState.sessionID2
member.summary: Private backing field for the sessionID property. Stores the network session identifier. Defaults to byte.MaxValue.

member.name: P:GameState.campaignName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the current campaign being played. Used to track which campaign the player is in across level transitions.

member.name: F:GameState._campaignName
member.summary: Public backing field for the campaignName property. Stores the current campaign name.

member.name: F:GameState.customLevelID
member.summary: The unique identifier for custom levels. Used when loading user-created content from Steam Workshop or Playtomic.

member.name: F:GameState.levelNumber
member.summary: The current level number within the campaign. Used to track progression and determine which level to load.

member.name: F:GameState.loadCustomCampaign
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the game should load a custom campaign (user-created content) rather than built-in campaigns.

member.name: M:GameState.Apply
member.summary: Applies the current GameState values to their respective game systems. Sets the static instance, updates network session ID, level editor state, checkpoint data, and other persistent values. Called after loading to restore game state.

member.name: M:GameState.ClearSuperCheckPointStatus
member.summary: Clears all super checkpoint related data, resetting the load offsets and checkpoint position. Called when starting fresh or when checkpoint data should be discarded.

member.name: M:GameState.FullRefresh
member.summary: Performs a complete refresh of the GameState by pulling current values from various game systems. Updates session ID, scene name, level editor status, publish run data, and checkpoint information. Used before scene transitions to ensure state consistency.

member.name: M:GameState.PickRandomSeed
member.summary: Generates a new random seed based on the current time's millisecond value. Called during GameState construction and when a new random seed is needed.

member.name: M:GameState.ResetToDefault
member.summary: Resets all GameState values to their default states. This includes clearing scene data, campaign info, game modes, level editor status, and checkpoint data. Commonly called when returning to main menu or starting a new game session.

member.name: M:GameState.SelectiveRefresh
member.summary: Performs a selective refresh of the GameState, updating only session ID, scene name, level editor status, and publish run data. Does not update checkpoint-related data. Used for lighter state updates.

member.name: M:GameState.ToString
member.summary: Returns a formatted string representation of all GameState values for debugging purposes. Includes scene info, campaign data, session details, game modes, checkpoint status, and other state information.
member.returns: A multi-line string containing all GameState values formatted for debug output.

member.name: M:GameState.FadeToNextScene(System.String)
member.summary: Initiates a fade transition to the next scene. Blocks input during the fade, sets up the scene to load, and triggers the fade effect. Disables audio low pass filter for the transition.
member.param: Optional scene name to load. If empty, uses the scene stored in GameState.sceneToLoad.

member.name: M:GameState.GoBackToFreshMainMenuFromAnywhere
member.summary: Attempts to return to the main menu from any game screen or state. Handles different scenarios including being in menus, world map, hero select, or during loading. Returns false if unable to determine current state.
member.returns: True if successfully initiated return to main menu, false if current state couldn't be determined.

member.name: M:GameState.LoadLevel(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the specified level or scene, handling all necessary setup including network handshakes, scene type detection, and custom campaign loading. This is the main method for transitioning between game scenes.
member.param: Optional scene name to load. If empty, uses the scene stored in GameState.sceneToLoad.

member.name: M:GameState.OnCustomLevelLoad(Campaign)
member.summary: Callback method invoked when a custom level finishes loading from Playtomic. Sets the loaded campaign as current and initiates the scene transition.
member.param: The campaign data that was loaded from the online service.

member.name: P:GameState.sceneToLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the scene that should be loaded next. This property is used to coordinate scene transitions throughout the game.

member.name: F:GameState._blockInputForFade
member.summary: Tracks whether input was blocked specifically for scene fade transitions. Used to properly restore input state after fade operations complete.

member.name: F:GameState._sceneToLoad
member.summary: Private backing field for the sceneToLoad property. Stores the name of the next scene to load.

member.name: F:GameState.gameMode
member.summary: The current game mode (Campaign, ExplosionRun, DeathMatch, BroDown, SuicideHorde, Cutscene, Race, or NotSet). Determines gameplay rules and objectives for the current session.

member.name: F:GameState.levelEditorActive
member.summary: Indicates whether the level editor is currently active. Synchronized with LevelEditorGUI.levelEditorActive during state refresh operations.

member.name: F:GameState.loadMode

member.name: F:GameState.publishRun

member.name: F:GameState.publishRunSuccessful
member.summary: Indicates whether the publish run was completed successfully. Synchronized with LevelEditorGUI.publishRunSuccessful during state refresh operations.

member.name: F:GameState.immediatelyGoToCustomCampaign
member.summary: Flag to bypass menus and immediately load a custom campaign. Used for quick-loading user-created content from various menu screens.

member.name: F:GameState.returnToWorldMap
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the game should return to the world map after the current level. Used to control navigation flow between levels and the campaign map.

member.name: F:GameState.startNewWorldMapGame

member.name: F:GameState.nextXLoadOffset
member.summary: The X-axis offset for the next map load position. Used with super checkpoints to determine spawn location when continuing from a checkpoint.

member.name: F:GameState.nextYLoadOffset
member.summary: The Y-axis offset for the next map load position. Used with super checkpoints to determine spawn location when continuing from a checkpoint.

member.name: F:GameState.persistPastLevelLoad
member.summary: Determines whether certain game elements should persist when loading a new level. Used to maintain continuity for specific objects or state across level transitions.

member.name: F:GameState.startFromSuperCheckPoint

member.name: F:GameState.superCheckpointStartPos
member.summary: The grid position where players should spawn when starting from a super checkpoint. Only used when startFromSuperCheckPoint is true.

member.name: P:GameState.hardCoreMode
member.summary: Gets whether the game is currently in hardcore mode (Iron Bro mode). This mode features permanent death and is only available in world map campaigns.

member.name: P:GameState.hardMode
