member.name: F:GameState.arcadeHardMode
member.summary: Hard mode setting for arcade (non-world map) game modes. Used when currentWorldmapSave is null or not in a world map campaign.

member.name: F:GameState.currentWorldmapSave
member.summary: The current world map save slot data containing campaign progress. Holds information about unlocked levels, collected items, and difficulty settings for the active campaign.

member.name: F:GameState.mapGenSeed
member.summary: The seed value used for procedural map generation when useRandomMapGenSeed is true. Allows for reproducible randomly generated levels.

member.name: F:GameState.randomSeed
member.summary: The random seed used for level generation and other randomized game elements. Used to ensure consistency in procedural generation.

member.name: F:GameState.useRandomMapGenSeed
member.summary: Determines whether to use a specific seed for map generation. When true, uses mapGenSeed value; when false, uses default generation behavior.

member.name: M:Grenade.Awake
member.summary: Initializes the grenade when the GameObject is created. Sets up the fragile collision layer for detecting breakable objects and initializes the bounce tracking list if needed.

member.name: M:Grenade.RegisterGrenade
member.summary: Registers this grenade with the Map's tracking systems. If the grenade is marked as shootable, it's added to the shootable grenades list for AI targeting. All grenades are added to the general grenade tracking list.

member.name: M:Grenade.SetToDisable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether this grenade should start in a disabled state. Used for pre-placed grenades in levels that shouldn't be active immediately.
member.param: True to start disabled, false for normal behavior

member.name: M:Grenade.SetupGrenade(System.Int32,System.Int32,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour)
member.summary: Initializes grenade ownership and visual properties. Sets the player number, random seed, and who fired the grenade. Configures trail renderer colors based on the player number, using player-specific colors for players 0-3 and red/yellow for others.
member.param: Random seed for consistent behavior
Player number who owns this grenade
The unit that launched this grenade

member.name: M:Grenade.Start
member.summary: Completes grenade initialization after all Awake calls. Caches the main material, sets up the ground collision layer, registers the grenade with game systems, and handles special disabled spawn states for pre-placed grenades.

member.name: F:Grenade.disabledAtStart
member.summary: When true, the grenade starts in a disabled state. Used for pre-placed grenades in levels that shouldn't be active until triggered. Set via SetToDisable method.

member.name: M:Grenade.Death
member.summary: Handles the grenade explosion. Damages terrain, creates visual effects, and damages units within the blast radius. Only the local player's grenades calculate unit damage to prevent networking issues. Awards achievements for special kills and triggers explosion effects.

member.name: M:Grenade.DestroyGrenade
member.summary: Removes the grenade from all tracking systems and destroys the GameObject. Called after the explosion effects have been created.

member.name: M:Grenade.Knock(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies knockback force to the grenade from explosions or other impacts. Adjusts velocity based on the impact force and grenade weight, adds rotational spin, and plays a defend sound.
member.param: Horizontal position difference from impact source
Vertical position difference from impact source
Incoming horizontal velocity of the impact
Incoming vertical velocity of the impact

member.name: F:Grenade.blastForce
member.summary: Physics knockback force applied to units caught in the explosion. Determines how far units are pushed away from the blast center. Defaults to 50 force units.

member.name: F:Grenade.damage
member.summary: Base explosion damage dealt to units, terrain, and destructibles. Applied through various multipliers for different explosion zones. Defaults to 5 damage.

member.name: F:Grenade.damageType
member.summary: Type of damage this grenade inflicts, determining how units resist or react to the explosion. Also used when damaging fragile objects during flight.

member.name: F:Grenade.firedBy
member.summary: Reference to the unit that launched this grenade. Used for damage attribution, achievement tracking, and determining local ownership for networking. Set during initialization.

member.name: F:Grenade.friendlyFire
member.summary: Determines if this grenade damages units on the same team as the thrower. When true, explosion damages all units. When false, only damages enemies. Defaults to true.

member.name: F:Grenade.panicCounter
member.summary: Timer controlling when to trigger panic in nearby AI units. Decrements each frame when life is below 0.5 seconds, triggering Map.PanicUnits every 0.045 seconds to make enemies flee.

member.name: F:Grenade.playerNum
member.summary: Identifies which player threw this grenade for damage attribution and scoring. Also determines trail color for players 0-3. Defaults to -1 for non-player grenades.

member.name: F:Grenade.range
member.summary: Explosion radius in world units. Controls the area of effect for damage to units, terrain, and doodads. Also scales visual explosion effects. Defaults to 48 units.

member.name: F:Grenade.shootable
member.summary: When true, this grenade can be targeted and detonated by projectiles. Registers with Map.RegisterShootableGrenade for AI targeting systems.

member.name: M:Grenade.GiveBrotatoAchievementOnKill
member.summary: Marks this grenade to award the Hot Brotato achievement if it kills a mook. Called by special abilities or power-ups that enable achievement-granting grenades.

member.name: F:Grenade.giveBrotatoAwardIfIKillAMook
member.summary: When true, awards the Hot Brotato achievement if this grenade kills a mook enemy. Checked during explosion damage and enemy bounce kills. Set via GiveBrotatoAchievementOnKill method by special abilities or power-ups.

member.name: F:Grenade.giveMartiniAchievement
member.summary: When true, awards the Martini achievement when this grenade kills enemies by bouncing off them. Only triggers during successful enemy bounce kills, not regular explosions.

member.name: M:Grenade.Bounce(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handles physics response when the grenade hits surfaces. Reduces velocities, applies angular friction for realistic rolling, interacts with doors, triggers ground effects like mines, and plays impact sounds based on collision force.
member.param: True if bouncing on the X axis (hit vertical surface)
True if bouncing on the Y axis (hit horizontal surface)

member.name: M:Grenade.BounceOffEnemies
member.summary: Processes bouncing off enemy units when the grenade hits them from above. Checks if the grenade has sufficient downward velocity, then attempts to hit units below. Supports both single and multiple bounce modes. Applies upward velocity based on weight and reduces horizontal speed. Awards achievements for special bounce kills.

member.name: M:Grenade.CanBounceOnEnemies
member.summary: Determines if the grenade has sufficient downward velocity to bounce off enemies. Prevents slow-moving grenades from triggering enemy bounces.
member.returns: True if downward velocity exceeds 120 units/second

member.name: M:Grenade.HitFragile
member.summary: Detects and damages fragile objects in the grenade's path during flight. Uses velocity direction to check ahead for breakable objects on the fragile layer. Creates visual puff effects on impact and either bounces off doors or sends damage messages to other fragile objects like glass.

member.name: M:Grenade.Launch(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Primary method for spawning and launching grenades into the world. Handles complex wall collision detection to prevent grenades from spawning inside terrain. Registers the grenade as a fetchable object for AI awareness and initializes trail tracking.
member.param: Initial X position
Initial Y position
Initial horizontal velocity
Initial vertical velocity

member.name: M:Grenade.ReduceLife(System.Single)
member.summary: Multiplies the grenade's remaining fuse time by the specified factor. Used to create shorter fuses for special grenade types or launch methods. Ensures a minimum life of 0.01 seconds to prevent instant detonation.
member.param: Multiplier for the remaining life (0-1 reduces, >1 extends)

member.name: M:Grenade.RunMovement
member.summary: Updates grenade physics each frame. Checks for collisions with fragile objects, handles bouncing off enemies if enabled, and processes base movement physics.

member.name: M:Grenade.SetMinLife(System.Single)
member.summary: Ensures the grenade has at least the specified fuse time remaining. Used to prevent instant explosions when grenades are thrown or knocked.
member.param: Minimum life time in seconds

member.name: M:Grenade.SetPosition
member.summary: Updates the grenade's transform position. Simple override that calls the base implementation to maintain position synchronization.

member.name: M:Grenade.ThrowGrenade(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Launches a grenade that was previously held by a unit. Unparents the grenade, sets its position and velocity, resets visual effects, and ensures a minimum fuse time of 0.7 seconds.
member.param: Horizontal throw velocity
Vertical throw velocity
Release X position
Release Y position
Player number who threw the grenade

member.name: P:Grenade.ShouldTimeslice
member.summary: Indicates that grenades should not participate in time-slicing optimization. Always returns false to ensure grenades update every frame for accurate physics and timing.

member.name: F:Grenade.alreadyBouncedOffUnits
member.summary: Tracks units this grenade has bounced off when bounceOffEnemiesMultiple is false. Prevents the same unit from being hit multiple times. List is populated during BounceOffEnemies calls.

member.name: F:Grenade.angularFrictionM
member.summary: Multiplier for angular velocity calculations when useAngularFriction is enabled. Higher values create more spin from movement and impacts. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: F:Grenade.bounceOffEnemies
member.summary: Enables the grenade to bounce off enemy units when falling from above. Checked each frame during movement updates to trigger bounce detection.

member.name: F:Grenade.bounceOffEnemiesMultiple
member.summary: When true, allows bouncing off the same enemy multiple times. When false, uses alreadyBouncedOffUnits list to track and prevent repeated bounces.

member.name: F:Grenade.bounceYOffset
member.summary: Vertical offset applied during enemy bounce detection. Adjusts the collision check position relative to the grenade center. Defaults to 2 units upward.

member.name: F:Grenade.fragileLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for detecting breakable objects like glass during flight. Set to "DirtyHippie" layer during initialization. Used by HitFragile method for collision detection.

member.name: F:Grenade.useAngularFriction
member.summary: Enables realistic rotation physics when bouncing. When true, horizontal movement creates rotation and impacts affect spin based on the angularFrictionM multiplier.

member.name: F:Grenade.weight
member.summary: Mass factor affecting physics calculations. Higher weight reduces knockback effects and bounce height. Used in velocity calculations for both throwing and impact responses. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: M:Grenade.CreateWarningEffect
member.summary: Spawns a red warning diamond effect at the grenade's position. Creates either a normal or large warning indicator based on the largeWarning flag setting.

member.name: M:Grenade.MakeEffects
member.summary: Creates explosion visual and audio effects when the grenade detonates. Spawns either a huge or normal explosion based on the hugeExplosion flag, plays the death sound, and damages nearby destructible doodads.

member.name: M:Grenade.ResetTrail
member.summary: Resets trail effect tracking to the current position. Prevents visual artifacts when the grenade is teleported or initially thrown by clearing the trail history.

member.name: M:Grenade.RunTrail
member.summary: Updates the grenade's visual trail effect each frame. Supports two trail types: FireTrail creates spark particles along the path, while ColorTrail creates a colored line based on the throwing player's color and grenade velocity. Includes optimization to prevent excessive trail length.

member.name: M:Grenade.RunWarnings
member.summary: Creates visual and audio warnings before explosion. Increases warning intensity as the fuse burns down, with faster flickering and higher pitch beeps when life drops below 0.5 seconds. Alternates grenade material and creates warning diamonds. Also triggers AI unit panic reactions.

member.name: F:Grenade.createdTrail
member.summary: Reference to the active ProjectileTrail effect instance. Created when the grenade has sufficient velocity and destroyed when velocity drops too low. Used for ColorTrail type.

member.name: F:Grenade.dontMakeEffects
member.summary: When true, skips creating visual explosion effects in the Death method. Used for silent explosions or when effects are handled externally.

member.name: F:Grenade.explosion
member.summary: Standard explosion visual effect component. Assigned in Unity Inspector and likely triggered during the Death method for normal-sized explosions.

member.name: F:Grenade.explosionBig
member.summary: Large explosion visual effect component. Assigned in Unity Inspector and likely triggered for grenades with enhanced explosion visuals.

member.name: F:Grenade.fire1
member.summary: Visual fire effect component slot 1. Assigned in Unity Inspector for grenades with burning or fire trail effects. Controlled by FlickerFader component behavior.

member.name: F:Grenade.fire2
member.summary: Visual fire effect component slot 2. Assigned in Unity Inspector for grenades with burning or fire trail effects. Controlled by FlickerFader component behavior.

member.name: F:Grenade.fire3
member.summary: Visual fire effect component slot 3. Assigned in Unity Inspector for grenades with burning or fire trail effects. Controlled by FlickerFader component behavior.

member.name: F:Grenade.flickerCounter
member.summary: Timer controlling the material swap rate for warning flashes. Increments each frame and triggers flashes at 0.0667 second intervals when life is below 0.5 seconds, or 0.133 second intervals otherwise.

member.name: F:Grenade.hasHeroTrail
member.summary: Flag indicating this grenade should display a hero-colored trail. Currently unused in base class but available for derived grenade types.

member.name: F:Grenade.hugeExplosion
member.summary: When true, creates an enhanced explosion effect with additional visual elements and low-pass audio filtering. Used for special high-powered grenades.

member.name: F:Grenade.hugeExplosionLowPassM
member.summary: Audio low-pass filter multiplier applied to huge explosion sound effects. Lower values create more muffled, bass-heavy explosion sounds. Used when hugeExplosion is true. Defaults to 0.1 for deep, rumbling explosions.

member.name: F:Grenade.largeWarning
member.summary: When true, displays a larger warning diamond effect during countdown. Used for grenades with larger blast radius or special importance. Standard grenades use the normal size.

member.name: F:Grenade.lastTrailAlphaM
member.summary: Alpha transparency multiplier for trail effects. Set to 0.5 when trail is reset, though current implementation doesn't actively use this value. Defaults to 0.1. Reserved for future trail fading effects.

member.name: F:Grenade.lastTrailX
member.summary: Stores the X coordinate where the last trail segment was drawn. Used to calculate distance between trail points and prevent excessive trail length. Updated continuously during trail rendering.

member.name: F:Grenade.lastTrailY
member.summary: Stores the Y coordinate where the last trail segment was drawn. Works with lastTrailX to track trail continuity and calculate segment distances for optimization.

member.name: F:Grenade.mainMaterial
member.summary: The grenade's default visual material cached from the renderer at startup. Used for material swapping during warning flashes before explosion.

member.name: F:Grenade.mainMaterialShowing
member.summary: Tracks which material is currently displayed during warning flashes. Toggles between true (main material) and false (other material) to create the flickering countdown effect before explosion. Defaults to true.

member.name: F:Grenade.otherMaterial
member.summary: Alternate material for visual warning effects. Swapped with mainMaterial during the countdown phase to create a flashing warning effect before detonation.

member.name: F:Grenade.pulseCount
member.summary: Counts the number of warning flashes during countdown. Used to trigger warning effects and beep sounds on odd-numbered pulses, creating a rhythmic warning pattern.

member.name: F:Grenade.shrapnel
member.summary: Reference to shrapnel projectile prefab. Assigned in Unity Inspector for grenades that spawn shrapnel on explosion. Used by derived grenade types.

member.name: F:Grenade.smoke1
member.summary: Smoke visual effect component slot 1. Assigned in Unity Inspector for smoke trails or explosion smoke. Likely triggered on explosion or during flight.

member.name: F:Grenade.smoke2
member.summary: Smoke visual effect component slot 2. Assigned in Unity Inspector for smoke trails or explosion smoke. Likely triggered on explosion or during flight.

member.name: F:Grenade.trailDrawDelay
member.summary: Frame counter that delays trail drawing after launch. Set to 2 frames on launch to prevent trail artifacts at spawn point. Decrements each frame until reaching 0.

member.name: F:Grenade.trailRenderer
member.summary: Line renderer component for drawing colored trails. Configured in SetupGrenade to match the throwing player's color. Null for grenades without colored trails.

member.name: F:Grenade.trailType
member.summary: Determines the visual trail style for this grenade. FireTrail creates spark particles along the flight path, while ColorTrail creates a colored line based on the throwing player.

member.name: M:Grenade.PlayDeathSound
member.summary: Plays the grenade explosion sound effect at the default volume of 0.7.

member.name: M:Grenade.PlayDeathSound(System.Single)
member.summary: Plays the grenade explosion sound effect at the specified volume level.
member.param: Volume level for the explosion sound (0.0 to 1.0)

member.name: M:Grenade.PlaySpecialSound(System.Single)
member.summary: Plays special grenade sound effects positioned between the grenade and camera for better audibility. Used for unique grenade effects like cluster bomb separations.
member.param: Volume level for the special sound (0.0 to 1.0)

member.name: F:Grenade.maxVelocityBounceVolume
member.summary: Impact velocity at which bounce sounds reach maximum volume. Used to scale volume between minimum and maximum based on impact force. Defaults to 210 units per second.

member.name: F:Grenade.minVelocityBounceSound
member.summary: Minimum impact velocity required to play bounce sound effects. Prevents sounds from playing on gentle contacts. Defaults to 33 units per second.

member.name: F:Grenade.sound
member.summary: Cached reference to the global Sound instance. Lazily initialized when first playing death sounds to avoid repeated GetInstance() calls. Used for performance optimization when playing explosion audio.

member.name: F:Grenade.soundHolder
member.summary: Container for all grenade-related sound effects including defend sounds (knockback), hit sounds (bouncing), death sounds (explosion), special sounds, and greeting sounds (countdown beeps). Central audio management for the grenade.

member.name: M:Grenade.PackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Serializes the grenade's network state for synchronization. Packs the X/Y position and enabled state into the stream, then calls base packing for additional data.
member.param: The network stream to write state data to
member.returns: The stream with serialized grenade state

member.name: M:Grenade.UnpackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Deserializes the grenade's network state from a stream. Reads position and enabled state, applies them to the grenade, then calls base unpacking for additional data.
member.param: The network stream to read state data from
member.returns: The stream after reading grenade state

member.name: P:Grenade.FiredLocally
member.summary: Determines if this grenade was fired by the local player rather than a remote networked player. Uses lazy evaluation to check if the firedBy unit is owned locally, falling back to the grenade's own ownership. Critical for preventing duplicate damage calculations in multiplayer.

member.name: M:Grenade.RunUpdate
member.summary: Allows external code to force an immediate update cycle. Simply calls the Update method to process physics and effects outside the normal update loop.

member.name: M:Grenade.Update
member.summary: Main update loop called each frame. Processes base physics updates, runs warning effects when the fuse is below 1 second, and updates the visual trail.
member.returns: Always returns true to continue updating

member.name: M:HeroController.Awake
member.summary: Unity Awake method that initializes the HeroController singleton. Sets up the instance reference, registers network event handlers for player drops and disconnections, and initializes hero tracking collections. Also sets the initial spawn point if one exists in the scene.

member.name: M:HeroController.OnDestroy
member.summary: Unity OnDestroy cleanup method. Unregisters network event handlers, clears the singleton instance reference, and disposes of all tracking collections to prevent memory leaks and ensure clean shutdown.

member.name: M:HeroController.Start
member.summary: Unity Start method that initializes the HeroController. Sets up game state, loads input settings from PlayerPrefs, finds the spawn point, initializes perks system, spawns joined players, and begins the game sequence. Core initialization point for multiplayer hero management.

member.name: M:HeroController.Update
member.summary: Main update loop for HeroController. Handles debug inputs, processes player drops, manages join messages, runs hero respawn logic, checks level completion, monitors player drop-ins, and updates time boost effects each frame.

member.name: P:HeroController.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of HeroController, creating it if necessary. Provides global access to the hero controller for managing player spawning and game state. Uses lazy initialization with FindObjectOfType if the instance is null.
member.returns: The singleton HeroController instance.

member.name: P:HeroController.InstanceExists
member.summary: Gets whether a HeroController instance currently exists in the scene. Used to check availability before accessing the singleton instance to avoid unnecessary creation.
member.returns: True if an instance exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:HeroController.inst
member.summary: Private static instance reference for the singleton pattern. Stores the single HeroController instance to ensure only one exists. Accessed through the public Instance property with lazy initialization.

member.name: F:HeroController.playerPrefabReference
member.summary: Reference to the Player prefab GameObject used for instantiating new players. Contains the template for creating networked player instances when players join the game session.

member.name: F:HeroController.players
member.summary: Static array holding all four possible Player instances. Central storage for player data, character references, and game state. Indexed by player number (0-3) for direct access to player information.

member.name: M:HeroController.AllBrosUseSteroids
member.summary: Activates steroid power-up for all living players simultaneously. Applies different time boost behavior based on game mode (competitive vs cooperative). Includes global time slow and color shift effects for dramatic impact.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetCorpseExplosionChance
member.summary: Gets the chance for corpses to explode from any playing player's upgrades. Returns the exploding corpse chance value from the first playing player found. Used for applying consistent corpse explosion mechanics across all players.
member.returns: The corpse explosion chance (0.0-1.0) or -1 if no players playing.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPrimaryFireLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the primary fire upgrade level for a specific player. Retrieves the modified value from the player's inventory value orchestrator. Returns 0 for invalid player numbers or if no upgrades are active.
member.param: The player number to check.
member.returns: The primary fire level (0 or higher).

member.name: M:HeroController.GetSecondaryFireLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the secondary fire (special ability) upgrade level for a specific player. Retrieves the modified value from the player's inventory value orchestrator. Returns 0 for invalid player numbers or if no upgrades are active.
member.param: The player number to check.
member.returns: The secondary fire level (0 or higher).

member.name: M:HeroController.OneBroUseSteroids(System.Int32)
member.summary: Activates steroid power-up for a single player with default settings. Applies networked steroid effect, Time Bro boost for 0.5 seconds, global time slow, and color shift visual effect. Standard quick steroid activation.
member.param: The player number to apply steroids to.

member.name: M:HeroController.OneBroUseSteroids(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Activates steroid power-up for a single player with customizable parameters. Allows control over duration, visual effects, and whether to use high-five or standard time slow mechanics. Advanced steroid activation method.
member.param: The player number to apply steroids to.
Duration of the steroid effect in seconds.
Whether to apply time slow color shift effect.
Use high-five time slow instead of standard.
Duration of the time slow effect.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetHeroInvulnerable(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets a specific hero to invulnerable state for the specified duration. Validates the player number and checks that the player has a character instance before applying the invulnerability effect without showing halo or other visual indicators.

Duration in seconds for the invulnerability effect.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetHeroesWillComebackToLife(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets heroes within range to resurrect after death for the specified duration. This effect allows heroes to automatically respawn at their death location after being killed, useful for special game modes or power-ups.

Y coordinate of the center position.
Radius of the effect area.
Duration in seconds for the resurrection effect.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetHerosInvulnerable(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets all heroes within a specified range of a position to invulnerable state. Checks each player's distance from the center point and applies invulnerability if they are within the circular range. Optionally shows a visual halo effect.

Y coordinate of the center position.
Radius of the effect area.
Duration in seconds for the invulnerability effect.
Whether to display a visual halo effect on affected heroes.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetOffscreenHeroesInvulnerable(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets all offscreen heroes to invulnerable state for the specified duration. Loops through all players and applies invulnerability to characters that are not visible on screen. Also resets their teleport counter to -2 to prevent immediate teleportation.
member.param: Duration in seconds for the invulnerability effect.

member.name: F:HeroController.timeBoostTime
member.summary: Remaining duration of time manipulation effects. Tracks how long time dilation from Time Bro abilities or power-ups should continue. Decrements each frame and restores normal time when it reaches zero.

member.name: F:HeroController.ultraHealthyHeroes
member.summary: Flag indicating if heroes have enhanced health. When true, heroes may have additional hit points or damage resistance. Used for special game modes or difficulty modifiers.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAllControllerRumble(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets controller vibration/rumble for all connected players simultaneously. Used for major events that should provide feedback to everyone, such as large explosions or environmental effects.
member.param: The intensity of the rumble effect (0-1 range) for all controllers.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetControllerRumble(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets controller vibration/rumble for a specific player. Provides haptic feedback through the controller to enhance game feel for explosions, impacts, or other significant events.
member.param: The player number whose controller should rumble.
The intensity of the rumble effect (0-1 range).

member.name: M:HeroController.AddHeroToAlreadyChosenHeroes(HeroType)
member.summary: Adds a hero type to the list of already chosen heroes. Prevents duplicate entries and maintains the history of selected heroes for game modes that cycle through available characters.

member.name: M:HeroController.AddLife(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds one life to a specific player. Validates that the player exists and is actively playing before calling the player's AddLife method. Used for life pickups, rewards, or game mechanics that grant extra lives.

member.name: M:HeroController.AddLocalPlayer(System.Int32,System.Int32)

The controller ID for the new player.

member.name: M:HeroController.AddPlayer(System.Int32,System.Int32,PID)
member.summary: RPC method that adds a new player to the game. For local players, instantiates the player prefab with network buffering. For remote players, resets ping sampling. Also ensures enough bros are unlocked for all joined players.

The controller ID for the new player.
The network player ID.

member.name: M:HeroController.AssignPlayerCharacter(System.Int32,TestVanDammeAnim)

The TestVanDammeAnim character instance to assign.

The hero character to attach to the helicopter.

Whether to trigger explosion effects on attachment.

member.name: M:HeroController.AutoJoinLocalHost

member.name: M:HeroController.ChangeBro(System.Int32,HeroType)

member.name: M:HeroController.DecreaseAmmo

member.name: M:HeroController.DetachHeroFromHelicopter(TestVanDammeAnim)

member.name: M:HeroController.Dropout(System.Int32,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:HeroController.DropoutRPC(System.Int32)

member.name: M:HeroController.FindAndFlashNextSpawnDoor(System.Int32)

member.name: M:HeroController.FlagPlayerToDrop(System.Int32)

member.name: M:HeroController.GetNthAvailableSlot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the Nth available player slot that is not currently occupied. Scans through all four player slots and counts empty slots until reaching the requested index. Used for assigning new players to available positions.
member.param: The zero-based index of the available slot to find.
member.returns: Player slot number (0-3) or -1 if not enough slots available.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetNthLocalPlayerPlaying(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the player number of the Nth local player who is actively playing. Counts only local players (IsMine) who have joined the game. Used for split-screen and local co-op player management.
member.param: The zero-based index of the local player to find.
member.returns: Player number (0-3) of the Nth local player or -1 if not found.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPidFromControl(System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps a controller ID to its corresponding network Player ID (PID). Used to identify which network player corresponds to a given local controller input for proper multiplayer synchronization.
member.param: The local controller ID to map.
member.returns: The PID enum value for the controller, or PID.NoID if not found.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayerName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the name of a specific player. Returns either the custom name set via SetPlayerName or the default name if none was set.
member.param: The player index to get the name for.
member.returns: The player's name string.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayerNumForControllerID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the player number associated with a specific controller ID. Only checks local players (IsMine) and returns -1 if the controller is not assigned to any player. Used for mapping controller input to the correct player.
member.param: The controller ID to look up.
member.returns: Player number (0-3) or -1 if not found.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayerUsingController(System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the Player instance that is using a specific controller ID. Only returns local players (IsMine) that match the controller number. Used for mapping controller input to the correct player object.
member.param: The controller ID to search for.
member.returns: The Player using the controller or null if not found.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetSpecialAmmo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the appropriate special ammunition count for a player, choosing between the current count and the last recorded count based on which is higher. Used to maintain ammo across respawns.
member.param: The player number to get ammo for.
The current special ammo count.
member.returns: The maximum of current and last recorded ammo counts.

member.name: M:HeroController.GiveAllLifelessPlayersALife
member.summary: Gives one life to all players who are currently at zero lives. Loops through all playing players and grants a life to those who have no lives remaining, preventing complete elimination from the game.

member.name: M:HeroController.HaveAllHerosBeenInstantiated
member.summary: Checks whether all active players have had their hero characters instantiated. Used as a readiness check before starting gameplay to ensure all players have spawned characters in the scene.
member.returns: True if all playing players have character instances; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsControIdRegisteredToPID(System.Int32,PID)
member.summary: Checks if a controller ID is already registered to a specific network player ID. Prevents the same controller-PID combination from joining multiple times, ensuring each network player has only one slot.
member.param: The controller ID to check.
The player network ID to check against.
member.returns: True if this controller-PID combination is already registered; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsControllerIDUsed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if a controller ID is already assigned to an active player. Used internally to prevent duplicate controller assignments when players join the game.
member.param: The controller ID to check.
member.returns: True if the controller is already in use; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsPlayerActiveForControllerID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the player using a specific controller is active and alive with lives remaining. More comprehensive than just checking if the controller is in use, this ensures the player can actually participate in gameplay.
member.param: The controller ID to check.
member.returns: True if the player is active, alive, and has lives; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsPlayerPlaying(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether a specific player is currently active in the game. Used to determine which player slots are occupied for spawning and input handling.
member.param: The player index to check.
member.returns: True if the player at the given index is playing; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsTypeInUse(HeroType)
member.summary: Checks if a specific hero type is currently being used by any player. Iterates through all playing players to see if any have the specified hero type assigned. Used to prevent duplicate hero selection.
member.param: The HeroType to check for usage.
member.returns: True if the hero type is in use; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.KickPlayersIfHeHasNotJoined(PID)
member.summary: Initiates a timeout check for a player who is expected to join. Starts a coroutine that will kick the player if they haven't joined within the timeout period (2 seconds).
member.param: The PID of the player to monitor for joining.

member.name: M:HeroController.KickPlayersIfHeHasNotJoinedRoutine(PID)
member.summary: Coroutine that waits 2 seconds then checks if a player has joined. If the player's PID is not found in the active players list, sends a kick command to remove them from the session.
member.param: The PID of the player to check and potentially kick.
member.returns: IEnumerator for coroutine execution.

member.name: M:HeroController.MonitorPlayerDropin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Monitors a potential player slot for controller input to join the game. Checks for fire button press from a logged-in controller and initiates the join process if valid input is detected.
member.param: The player slot number to monitor for drop-in.

member.name: M:HeroController.PlayerExists(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if a player exists and has valid data at the specified player number. Verifies both that the player object is not null and that it reports existing through its Exists() method.
member.param: The player number to check.
member.returns: True if the player exists with valid data; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.RecieveHeroTypeFromMaster(HeroType,System.Int32,HeroType[],Ack)
member.summary: Client-side RPC that receives the hero type assignment from the master. Updates the local hero type, synchronizes the already-chosen heroes list, and triggers the spawn process for the assigned hero.
member.param: The hero type assigned by the master.
The player number receiving the assignment.
Updated list of heroes already chosen.
Network acknowledgment response.

member.name: M:HeroController.RegisterHeroToPlayer(TestVanDammeAnim,System.Int32,HeroType)
member.summary: Registers a spawned hero character to a specific player slot. Links the hero instance to the player data, activates the HUD, sets the hero type, and handles rescue bro visibility. Core method for establishing the player-hero connection.
member.param: The TestVanDammeAnim hero instance to register.
The player number to register the hero to.
The type of hero being registered.

member.name: M:HeroController.RequestAllPlayerData(PID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: RPC method that sends complete player data to a specific network target. Broadcasts all player slots' information including playing status, lives (optionally), and special ammo counts. Used when players join to synchronize game state.
member.param: The network PID to send the data to.
Whether to include life counts in the synchronization.

member.name: M:HeroController.RequestHeroTypeFromMaster(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Client-side method to request a hero type assignment from the master/host. Sends available hero types and preferences to the master who will assign an appropriate hero based on game rules and availability.
member.param: The player number requesting a hero.
Whether to ignore heroes the player hasn't unlocked yet.

member.name: M:HeroController.RequestHeroTypeFromMasterRPC(PID,System.Int32,HeroType[],HeroType,HeroType[],Ack,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Server-side RPC that processes hero type requests from clients. Determines the appropriate hero based on game mode, availability, and player preferences, then sends the assignment back to the requesting client.
member.param: The PID of the requesting player.
The player slot number.
Array of heroes the player has unlocked.
The player's preferred hero choice.
Heroes unlocked but not yet seen by player.
Network acknowledgment request.
Whether to skip unseen heroes.

member.name: M:HeroController.RequestJoinGame(System.Int32,PID,System.String)
member.summary: Processes a request to join the game from a client. Host-only method that validates the request, assigns an available player slot, broadcasts the addition to all players, and requests player data synchronization. Prevents duplicate joins and handles full games.
member.param: The controller number of the joining player.
The network PID of the requesting player.
The display name of the joining player.

member.name: M:HeroController.RestartAllHeroesBubbles
member.summary: Shows the start bubble animation for all living heroes. Creates visual feedback at level start or after checkpoints to indicate player positions and readiness.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAllHeroesImmuneToOutOfBounds
member.summary: Makes all living heroes immune to out-of-bounds death. Prevents heroes from dying when they go outside level boundaries, used during transitions or special sequences.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAllHeroesInvulnerable(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets all living heroes to invulnerable state for the specified duration. Loops through all player slots and applies invulnerability to each active character. Used for level transitions or special events.
member.param: Duration in seconds for the invulnerability effect.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetIsPlaying(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates a player's playing status. Synchronizes with the platform controller, updates network room information, and manages player state. Handles both joining and leaving players with proper platform integration.
member.param: The player index to update.
True if the player is joining; false if leaving.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetLives(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of lives for one or all players. Can target a specific player or set lives for all players when playerNum is -1. Updates both the lives count and any powerups that track lives.
member.param: The player to set lives for, or -1 for all players.
The number of lives to set.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetOriginalSpecialAmmoCount(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the original special ammunition count displayed in the HUD. Updates the player HUD's tracking of the base ammo count for display purposes, separate from the actual current ammo.
member.param: The player number to update HUD for.
The original ammo count to display.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetPlayerCharacter(System.Int32,TestVanDammeAnim)
member.summary: Assigns a character instance to a specific player slot. Links the spawned TestVanDammeAnim character to the player's data for tracking and control.
member.param: The player index to assign the character to.
The TestVanDammeAnim character instance to assign.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetPlayerName(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a custom name for a specific player. Overwrites the default "P1" style names with player-chosen or platform-provided names.

The custom name to assign to the player.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetSpecialAmmo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the special ammunition count for a specific player. Updates the ammo tracking array if the count is non-negative, used for restoring ammo counts after respawn or power-ups.
member.param: The player number to set ammo for.
The special ammo count to set.

member.name: M:HeroController.SpawnJoinedPlayers
member.summary: Spawns hero characters for all joined players who haven't been spawned yet. Handles different game modes (BroDown, SuicideHorde, etc.) with appropriate spawn behavior. Uses RPC calls to synchronize player addition across the network.

member.name: M:HeroController.SpawnSuicideBro(System.Int32)
member.summary: Spawns a player in Suicide Horde mode. Calls the player's RespawnBro method without checkpoint and clears any associated spawn door reference. Used specifically for the Suicide Horde game mode's unique spawning system.
member.param: The player number to spawn as suicide bro.

member.name: M:HeroController.UpdatePlayerData(System.Int32,System.Boolean,PID,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: RPC method that updates all player data for a specific slot. Synchronizes player information across the network including playing status, network ID, name, and controller assignment. Core method for keeping player data consistent.
member.param: The player slot index to update.
Whether the player is actively playing.
The network player ID.
The player's display name.
The controller ID assigned to this player.

member.name: M:HeroController.UpdatePlayerUserData(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Updates a player's controller and name information and broadcasts the change to other players. Also updates the primary user ID for single-player scenarios. Used when players change controllers or update their names mid-game.
member.param: The player number to update.
The new controller ID.
The new player name.

member.name: F:HeroController.BotBrainLeader
member.summary: Specifies which player number the bot brain should follow. When using AI control, bots will follow and assist the specified player. Initialized to -1 (no leader) for each slot.

member.name: F:HeroController.PIDS
member.summary: Network Player IDs for each player slot. Maps local player indices to network identities for multiplayer synchronization. Initialized to NoID and updated when players join. Critical for network communication.

member.name: F:HeroController.UseBotBrain
member.summary: Tracks whether each player slot is using AI bot brain control. When true, the player is controlled by AI instead of human input. Used for bot players in single player or when players disconnect.

member.name: F:HeroController.ammoCounts
member.summary: Tracks current special ammunition counts for each player. Initialized to -1 to indicate no ammo data. Used for maintaining ammo state across respawns and for HUD display. Array indexed by player number.

member.name: F:HeroController.lastAmmoCounts
member.summary: Stores the last known special ammunition count for each player. Used to restore ammo after respawn or to track ammo changes. Helps maintain ammo persistence across death/respawn cycles.

member.name: F:HeroController.playerControllerIDs
member.summary: Maps player slots to physical controller IDs. Tracks which gamepad or input device controls each player. Initialized to -1 (no controller) and updated when players join with their controller ID.

member.name: F:HeroController.playerNames
member.summary: Stores display names for each player slot. Can be custom names from platform profiles or default names like "P1". Initialized as empty strings and updated when players join or change names.

member.name: F:HeroController.playersPlaying
member.summary: Private array tracking which player slots are actively in the game. True indicates the slot is occupied by a joined player, false means empty. Core state for player management.

member.name: M:HeroController.AreAllHerosDead
member.summary: Checks if all player heroes are currently dead. Used to determine game over conditions or trigger respawn sequences when no players remain alive.
member.returns: True if no players are alive; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.AreAllOtherHerosDead(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if all heroes except the specified player are dead. Note: Current implementation has a bug and always returns false due to misplaced return statement. Intended to check if only one player remains alive.
member.param: The player number to exclude from the death check.
member.returns: Always returns false due to implementation bug.

member.name: M:HeroController.AtLeastOnePlayerStillHasALife
member.summary: Checks if any playing player has at least one life remaining. Used to determine if the game should continue or trigger game over. Returns true as long as any player can still respawn.
member.returns: True if at least one player has lives remaining; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetFirstHeroAlive
member.summary: Finds the first player who has a living hero character. Scans through all player slots in order and returns the index of the first one with an alive character. Defaults to 0 if no living heroes found.
member.returns: The player number of the first living hero, or 0 if none alive.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetFirstPlayerPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the position of the first living player other than the specified one. Used for finding ally positions for AI or camera logic. Falls back to checkpoint position if no other living players exist.
member.param: The player number to exclude from the search.
member.returns: Vector2 position of the first other living player or checkpoint position.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetLocalPlayerCount
member.summary: Gets the count of local players (non-network players) in the game. Checks the IsMine property of each player's PID to identify local vs remote players. Used for split-screen and local co-op scenarios.
member.returns: The number of local players (0-4).

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayerLives(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the number of lives remaining for a specific player. Returns 0 if the player doesn't exist or isn't playing.
member.param: The player number to get lives for.
member.returns: The number of lives remaining for the player.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayersAliveCount
member.summary: Counts the number of players who are currently alive. Checks each playing player to see if they have a character instance that is alive. Used for gameplay logic that depends on active player count.
member.returns: The number of players with living characters.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayersOnHelicopterAmount
member.summary: Counts players who are both alive and currently on the extraction helicopter. Used for level completion checks to ensure all players have reached the extraction point before ending the level.
member.returns: The number of living players on the helicopter.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayersPlayingCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of players currently marked as playing. Counts all players with isPlaying flag set to true, regardless of whether they are alive or have spawned characters.
member.returns: The count of players currently in the game.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetTotalLives
member.summary: Calculates the total remaining lives across all playing players. Sums up the Lives count for each active player to determine overall lives pool for game over conditions.
member.returns: The total number of lives remaining for all players.

member.name: M:HeroController.HasJustStarted
member.summary: Checks if the game has just started by testing if input is still delayed. Returns true during the initial game startup period before player input is enabled, used to prevent premature actions.
member.returns: True if the game just started and input is delayed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.HaveAllPlayersHaveSpawned
member.summary: Checks if all players have completed spawning and are no longer in first deployment state. Game mode aware, checking only the expected number of players for BroDown or SuicideHorde modes.
member.returns: True if all expected players have spawned; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.HaveAllPlayersJoined
member.summary: Checks if all players who are supposed to be playing have joined the game. Considers different game modes (BroDown, SuicideHorde) to determine expected player count. Sets AllPlayersHaveJoined field when all expected players join.
member.returns: True if all expected players have joined; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsAnyHeroDead
member.summary: Checks if any playing hero is currently dead. Only considers players who are actively playing, ignoring empty slots. Used for respawn timing logic.
member.returns: True if any playing player is dead; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsAnyPlayerDead
member.summary: Checks if any active player is currently dead. Only considers players who are marked as playing, ignoring empty slots. Used for game logic that triggers when at least one player needs respawning.
member.returns: True if any playing player is dead; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsDead(System.Int32)
member.summary: Protected method that checks if a specific player is dead. Returns true if the player exists but has no living character instance, indicating they are awaiting respawn.
member.param: The player number to check death status for.
member.returns: True if the player is dead; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.IsPlaying(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if a specific player slot is active and playing. Simple accessor for the player's isPlaying flag without additional validation.
member.param: The player number to check.
member.returns: True if the player is marked as playing; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.NumberOfPlayers
member.summary: Counts the total number of players currently in the game. Includes both local and remote players who have joined but may not necessarily be alive. Used for game logic that depends on participant count.

member.name: M:HeroController.NumberOfPlayersOnThisPC
member.summary: Counts only local players on this machine. Checks each player's PID to determine if they belong to the local client. Used for split-screen management and local input handling.

member.name: M:HeroController.PlayerHasALife(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if a specific player has any lives remaining. Used to determine if a player can still respawn after death.

member.name: M:HeroController.PlayerHasDied(System.Int32)

member.name: M:HeroController.PlayerHasDiedRPC(System.Int32)
member.summary: RPC method that notifies all clients when a player dies. Updates death tracking, manages lives, handles game over conditions, and coordinates the death state across the network. Only processes on non-host clients.

member.name: M:HeroController.PlayerIsAlive(System.Int32)
member.summary: Simple check to determine if a player is currently alive. Verifies the player is playing and has a living character instance in the game world.

member.name: M:HeroController.PlayerIsBeingRescuedOrRespawned(System.Int32)

member.name: M:HeroController.ResetPlayersPlaying

member.name: M:HeroController.UpdateDeathOrder(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Updates the local death order array to match the authoritative version from the host. Ensures all clients maintain consistent death ordering for respawn priority and other death-related mechanics.

member.name: M:HeroController.CanSeePlayer(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Performs a line of sight check for players in a specific direction. Uses raycasting to ensure no obstacles block the view. Checks both players and their owned units (like SnakeBroskin's grenade hologram).

Y coordinate to check from.
Direction to check (-1 for left, 1 for right).
Maximum horizontal distance for line of sight.
Maximum vertical distance for line of sight.
Output parameter for the player number if seen.
member.returns: True if a player is visible in the specified direction; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.CanSeePlayer(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Line of sight check with both X and Y direction constraints. Most restrictive visibility check that requires the target to be in the correct quadrant and have an unobstructed line of sight.
member.param: X coordinate to check from.
Y coordinate to check from.
Horizontal direction (-1 for left, 1 for right).
Vertical direction (-1 for down, 1 for up).
Maximum horizontal distance for line of sight.
Maximum vertical distance for line of sight.
Output parameter for the player number if seen.
member.returns: True if a player is visible in the specified quadrant; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.CanSeePlayer(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Checks if a specific player is visible from a given position. Uses raycasting to verify line of sight is not blocked by terrain or obstacles. Considers stealth mode - returns false if the player is in stealth.
member.param: The specific player number to look for.
X coordinate to check from.
Y coordinate to check from.
member.returns: True if the specified player is visible and not in stealth; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.CanSeePlayer(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Omnidirectional line of sight check for any player within range. Checks all living players and their units for visibility without direction constraints. Respects stealth mode and uses raycasting for obstacle detection.
member.param: X coordinate to check from.
Y coordinate to check from.
Maximum horizontal distance for line of sight.
Maximum vertical distance for line of sight.
Output parameter for the nearest visible player number.
member.returns: True if any player is visible within range; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetActualNearestPlayer(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Finds the truly nearest player using combined X and Y distance. More accurate than GetNearestPlayer for finding the closest player as it uses actual distance rather than treating X and Y separately.
member.param: X coordinate to search from.
Y coordinate to search from.
Maximum horizontal distance to search.
Maximum vertical distance to search.
member.returns: Player index (0-3) of nearest player or -1 if none in range.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetNearestPlayer(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Finds the nearest player within a specified rectangular range. Returns the player index of the closest player within the range or -1 if no players are found. Uses Manhattan distance for range checking.
member.param: X coordinate to search from.
Y coordinate to search from.
Maximum horizontal distance to search.
Maximum vertical distance to search.
member.returns: Player index (0-3) of nearest player or -1 if none in range.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetNearestPlayer(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the nearest player within range and updates the current nearest reference. Returns true if a closer player was found than the current nearest. Used for iterative searches to find the closest among multiple candidates.
member.param: X coordinate to search from.
Y coordinate to search from.
Maximum horizontal distance to search.
Maximum vertical distance to search.
Reference to current nearest player, updated if closer found.
member.returns: True if a closer player was found; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetNearestPlayerPos(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Finds the position of the nearest living player to the specified coordinates. Returns the player's position as a Vector3 or a far-away position (1000, 1000, 0) if no players are alive.
member.param: X coordinate to search from.
Y coordinate to search from.
member.returns: Vector3 position of the nearest player or (1000, 1000, 0) if none found.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetNearestPlayerPos(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the position of the nearest living player and returns their player number. Uses squared distance for efficiency and updates the playerNum reference with the nearest player's index.
member.param: X coordinate to search from.
Y coordinate to search from.
Output parameter for the nearest player's number.
member.returns: Vector3 position of the nearest player or (1000, 1000, 0) if none found.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayerPos(System.Int32,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Gets the position of a specific player through reference parameters. If the player doesn't exist or isn't alive, returns (-1000, -1000) as an invalid position marker.
member.param: The player number to get position for.
Output parameter that receives the player's X position.
Output parameter that receives the player's Y position.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayerPos(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the position of a specific player as a Vector3. Returns the player's current position or (-1000, -1000, 0) if the player doesn't exist or isn't alive.
member.param: The player number to get position for.
