member.param: The player number to remove the temporary target from.

member.name: M:HeroController.StopFollowing(UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Removes a transform from the extra camera follow positions list. Called when an object no longer needs camera attention, such as when it's destroyed or becomes irrelevant.
member.param: The transform to stop following.

member.name: M:HeroController.TryFollow(UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Adds a transform to the list of extra camera follow positions if not already present. Used for dynamic camera targets like important game objects or NPCs that the camera should include in its view calculations.
member.param: The transform to add to camera following.

member.name: F:HeroController.followingPreferredPlayer
member.summary: Player number that the camera should prefer to follow. Set to -1 for no preference. Used to bias camera positioning toward specific players during gameplay or cutscenes.

member.name: F:HeroController.lastCameraFollowPos
member.summary: Stores the last calculated camera follow position. Used for smooth camera interpolation and to track camera movement history. Updated each frame when calculating new follow positions.

member.name: F:HeroController.lastFollowTimeSwitch
member.summary: Timestamp of the last camera follow target switch. Used to prevent rapid camera target changes and ensure smooth transitions between follow targets.

member.name: F:HeroController.lastFollowTimeSwitchBack
member.summary: Timestamp of the last switch back to default camera following. Tracks when the camera returned from following special targets to prevent oscillation between targets.

member.name: F:HeroController.repositionDelay
member.summary: Cooldown timer for camera repositioning attempts. Prevents rapid camera adjustments by enforcing a minimum delay between reposition checks. Set when repositioning is blocked to create smoother camera behavior.

member.name: F:HeroController.timeSinceFinish
member.summary: Time elapsed since level completion. Used for post-level timing, delayed transitions, and ensuring completion sequences play out fully before moving to next level.

member.name: F:HeroController.wasFollowingExtra
member.summary: Tracks whether the camera was previously following extra targets beyond players. Used to detect state changes in camera following behavior and manage transitions between following players only versus including additional targets.

member.name: M:HeroController.DisableHud
member.summary: Disables the HUD display for all players. Loops through all player slots and calls DisableHud on each player instance. Used during cutscenes or special game states where HUD should be hidden.

member.name: M:HeroController.EnableHud
member.summary: Enables the HUD display for all players. Loops through all player slots and calls EnableHud on each player instance. Used to restore HUD visibility after cutscenes or special events.

member.name: M:HeroController.FlashAvatar(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Triggers a flashing effect on the player's avatar for the specified duration. Used to draw attention to status changes, damage, or special events. The avatar will flash for the given time period.
member.param: The player number whose avatar should flash.
Duration in seconds for the flash effect.
True to flash primary avatar; false for secondary.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetAvatarMaterial(HeroType)
member.summary: Retrieves the avatar material associated with a specific hero type. Each hero can have a unique avatar material for special visual effects in the HUD. Returns null if no custom material exists for the hero type.
member.param: The hero type to get avatar material for.
member.returns: The avatar Material for the hero type or null if not found.

member.name: M:HeroController.MustShowHuds
member.summary: Returns whether HUDs must be shown based on the global mustShowHUDS flag. Simple accessor for the HUD visibility state used by various game systems.
member.returns: True if HUDs must be shown; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarAngry(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the player's avatar to the angry expression state. Updates the HUD avatar display to show an aggressive face, typically during combat or special actions. Can target either primary or secondary avatar displays.
member.param: The player number whose avatar to update.
True to update primary avatar; false for secondary.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarBounceDown(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Triggers a downward bounce animation on the player's avatar. Creates a visual feedback effect where the avatar appears to compress or bounce downward, often used for impact or landing effects.
member.param: The player number whose avatar should bounce down.
True to bounce primary avatar; false for secondary.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarBounceUp(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Triggers an upward bounce animation on the player's avatar. Creates a visual feedback effect where the avatar appears to stretch or bounce upward, often used for jump or spring effects.
member.param: The player number whose avatar should bounce up.
True to bounce primary avatar; false for secondary.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarCalm(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the player's avatar to the calm expression state. Updates the HUD avatar display to show the normal, non-angry face for the specified player. Can target either primary or secondary avatar displays.
member.param: The player number whose avatar to update.
True to update primary avatar; false for secondary.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarDead(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the player's avatar to the dead state. Updates the HUD to show the death animation or static dead frame, indicating the player has died. Can target either primary or secondary avatar displays.
member.param: The player number whose avatar to mark as dead.
True to update primary avatar; false for secondary.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarFire(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the player's avatar to display fire animation. Shows the avatar with flames, typically used when the player is on fire or using fire-based abilities. Can target either primary or secondary avatar displays.
member.param: The player number whose avatar to set on fire.
True to update primary avatar; false for secondary.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarFireFrame(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a specific frame of the fire animation for the player's avatar. Allows precise control over which frame of the burning animation is displayed, useful for synchronized effects.
member.param: The player number whose avatar fire frame to set.
The specific animation frame number to display.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarFrame(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Internal method to set a specific animation frame for the player's avatar. Provides low-level control over avatar animation state for custom effects or specific animation requirements.
member.param: The player number whose avatar frame to set.
The specific frame number to display.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetAvatarMaterial(System.Int32,UnityEngine.Material)
member.summary: Sets a custom material for the player's avatar display. Allows special visual effects by replacing the avatar's rendering material, such as for power-ups or status effects.
member.param: The player number whose avatar material to change.
The Material to apply to the avatar.

member.name: M:HeroController.ShowHuds
member.summary: Shows all player HUD displays if mustShowHUDS flag is true. Iterates through all players and calls Show() on each HUD component to make health, ammo, and lives visible.

member.name: M:HeroController.SwitchAvatarMaterial(SpriteSM,HeroType)
member.summary: Switches a sprite's material to match the specified hero type's avatar material. Retrieves the appropriate material and applies it to the sprite if available. Returns whether the switch was successful.
member.param: The SpriteSM to update with new material.
The hero type whose avatar material to use.
member.returns: True if material was found and applied; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:HeroController.blankAvatar
member.summary: Material used as a placeholder avatar when no hero-specific avatar is available. Displayed in the HUD before a hero is selected or as a fallback for missing avatar materials.

member.name: F:HeroController.doubleBroSevenAvatarCount
member.summary: Tracks the current avatar index for Double Bro Seven. Used to cycle through available avatar textures, providing visual variety for this character's HUD representation.

member.name: F:HeroController.infoBarColor
member.summary: Color used for the info bar display during countdown and announcements. Default is black. Can be customized per level or game mode to match the visual theme.

member.name: F:HeroController.mustShowHUDS
member.summary: Global flag controlling HUD visibility. When true, all player HUDs must be shown. Used to force HUD display during gameplay and hide during cutscenes or menus.

member.name: F:HeroController.textureDoubleBroSevenAvatars
member.summary: Array of avatar textures specifically for the Double Bro Seven character. Supports multiple avatar variations for this unique hero type that can cycle through different appearances.

member.name: M:HeroController.DeserializeForJoin(UnityStream)
member.summary: Deserializes player data received during network join. Unpacks and updates the local arrays for playing status, controller IDs, and PIDs from the received stream data.
member.param: The UnityStream containing serialized player data.

member.name: M:HeroController.OnAfterDeserialize
member.summary: Unity deserialization callback that rebuilds the hero data dictionary from the serialized list. Handles duplicate keys by incrementing enum values to ensure data integrity. Part of the ISerializationCallbackReceiver interface.

member.name: M:HeroController.OnBeforeSerialize
member.summary: Unity serialization callback that converts the internal hero data dictionary to a serializable list format. Part of the ISerializationCallbackReceiver interface implementation for saving game state.

member.name: M:HeroController.PackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Packs the HeroController's network state for synchronization. Includes checkpoint position, bros released status, round timestamps, and checkpoint ID. Overrides base class to add hero-specific state data.
member.param: The UnityStream to pack state into.
member.returns: The stream with packed state data.

member.name: M:HeroController.SerializeForJoin(UnityStream)
member.summary: Serializes essential player data for network join operations. Packs the playing status, controller IDs, and network PIDs into the stream for transmission to joining players.
member.param: The UnityStream to serialize data into.

member.name: M:HeroController.UnpackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Unpacks network state data to synchronize the HeroController. Restores checkpoint position, bros released status, timestamps, and checkpoint ID from the stream. Ensures proper state synchronization across the network.
member.param: The UnityStream containing packed state data.
member.returns: The stream after unpacking.

member.name: M:HeroController.DebugDraw
member.summary: Comprehensive debug GUI display showing detailed player and game state information. Displays camera positions, player data tables including controllers, PIDs, playing status, hero states, positions, bot brain settings, and following relationships. Includes interactive controls for bot brain configuration during debug sessions.

member.name: M:HeroController.FindRemotePlayerToFollow(Player)
member.summary: Finds a suitable remote player for bot brain following behavior. Prioritizes remote players over local ones, returning the first remote player found or the last local player if no remote players exist. Returns -1 if no suitable follow target is found.
member.param: The player looking for someone to follow.
member.returns: The player index to follow or -1 if none found.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetTestInfo(HeroType)
member.summary: Sets which hero type should always be chosen for testing purposes. Overrides normal hero selection to force a specific character for debugging and testing.
member.param: The HeroType to always select during testing.

member.name: M:HeroController.UpdateDebugInputs
member.summary: Processes debug keyboard inputs for development and testing. Handles force invulnerability (F8), force level finish (Ctrl+Shift+F9), HUD toggle (Ctrl+F12), and editor-only commands like speed boost and unlock clearing.

member.name: F:HeroController.alwaysChooseHero
member.summary: Forces all players to spawn as a specific hero type when set. Used for testing specific heroes or creating themed gameplay experiences. Set to HeroType.None for normal random/sequential hero selection.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroDefinition.avatar
member.summary: Avatar material for the hero in the HeroDefinition. Used for HUD display to show the hero's face/portrait. Each hero has a unique avatar material for visual identification.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroDefinition.characterReference
member.summary: Reference to the hero character prefab in the HeroDefinition. Points to the TestVanDammeAnim asset that will be instantiated when this hero type is spawned.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroDefinition.name
member.summary: Display name of the hero in the HeroDefinition data structure. Used for UI display, announcements, and hero selection screens. Part of the hero configuration system.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroSetupKeyPair.data
member.summary: The HeroDefinition data in the key-value pair structure. Contains the actual hero configuration including name, prefab reference, and avatar material for the associated HeroType.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroSetupKeyPair.enumName
member.summary: The HeroType enum value in the key-value pair structure. Maps the enum to its corresponding HeroDefinition data for serialization and configuration management.

member.name: M:HeroController.GetPlayerNums(PID)
member.summary: Gets all player numbers associated with a specific player ID. Iterates through all 4 possible player slots and returns a list of player numbers where the PID matches. Used for finding which player slots belong to a specific connected player.
member.param: The player ID to search for.
member.returns: List of player numbers (0-3) that match the given player ID.

member.name: F:HeroController.heroList
member.summary: Serializable list of hero setup data using the HeroSetupKeyPair inner class. This list is populated during OnBeforeSerialize from the internal _heroData dictionary and restored during OnAfterDeserialize. Used for Unity's serialization system to persist hero configuration data.

member.name: F:HeroController.deathmatchSpawnQueue
member.summary: Queue of player numbers waiting to spawn in deathmatch mode. When multiple players need to respawn and spawning is limited (e.g., helicopter capacity), this queue tracks the order. The host manages the queue and syncs it to other players via the SyncRespawnQueue RPC.

member.name: F:HeroController._playersToDrop
member.summary: Static list of player numbers flagged to be dropped from the game. Players are added to this list via FlagPlayerToDrop and are actually dropped during the next Update cycle. This deferred dropping prevents issues with immediate disconnection.

member.name: F:HeroController.playerDeathOrder
member.summary: Tracks the order in which players died during the current game session. Used by the rescue system to determine which player should be revived when a rescue bro is collected. Earlier deaths get priority for revival. Synced across network.

member.name: F:HeroController.heroAlreadyChosenTypes
member.summary: Static list tracking which hero types have already been selected during the current game session. Used to prevent duplicate hero selection when spawning new characters, ensuring variety. The list is trimmed when it grows too large relative to active players.

member.name: F:HeroController.rescueBros
member.summary: List of all active rescue bros in the current level. Rescue bros register themselves on Start and are removed when freed or destroyed. Used for proximity checks when players attempt to rescue bros and for finding the nearest rescue bro to players.

member.name: F:HeroController.hiddenExplosives
member.summary: Static list of all registered hidden explosives in the game. Hidden explosives register via RegisterHiddenExplosives and are removed via RemoveHiddenExplosives. List is cleared on Awake and OnDestroy. Used for managing special explosive objects.

member.name: F:HeroController.extraFollowPositions
member.summary: Static list of additional transform positions for the camera to follow beyond player characters. Objects can register via TryFollow and unregister via StopFollowing. Camera system checks these positions when determining view bounds and focus area.

member.name: M:HeroController.ConvertHeroArrayToIntArray(HeroType[])
member.summary: Converts an array of HeroType enums to an array of integers for serialization. Uses Array.ConvertAll with a lambda to cast each HeroType to its integer value. Used when hero type data needs to be transmitted or stored as integers.
member.param: The array of HeroType enums to convert.
member.returns: Array of integers representing the hero types.

member.name: M:HeroController.ConvertIntArrayToHeroArray(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Converts an array of integers back to an array of HeroType enums after deserialization. Uses Array.ConvertAll with a lambda to cast each integer to HeroType. Reverse operation of ConvertHeroArrayToIntArray for restoring hero type data.
member.param: The array of integers to convert.
member.returns: Array of HeroType enums restored from the integers.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.AreAnyMoreBrosAvailableToBeSavedInHardcoreMode
member.summary: Checks if there are any heroes left to rescue in hardcore mode. Compares all unlocked heroes against those already available or dead in the current hardcore save to determine if more can be rescued.
member.returns: True if there are heroes that can still be rescued in hardcore mode, false if all are either available or dead.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.CheckFreedBrosUnlocks(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the current freed prisoner count has reached any hero unlock thresholds and unlocks the appropriate heroes. Also sets the next hero type for immediate availability.
member.param: If true, displays an announcement when heroes are unlocked.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.ClearHeroUnlockIntervals
member.summary: Clears the cached hero unlock interval data and forces it to regenerate. The method also accesses the first unlock interval to trigger regeneration of the dictionary.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.ClearUnlocks
member.summary: Resets all hero unlocks and clears the unlock progression data. If in exhibition build mode, also clears the cached unlock intervals to force regeneration.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.FreeBro
member.summary: Handles the rescue of a prisoner and associated hero unlock progression. In hardcore mode, randomly selects an available hero to add to the player's roster. In normal mode, increments the freed prisoner counter through PlayerProgress.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.GetNextHeroToBeUnlocked
member.summary: Determines which hero will be unlocked next based on the current rescue count. Iterates through the unlock intervals to find the next hero that hasn't been reached yet.
member.returns: The HeroType that will be unlocked next, or HeroType.None if all heroes are unlocked.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.GetNumberOfRescuesFromSinceUnlock
member.summary: Calculates how many rescues have been performed since the last hero was unlocked. Used for tracking progress between unlock milestones.
member.returns: The number of rescues since the last unlock, or 0 if no unlocks have occurred yet.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.GetNumberOfRescuesToNextUnlock
member.summary: Calculates how many more prisoner rescues are needed to unlock the next hero. Used by the level complete screen to show unlock progress to players.
member.returns: The number of rescues needed until the next hero unlock, or -1 if all heroes are unlocked.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.GetUnlockedHeroes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a list of all currently unlocked heroes available for selection. Filters out heroes that aren't compatible with certain game modes (death match, explosion run, etc.) and optionally excludes heroes that haven't been played yet.
member.param: If true, excludes newly unlocked heroes that haven't been played yet.
member.returns: A list of HeroType values representing all unlocked and available heroes.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the hero unlock system at game start. Removes any unlocked heroes that aren't available in the current campaign, checks for any new unlocks based on freed prisoner count, and preserves the next hero selection if valid.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.IsAvailableInCampaign(HeroType)
member.summary: Checks if a specific hero can be unlocked in the current campaign mode. Heroes must be part of the unlock progression to be available (some heroes like Expendabros are special unlocks).
member.param: The hero type to check for campaign availability.
member.returns: True if the hero can be unlocked through normal campaign progression, false otherwise.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.IsExpendaBro(HeroType)
member.summary: Determines if a hero is one of the Expendabros characters (special cross-promotion heroes from The Expendables movie franchise). These heroes have special unlock conditions.
member.param: The hero type to check.
member.returns: True if the hero is an Expendabro (LeeBroxmas, BroneyRoss, etc.), false otherwise.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.MakeSureTheresEnoughUnlockedBrosForAllTheJoinedPlayers
member.summary: Ensures that enough heroes are unlocked to support all joined players. In exhibition builds, unlocks 4 specific heroes. In normal gameplay, automatically increases the freed prisoner count to unlock enough heroes for the player count.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.UnlockAllBros
member.summary: Debug method that instantly unlocks all heroes by setting the freed prisoner count to 99999 and checking for unlocks. Used for testing purposes.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.UnlockEverythingButBroheart
member.summary: Debug method that unlocks all heroes except BroveHeart by setting the freed prisoner count to 399. BroveHeart requires 400 rescues, so this leaves only that hero locked.

member.name: M:HeroUnlockController.IsDeathMatchBro(HeroType)
member.summary: Determines if a hero is available for selection in death match and similar competitive game modes. Most heroes are available except for a few special cases like CaseyBroback.
member.param: The hero type to check for death match availability.
member.returns: True if the hero can be used in death match modes, false otherwise.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.GetCurrentMap
member.summary: Retrieves the MapData for the current level based on the game's load mode and settings. This is the primary method for obtaining level data and handles all different load scenarios.
member.returns: The MapData for the current level, or null if no valid level data could be loaded.
member.remarks: This method handles multiple loading scenarios: - Campaign mode: Loads from the current campaign's level array - LoadFromMapdata: Uses the pre-set MapDataToLoad - LoadFromFile: Loads individual level files from disk - Generated: Creates procedurally generated levels The method also handles initial setup when loadMode is NotSet, including editor test levels and last played custom levels. This is called by Map.LoadMap to get the level data.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.GetMapDataForCampaign
member.summary: Loads map data for the current campaign based on game mode and level number. Handles special cases for BroDown mode (player count based levels), versus modes with rotation, and victory screen for completed campaigns.
member.returns: The MapData for the current level, or victory screen data if the campaign is complete.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.GetMapDataFromFile
member.summary: Loads map data from a file on disk. Attempts to load as a campaign first, falling back to single level loading if that fails. Updates the level file name tracking.
member.returns: The loaded MapData, or null if no valid file name is set.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.GotoNextCampaignScene
member.summary: Handles the transition to the next scene in the campaign sequence, including special handling for the helicopter intro cutscene at the start of the main campaign.
member.remarks: This method has special logic for the campaign start: - If at level 0 (campaign start) and haven't shown the helicopter intro for non-custom campaigns, it loads the "MissionScreenVietnam" intro scene first - Otherwise, it loads the standard campaign scene The method sets the appropriate scene in GameState and calls GameModeController.LoadNextScene to handle the actual transition. Used when starting a new campaign from menus.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.GotoNextLevel
member.summary: Advances to the next level in the current campaign by incrementing the level number and reloading the current scene. Resets to level 0 if past the end of the campaign.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.ResetLevelAndGameModeToDefault
member.summary: Resets all level selection and game mode settings to their default values. This comprehensive reset is called when returning to the main menu or starting a fresh game session.
member.remarks: This method performs a complete reset of the game state including: - Setting current level to 0 and clearing fail counts - Resetting all campaign loading flags and modes - Clearing custom campaign and workshop data - Resetting player wins and statistics - Clearing triggered once-only triggers - Setting the default campaign based on build type (Expendabros, Exhibition, or standard) This ensures a clean slate when starting new game sessions.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.RestartCampaignScene
member.summary: Initiates a restart of the current campaign scene by triggering a fade transition. This method is called when the player chooses to retry a failed level.
member.remarks: The method triggers a 2-second solid fade effect. The actual scene reload is handled by the fade system once the fade completes. This is typically called from the level failure screen when the player chooses to retry instead of returning to the menu.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.CompleteCurrentLevel
member.summary: Marks the current level as complete by incrementing the level number and saving progress for online campaigns. Resets the helicopter intro flag for the next level.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.DmRotationLevelLoadComplete(Campaign)
member.summary: Called when a deathmatch rotation level finishes downloading. Assigns the campaign to the appropriate rotation slot and initiates download of the next level if needed.
member.param: The downloaded campaign to add to the rotation.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.FindOnlineDeathmatchLevels
member.summary: Queries Steam Workshop for deathmatch levels using either vote ranking (70% chance) or trend ranking (30% chance). Initiates the asynchronous query and sets up the callback handler.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.GetFormattedCampaignName(System.String)
member.summary: Formats a campaign file name into a display name by converting to uppercase, removing prefixes, and looking up formatted names. Used for campaign display in UI and presence text.
member.param: The raw campaign file name to format (e.g., "WM_Mission1").
member.returns: The formatted campaign name (e.g., "2" for "MISSION1") or the cleaned uppercase name if no lookup exists.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.LoadNextVersusCampaign
member.summary: Loads the next campaign in the versus rotation system. Handles both online deathmatch rotation with Steam Workshop levels and offline rotation with local campaigns. Manages the campaign queue and initiates downloads for upcoming levels.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.SetLevelPresence
member.summary: Sets the platform-specific presence text based on the current campaign and level. Displays different text for challenge levels, arcade levels, and campaign levels.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.UGC_UGCQueryCompleted(Steamworks.SteamUGCQueryCompleted_t,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Callback handler for Steam Workshop queries. Processes the returned deathmatch levels, creates WorkshopLevelDetails objects, and selects levels for the current and next rotation slots.
member.param: The Steam UGC query result containing workshop level information.
Whether the query failed due to an IO error.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.campaignToLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the campaign that should be loaded. This property stores and retrieves the campaign name from the GameState singleton instance, ensuring that the campaign name persists across scene transitions.
member.remarks: This is a key property used throughout the game to determine which campaign should be loaded. It's set by various menu systems (CustomCampaignMenu, HeroSelectController, etc.) and read by the level loading system. The value is stored in GameState.Instance.campaignName to maintain consistency across the game session.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.currentCampaign
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently loaded Campaign object containing all level data for the active campaign. Setting this property also updates the campaign name in GameState for persistence.
member.remarks: This property holds the actual Campaign object with all its levels, header information, and metadata. When set, it automatically updates GameState.Instance.campaignName with either the header name (if available) or the campaign's base name. This is the primary way to access level data for the current campaign. Setting to null clears the campaign name in GameState.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.levelFileNameToLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the level file to be loaded. This property is used when loading individual level files from disk rather than campaign files. The property acts as a wrapper around the internal _levelFileNameToLoad field.
member.remarks: This property is typically set in the GetMapDataFromFile method to store the filename of the level that should be loaded. It's used by various game components like MainMenu, QuickLauncher, and SelectStartingAdvantage to specify which level file should be loaded when the game starts or transitions between scenes.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.loadCustomCampaign
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a custom campaign (user-created or downloaded) should be loaded instead of the built-in campaigns. This flag is stored in the GameState singleton and controls the campaign loading behavior.
member.remarks: When true, the game will attempt to load campaigns from disk (either user-created or published workshop campaigns) rather than from the built-in resources. This flag is set by custom campaign menus and affects how campaigns are loaded in GetMapDataForCampaign. It's reset to false when returning to main menu or starting standard campaigns.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.returnToWorldMap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the game should return to the world map after completing the current level or campaign. This property controls the flow between the world map mode and individual levels.
member.remarks: When true, completing a level will return the player to the 3D world map instead of proceeding to the next level in sequence. This is used for the world map campaign mode where players can choose which territory to tackle next. The value is stored in GameState to persist across scene transitions.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.CurrentCampaign
member.summary: Private backing field that stores the currently loaded campaign. Accessed through the currentCampaign property which handles campaign validation and loading.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.DefaultCampaign
member.summary: The default campaign to load when no specific campaign is selected. Initialized to the offline campaign ("vietnam") by default.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.ExpendabrosCampaign
member.summary: The campaign name for the Expendabros crossover content. Set to "Expendabros_Campaign" to identify and load Expendabros-specific levels.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.MapDataToLoad
member.summary: Stores pre-loaded map data to be used when LoadFromMapdata mode is active. Allows external code to set specific map data before level loading.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.OfflineCampaign
member.summary: The default campaign name used for offline single-player gameplay. Set to "vietnam" to use the standard Vietnam campaign levels.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.OnlineCampaign
member.summary: The default campaign name used for online multiplayer gameplay. Set to "VietnamNetworked" to use the networked version of the Vietnam campaign levels.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController._levelFileNameToLoad
member.summary: Internal backing field for the levelFileNameToLoad property. Stores the file name of a level to be loaded from disk.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.currentVSRotationCampaign
member.summary: Stores the current campaign in the versus mode rotation for online deathmatch games. When using online deathmatch level rotation, this holds the campaign that is currently active. Gets set when a deathmatch rotation level completes loading via DmRotationLevelLoadComplete. Used by LoadNextVersusCampaign to determine which campaign to load as the current campaign.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.currentWorkshopLevel
member.summary: Stores details about the currently loaded Steam Workshop level. Used when playing custom user-created content from the Workshop. Null when playing built-in campaigns.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.defaultDeathmatchCampaignIncludedInRotation
member.summary: Whether the default deathmatch campaign should be included in the versus rotation. Allows the built-in deathmatch maps to be part of the rotation.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.defaultRaceCampaignIncludedInRotation
member.summary: Whether the default race campaign should be included in the versus rotation. Allows the built-in race maps to be part of the rotation.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.haveSetListCallResult
member.summary: Private flag tracking whether the Steam Workshop query callback has been initialized. Prevents duplicate callback registration when querying Workshop content.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.isOnlineCampaign
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the currently loaded campaign is an online multiplayer campaign. Used to determine networking behavior and level selection logic.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.lastVersusCampaign
member.summary: Private field tracking the index of the last versus campaign played. Initialized to -100 to ensure no campaign matches on first selection. Used to prevent immediate repetition of versus campaigns.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.levelDetailsCurrentVSRotationCampaign
member.summary: Stores the workshop level details for the current campaign in the versus rotation. Contains metadata about the current online deathmatch level including file ID and creator info. Set when online VS levels are loaded from Steam Workshop query results. Used to track which specific workshop level is currently active in the rotation.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.levelDetailsNextVSRotationCampaign
member.summary: Stores the workshop level details for the next campaign queued in the versus rotation. Contains metadata about the next online deathmatch level to be loaded after the current one. Set when selecting random levels from the online VS levels list during Steam query processing. Cleared when the next level is promoted to current in LoadNextVersusCampaign.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.listCallResult
member.summary: Private Steam API callback result for Workshop content queries. Used internally when fetching lists of available Workshop levels for versus mode or custom campaigns.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.loadPublishedCampaign
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the game should load a published campaign from the Workshop or other external source. Checked during campaign loading to determine the source.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.nextVSRotationCampaign
member.summary: Stores the next campaign queued in the versus mode rotation for online deathmatch games. When the current VS rotation campaign ends, this campaign becomes the new current campaign. Gets set by DmRotationLevelLoadComplete when a second campaign loads while one is already current. Cleared after being promoted to current campaign in LoadNextVersusCampaign.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.onlineVSLevels
member.summary: Private list storing available online versus mode levels from the Workshop. Used to randomly select levels for versus mode rotation without repeating recently played levels.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.usingOnlineDMLevelRotation
member.summary: Indicates whether the game is currently using online deathmatch level rotation mode. When true, LoadNextVersusCampaign will use the VS rotation campaign fields instead of standard progression. Set to false during initialization and controlled by the deathmatch menu system. Determines whether to use rotation-based campaign loading for versus mode.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.versusRotationList
member.summary: List of campaign file names included in the versus mode rotation. Used for offline deathmatch and race modes to cycle through available maps.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.CurrentLevelNum
member.summary: Gets or sets the current level number (index) within the active campaign. This property wraps GameState.Instance.levelNumber for consistency.
member.remarks: This zero-based index indicates which level in the campaign array is currently active. It's incremented when completing levels and reset when starting new campaigns. The value persists in GameState across scene transitions.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.exhibitionCount
member.summary: Counter for exhibition mode levels. Initialized to -1, likely incremented during exhibition gameplay to track progress or determine exhibition-specific behavior.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.levelNumBrodownBurningJungle
member.summary: Constant defining the level number for the Brodown Burning Jungle level. Set to 1, used for identifying this specific level in campaigns or level sequences.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.levelNumBrodownCity
member.summary: Constant defining the level number for the Brodown City level. Set to 2, used for identifying this specific level in campaigns or level sequences.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.shownHelicopterIntro
member.summary: Flag tracking whether the helicopter intro sequence has been shown to the player. Prevents the intro from playing multiple times when starting campaigns from the beginning.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.totalNumberOfArcadeLevels
member.summary: The total number of levels available in arcade mode. Set to 63, used to determine when players have completed all arcade content and for progress tracking.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.GetCurrentCampaignLength
member.summary: Gets the total number of levels in the current campaign based on the game mode.
member.returns: The number of levels in the current campaign. Returns 1 for cutscene mode, 0 if no campaign is loaded, or the actual campaign length for other modes.
member.remarks: This method handles special cases: - Cutscene mode always returns 1 (single scene) - Returns 0 if currentCampaign is null - Otherwise returns the Length property of the current campaign Used for determining when the player has completed a campaign and for progress tracking.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.IsCustomCampaign
member.summary: Determines whether the currently loaded campaign is a custom campaign (user-created or from Steam Workshop).
member.returns: True if either loadCustomCampaign or isOnlineCampaign flags are set, false for built-in campaigns.
member.remarks: This method is used throughout the game to determine if special handling is needed for custom content, such as different victory screens, achievement restrictions, or save game behavior. Custom campaigns include both locally created campaigns and those downloaded from Steam Workshop.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.IsInProcGenCampaign
member.summary: Determines whether the game is currently playing procedurally generated levels rather than pre-designed campaign levels.
member.returns: True if not in world map mode and the load mode is set to Generated, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Procedurally generated campaigns create levels on the fly using the map generation system. This mode is mutually exclusive with world map campaigns and affects how levels are loaded and progressed through.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.IsInWorldMapCampaign
member.summary: Determines whether the game is currently in world map campaign mode where players progress through a 3D world map selecting territories.
member.returns: True if the returnToWorldMap flag is set, false otherwise.
member.remarks: World map campaigns use a different progression system where players return to a 3D world map between levels to choose their next territory. This affects save systems, progression tracking, and scene transitions.

member.name: M:LevelSelectionController.SpawnAsheAndHisCar
member.summary: Determines whether Ash Williams and his car should spawn in the current level. This is used for special Evil Dead crossover content in specific levels.
member.returns: True if the current level's description contains "deep throat" (case-insensitive), false otherwise.
member.remarks: This method checks the level description for a specific keyword to enable special Evil Dead content. The check is case-insensitive. This appears to be an Easter egg or special crossover feature that spawns Ash Williams (from Evil Dead) and his iconic car in certain levels.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.CurrentGameModeScene
member.summary: Gets the appropriate scene name for the current game mode. Different game modes use different scenes to handle their specific gameplay requirements.
member.remarks: Returns the scene name based on GameModeController.GameMode: - ExplosionRun: Returns ExplosionRunSceneName - DeathMatch: Returns DeathmatchSceneName - SuicideHorde: Returns SuicideHordeSceneName - Race: Returns RaceRunSceneName - Default: Returns CampaignScene All non-campaign modes currently use "Test Evan2" as their scene name.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.CustomCampaignVictoryScene
member.summary: Gets the name of the victory scene to use when completing a custom campaign. Returns different scene names based on whether Steam is enabled to handle different victory screen requirements.
member.remarks: Returns "VictoryCustomCampaignSteam" when Steam is enabled (for Steam Workshop integration and leaderboards), or "VictoryCustomCampaign" for non-Steam builds. This allows custom campaigns to have appropriate victory screens with or without Steam features.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.ExhibitionCampaign
member.summary: Gets the name of the campaign to use in exhibition mode, which varies based on demo settings and current scene. This property determines which special campaign should be loaded for exhibition/demo builds.
member.remarks: The property returns different campaigns based on the current state: - "Victory" if already in the Victory scene - "AlienExhibition" if the alien demo is selected - "BossRushCampaign" if the boss rush demo is selected - "VIETNAM_EXHIBITION_TWITCHCON" as the default exhibition campaign This is primarily used for special demo builds shown at conventions or events.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.MainMenuScene
member.summary: Gets the appropriate main menu scene name based on the build type. Returns different scene names for the Expendabros promotional build versus the standard Broforce build.
member.remarks: Returns "MainMenuExpendabros" for Expendabros builds (a special promotional version of the game), or "MainMenu" for standard Broforce builds. This allows the game to have different main menus for different versions while using the same codebase.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.BrodownSceneName
member.summary: The scene name used for brodown game mode. Default value is "Test Evan2".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.CampaignScene
member.summary: The current scene name used for campaign mode. Default value is "Test Evan2".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.CampaignSceneDefault
member.summary: The default scene name for campaign mode. Used as a fallback when no specific campaign scene is set. Default value is "Test Evan2".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.DeathmatchSceneName
member.summary: The scene name used for deathmatch game mode. Default value is "Test Evan2".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.ExplosionRunSceneName
member.summary: The scene name used for explosion run game mode. Default value is "Test Evan2".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.GameOverScene
member.summary: The scene name for the game over cutscene. Set to "CutsceneGameOver" which plays when all players have died and no lives remain.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.HellArcade
member.summary: The scene name for the Hell-themed arcade mode. Set to "WM_Hell" which represents the Hell world map used in arcade gameplay.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.HeroSelectScreen
member.summary: The scene name for the hero selection screen. Set to "HeroSelect" which allows players to choose their character before starting gameplay.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.IntroScene
member.summary: The scene name for the game's intro cutscene. Set to "Intro" which plays when starting a new campaign from the beginning.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.JoinScene
member.summary: The scene name used for joining multiplayer games. Default value is "newJoin".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.MainMenuSceneExpendabros
member.summary: The scene name for the Expendabros-specific main menu. Set to "MainMenuExpendabros" to provide a themed menu for the Expendabros crossover content.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.OfflineCustomVictoryScene
member.summary: The scene name for the victory screen shown after completing offline custom campaigns. Set to "VictoryCustomCampaign" to provide a different ending for user-created content.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.RaceRunSceneName
member.summary: The scene name used for race game mode. Default value is "Test Evan2".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.SuicideHordeSceneName
member.summary: The scene name used for suicide horde game mode. Default value is "Test Evan2".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.VictoryScene
member.summary: The scene name for the standard victory screen. Set to "Polaroid" which displays the victory polaroid photo sequence after completing a campaign.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.WorldMapScene
member.summary: The scene name for the world map screen. Default value is "WorldMap3D".

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController._MainMenuScene
member.summary: Private constant storing the main menu scene name. Set to "MainMenu" and used internally for scene transitions back to the main game menu.

member.name: F:LevelSelectionController.levelNumBrodownJungle
member.summary: Constant defining the level number for the Brodown jungle level. Value is 0.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.CurrentlyInGame
member.summary: Gets whether the player is currently in an active game (not in the main menu).
member.remarks: Returns true if not in the main menu scene, false otherwise. This is a simple helper property that inverts IsMainMenuScene for convenience. Used by various systems to determine if gameplay systems should be active.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.IsCampaignScene
member.summary: Gets whether the currently active scene is the campaign gameplay scene.
member.remarks: Performs a case-insensitive comparison with the CampaignScene name ("Test Evan2"). Returns true when actively playing campaign levels, false in menus or other game modes.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.IsLoadingScene
member.summary: Gets whether the currently active scene is the loading screen scene.
member.remarks: Checks if the active scene is "LoadingScreen" (case-insensitive). This is displayed during scene transitions and asset loading between gameplay scenes.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.IsMainMenuScene
member.summary: Gets whether the currently active scene is the main menu scene.
member.remarks: Performs a case-insensitive comparison between the active scene name and the MainMenuScene property. This accounts for different main menu scenes in different builds (standard vs Expendabros). Used to determine if menu-specific behavior should be active.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.IsMainMenuSceneLoading
member.summary: Gets whether the main menu scene is currently set to load next (during scene transitions).
member.remarks: Checks if GameState.Instance.sceneToLoad matches the main menu scene name (case-insensitive). This is useful for systems that need to prepare for returning to the main menu before the scene actually changes.

member.name: P:LevelSelectionController.IsWorldMapScene
member.summary: Gets whether the currently active scene is the 3D world map scene.
member.remarks: Checks if the active scene is "WorldMap3D" (case-insensitive). The world map is used in the world map campaign mode where players select territories to conquer.

member.name: M:MainMenu.Awake
member.summary: Initializes the main menu when the scene loads, setting up all core menu systems and resetting game state. Performs platform-specific setup, clears player progress data, initializes multiplayer connections, and begins the delayed menu initialization process. Also resets various game states to ensure a clean main menu experience.

member.name: M:MainMenu.DelayInitializeMenu
member.summary: Coroutine that delays menu initialization by 3 seconds, then checks for PlayTogether hosting status before initializing. If hosting PlayTogether, it checks multiplayer status with the host user before proceeding. Otherwise, directly calls InitializeMenu() after the delay.
member.returns: IEnumerator for coroutine execution.

member.name: M:MainMenu.InitializeMenu
member.summary: Completes the menu initialization process after the initial delay. Activates the menu highlight, sets the menu as active, restores any previously saved highlight index, and transitions to the campaign menu if hosting PlayTogether.

member.name: M:MainMenu.SetupItems
member.summary: Dynamically builds the main menu items list based on build configuration and player progress. Adds conditional menu items like Versus, Custom Campaign, Level Editor, and Join Online based on build type. Adjusts between "Start" and "Continue" arcade campaign based on player progress. Handles special logic for procedural generation test builds.

member.name: M:MainMenu.Start
member.summary: Called at scene start to finalize initialization. Sets time scale to normal, checks for immediate custom campaign transition if requested, plays the Broforce announcement sound, and stops all controller rumble effects.

member.name: M:MainMenu.Update
member.summary: Main update loop that handles initialization checks, editor-specific unlock cheats (F5 key), click-to-start text animation effects, mouse click detection for menu activation, and cheat code input processing.

member.name: F:MainMenu.clickToStartMesh
member.summary: Text mesh component displaying the "click to start" prompt before the main menu is active.

member.name: F:MainMenu.gameStartedThroughtMainMenu
member.summary: Static flag indicating whether the current game session was started through the main menu. Set to true in StartGame() method and used by other systems to determine game initialization context.

member.name: F:MainMenu.hasInitialized
member.summary: Tracks whether the menu has completed its initialization process, preventing input processing before initialization.

member.name: F:MainMenu.haveCalibrated
member.summary: Flag tracking whether initial calibration has occurred. Checked and set to true during the first Update() call. Purpose appears to be ensuring one-time initialization happens after menu is fully loaded.

member.name: F:MainMenu.instance
member.summary: Static singleton instance of the MainMenu class. Set during Start() initialization and used throughout the codebase for global access to main menu functionality. Checked for null in static methods like Reload().

member.name: F:MainMenu.logo
member.summary: Reference to the game logo GameObject displayed on the main menu. Animated during menu transitions with scaling effects. Hidden when transitioning to submenus and shown when returning to the main menu.

member.name: F:MainMenu.networkedBuild
member.summary: Indicates whether this is a networked build that should transition to the Campaign scene instead of the Join scene.

member.name: F:MainMenu.optionsMenu
member.summary: Reference to the options menu that can be accessed from the main menu.

member.name: F:MainMenu.starFieldAnimation
member.summary: Animation component for the starfield background effect. Plays default animation on menu show and special "starfieldLobbyTransition" animation when transitioning to lobby or custom campaign screens.

member.name: F:MainMenu.wasShown
member.summary: Static flag indicating whether the main menu has been shown at least once during the current game session.

member.name: M:MainMenu.GoBackToMenu
member.summary: Returns to the main menu from a submenu, reactivating the main menu and playing a drum sound effect (attack sound at index 1 with 0.25 volume).

member.name: M:MainMenu.GoToOptions
member.summary: Transitions from the main menu to the options menu. Deactivates the main menu, activates the options menu, and triggers the options menu transition-in animation.

member.name: M:MainMenu.HideRoutine
member.summary: Coroutine that animates hiding the menu with a scaling effect over 1 second. Scales both the menu and optionally the logo from normal size to an enlarged size based on ScaleFactor, then deactivates the GameObjects when complete.
member.param: Whether to also hide and scale the logo GameObject.
member.returns: IEnumerator for coroutine execution.

member.name: M:MainMenu.RunInput
member.summary: Processes input for menu navigation, disabling up/down movement when transitioning between menus or showing explanations. Overrides base Menu class input handling to prevent navigation during transitions.

member.name: M:MainMenu.Show
member.summary: Shows the main menu by activating both the menu and logo GameObjects, then starting the show animation coroutine.

member.name: M:MainMenu.ShowHideMenu
member.summary: Manages menu show/hide coroutines, stopping any existing coroutine before starting a new one to prevent animation conflicts.
member.param: The coroutine method to execute for showing or hiding the menu.

member.name: M:MainMenu.ShowRoutine
member.summary: Coroutine that animates showing the menu with a scaling effect. Blocks input during animation, plays starfield animation, scales menu and logo from zero to normal size over approximately 1.2 seconds, then plays camera shake and impact sound when complete.
member.returns: IEnumerator for coroutine execution.

member.name: M:MainMenu.TransitionToOnlineOrOffline(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Static method that transitions from the main menu to either the online/offline selection menu or directly to custom campaign/exhibition mode based on build type and previous menu selections.
member.param: Whether online multiplayer is available for the current platform/build.

member.name: F:MainMenu.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Scale multiplier applied during menu hide animations. Used in the HideRoutine to scale up the menu and logo by this factor (default 1.0) as they fade out. Affects the visual transition effect when hiding menus.

member.name: F:MainMenu._previousHighlightIndex
member.summary: Static field that stores the previously highlighted menu option index. Used to restore menu highlight position when returning to the main menu from other screens. Reset to 0 after being applied.

member.name: F:MainMenu.currentInput
member.summary: Accumulates keyboard input characters for cheat code detection. Characters are appended as typed and checked against known cheat strings. Initialized to empty string and grows with each character input during gameplay.

member.name: F:MainMenu.deathmatchCampaignSelectMenu
member.summary: Reference to the deathmatch campaign selection menu UI element. Used when transitioning to deathmatch mode from various menu navigation paths. Activated and transitioned in when players choose deathmatch game modes.

member.name: F:MainMenu.explanationTime
member.summary: Timestamp recording when the transition to the explanation screen began. Initialized to -1.5f.

member.name: F:MainMenu.hasOpenedWebPage
member.summary: Flag preventing multiple Steam store page openings in a single session. Set to true after first opening the Steam store URL, preventing subsequent calls to GoToSteamPage from opening duplicate browser tabs.

member.name: F:MainMenu.showHideRoutine
member.summary: Coroutine reference for the current menu show/hide animation routine. Stores the active coroutine to allow stopping previous animations before starting new ones. Set to null when animations complete.

member.name: F:MainMenu.transitioning
member.summary: Flag indicating the menu is currently transitioning between scenes, preventing input during transitions.

member.name: F:MainMenu.transitioningToExplanation
member.summary: Flag indicating the menu is transitioning to the game explanation screen.

member.name: F:MainMenu.worldMapOrArcadeMenu
member.summary: Reference to the world map or arcade mode selection menu. Used when transitioning from the main menu to campaign selection screens. Activated and transitioned in when players select campaign or arcade modes.

member.name: M:MainMenu.CustomCampaign
member.summary: Initiates transition to custom campaign menu after checking if the primary user has UGC restrictions. Shows an error dialog if restricted, otherwise sets up arcade difficulty mode and transitions to the difficulty menu with custom campaign flag set.

member.name: M:MainMenu.FilmMode
member.summary: Opens film mode for creating cinematics by activating the level editor in film mode and loading the FilmScene.

member.name: M:MainMenu.GoToCampaignMenu
member.summary: Transitions to the campaign selection menu (world map or arcade). In exhibition build mode, directly starts arcade mode instead. Otherwise deactivates main menu and activates the world map/arcade selection menu.

member.name: M:MainMenu.GoToCampaignMenu
member.summary: Navigates to the campaign selection menu. For exhibition builds, directly starts arcade mode. For regular builds, transitions to the world map or arcade menu.

member.name: M:MainMenu.LevelEditor
member.summary: Opens the level editor by setting up the game state for level editing mode, loading the last custom level, and transitioning to the campaign scene.

member.name: M:MainMenu.LoadProcGen
member.summary: Loads the procedural generation game mode by loading persistent assets and transitioning to the RogueforceStartingPerk scene.

member.name: M:MainMenu.StartArcade
member.summary: Starts an arcade campaign by resetting all game state, clearing hero unlocks, initializing the default campaign settings, and transitioning to the online/offline selection screen.

member.name: M:MainMenu.StartDeathMatch
member.summary: Opens the deathmatch campaign selection menu and deactivates the main menu.

member.name: M:MainMenu.StartExplosionRun
member.summary: Starts the Explosion Run game mode (beta feature) with the DefaultExplosionRun campaign and displays beta feedback text.

member.name: M:MainMenu.StartRace
member.summary: Starts the Race game mode (beta feature) with the DefaultRace campaign and displays beta feedback text.

member.name: M:MainMenu.StartSuicideHorde
member.summary: Starts the Suicide Horde game mode (beta feature) with the SuibroTest campaign, forcing offline mode, and displays beta feedback text.

member.name: M:MainMenu.TransitionToCustomCampaign
member.summary: Performs the visual transition to the custom campaign menu by playing the starfield lobby transition animation, activating the custom campaign menu GameObject, and hiding the main menu with logo.

member.name: M:MainMenu.TransitionToExplanation
member.summary: Initiates the transition to the game explanation screen by setting the transitioningToExplanation flag and recording the transition time.

member.name: M:MainMenu.TransitionToGame
member.summary: Transitions from the main menu to the game by fading to either the Campaign scene (for networked builds) or the Join scene (for non-networked builds).

member.name: F:MainMenu.customCampaignMenu
member.summary: Reference to the new custom campaign menu UI component. Activated when transitioning to custom campaign selection. GameObject is disabled during initialization and enabled when players select custom campaigns.

member.name: F:MainMenu.gameExplanation
member.summary: Text UI element displaying beta feature explanations. Updated with beta disclaimer text when entering multiplayer or custom campaign features. Shows feedback request message to players during beta features.

member.name: F:MainMenu.thankYouBetaBackerText
member.summary: TextMesh component displaying thank you message to beta backers. Activated alongside beta feature explanations when players access multiplayer or custom campaign features during beta testing.

member.name: M:MainMenu.FindAGameToJoin
member.summary: Initiates the process of finding an online multiplayer game to join by calling TryToGoToLobby with Online mode.

member.name: M:MainMenu.FindALocalGameToJoin
member.summary: Initiates the process of finding a local wireless multiplayer game to join by calling TryToGoToLobby with LocalWireless mode.

member.name: M:MainMenu.HostAGame
member.summary: Initiates the process of hosting an online game by deactivating the main menu and opening the MakeOnlineMenu interface.

member.name: M:MainMenu.RecreateConnectObject
member.summary: Recreates the multiplayer connection object if not immediately going to custom campaign or joining through friend invite. Disconnects existing connection, destroys the current Connect singleton if it exists, and instantiates a new connection prefab. Also releases player movement restrictions.

member.name: M:MainMenu.TransitionToLobby
member.summary: Performs the visual transition to the multiplayer lobby by playing the starfield lobby transition animation, opening the lobby if it exists, and hiding the main menu with logo.

member.name: M:MainMenu.TryToGoToLobby
member.summary: Attempts to transition to the multiplayer lobby after checking the primary user's multiplayer status for the specified mode. Shows a "please wait" overlay during the asynchronous status check, then transitions to lobby on success.
member.param: The multiplayer mode to check status for (Online or LocalWireless).

member.name: F:MainMenu.connectPrefab
member.summary: Prefab reference for the Connect networking component. Instantiated in RecreateConnectObject() to establish or refresh network connections. Used when starting games or resetting network state from the main menu.

member.name: F:MainMenu.lobby
member.summary: Reference to the Lobby component handling multiplayer lobby functionality. Disabled during initialization, then opened via lobby.Open() when transitioning to multiplayer lobby screens from the main menu.

member.name: F:MainMenu.lobbyGUI
member.summary: GameObject reference for the lobby GUI interface. Currently unused in the codebase - only the field declaration exists with no implementation references. Likely deprecated or placeholder for future use.

member.name: M:MainMenu.PlayImpactSound
member.summary: Static method that plays the main menu impact sound effect through the Sound singleton at 0.25 volume if the main menu instance exists.

member.name: F:MainMenu.CameraShake
member.summary: Animation component for camera shake effects during menu transitions. Played after the menu show animation completes to add impact to the menu appearance. Triggered alongside impact sound for dramatic effect.

member.name: F:MainMenu.impactSound
member.summary: Audio clip for the impact sound effect played during menu transitions. Played through the Sound singleton at 0.25f volume when menus finish showing. Creates audio feedback for menu animation completion.

member.name: M:MainMenu.CheckCheatString(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the current input string ends with the specified cheat string, performing a case-insensitive comparison.
member.param: The cheat code string to check against the current input.
member.returns: True if the current input ends with the cheat string (case-insensitive), false otherwise.

member.name: M:MainMenu.CheckCheats
member.summary: Monitors keyboard input for letters A through Z and processes each character through the cheat code system by calling ProcessCharacter for each key pressed.

member.name: M:MainMenu.ClearUnlocks
member.summary: Clears all hero unlocks through HeroUnlockController and updates the visual appearance of any "RESET" menu items by setting their text color to a dark gray (0.06, 0.06, 0.06, 1.0).

member.name: M:MainMenu.ExitGame
member.summary: Exits the game application by calling Application.Quit().

member.name: M:MainMenu.Feedback
member.summary: Opens a web browser to navigate to the Broforce game forums feedback page.

member.name: M:MainMenu.GoToSteamPage
member.summary: Opens the Steam store page for Broforce in a web browser. Prevents multiple page opens by tracking if the page has already been opened.

member.name: M:MainMenu.ProcessCharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: Processes keyboard input characters for cheat code detection. Appends the character to the current input string and checks for various cheat codes including teabagging, unlock all bros, unlock all territories, and special editor modes.
member.param: The character input from keyboard.

member.name: M:MainMenu.Reload
member.summary: Static method that reloads the main menu scene if a main menu instance exists, using GameState.LoadLevel with the main menu scene name from LevelSelectionController.

member.name: M:Map.BlindUnits(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Blinds all enemy units within range of a position. Blinded units have impaired vision and targeting abilities.
member.param: Player number performing the blind effect
X position of the blind effect center
Y position of the blind effect center
Radius of the blind effect
Duration of the blindness in seconds (default 9)

member.name: M:Map.BurnBlocksAround(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Burns blocks in the four cardinal directions (up, down, left, right) from a center position using raycasting. Can force burn non-oily blocks or only burn oily blocks based on the forced parameter.
member.param: Amount of fire damage to apply
Grid column position of the center
Grid row position of the center
If true, burns all blocks; if false, only burns oily blocks
Optional GameObject to ignore during raycasting
member.returns: Number of blocks that were burned

member.name: M:Map.BurnDamageBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Burns and damages a block at the specified grid position, sending both Damage and ForceBurn messages to all objects within a 6 unit radius. Used for guaranteed fire spreading to blocks.
member.param: Amount of fire damage to apply
Grid column position
Grid row position

member.name: M:Map.BurnLargeObjects(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Burns large objects at a specific grid position by sending fire damage messages to all objects within a 7 unit radius sphere. Commonly used for spreading fire to destructible scenery.
member.param: Amount of fire damage to apply
Grid column position
Grid row position
member.returns: True if any objects were found and damaged, false otherwise

member.name: M:Map.BurnLargeObjects(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Burns large objects at a specific world position by sending fire damage messages to all objects within a 7 unit radius sphere. Overload that accepts world coordinates instead of grid coordinates.
member.param: Amount of fire damage to apply

member.name: M:Map.DoLevelEndExplosions
member.summary: Coroutine that continuously generates random explosions across the visible screen area.
member.returns: An IEnumerator for the coroutine execution
member.remarks: This infinite coroutine creates explosions at random screen positions during the level-ending sequence. For each explosion attempt, it converts a random screen position to world coordinates with some overflow (140% screen width/height, centered at 80%). It then checks if the position contains solid blocks, background blocks, or ladders before creating an explosion there. The coroutine waits 0.1-0.4 seconds between explosions, creating a dramatic ending effect. Up to 50 position attempts are made per cycle to find a valid explosion location.

member.returns: Number of units killed by the explosion

member.name: M:Map.MakeAllBlocksUltraTough
member.summary: Sets all blocks in the map to have extremely high health, making them virtually indestructible.
member.remarks: This method iterates through all blocks in the map grid and sets their health to 1,000,000. It's typically called before the level-ending explosion sequence when destruction recording is enabled, ensuring that the terrain remains intact for replay or recording purposes despite the visual explosion effects. Only non-null blocks are affected.

member.name: M:Map.MakeLevelEndExplosion(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a single explosion at the specified position using a pooled explosive object.
member.param: The world position where the explosion should occur
member.remarks: This method pulls an explosive from the LevelEndExplosionBank pool, resets its state, positions it, and triggers the explosion. The explosive is moved from the bank to the active list for tracking. If the bank is empty, PopulateLevelEndExplosionBank() is called to refill it. This pooling system ensures smooth performance during the rapid explosion sequence at level end.

member.name: M:Map.PopulateLevelEndExplosionBank
member.summary: Pre-allocates a pool of hidden explosive objects for use in the level-ending explosion sequence.
member.remarks: This method creates a bank of 10 HiddenExplosives instances that are reused during the level-end explosion sequence. The explosives are instantiated from the hiddenExplosivePrefabReference asset, deactivated, and marked with DontDestroyOnLoad to persist across scenes. This pooling approach avoids the performance cost of instantiating explosives during the intense ending sequence.

member.name: M:Map.RegisterTargetableObject(TargetableObject)
member.summary: Registers an object that can be targeted by AI units, homing projectiles, or auto-aim systems. Targetable objects include enemies, destructible props, or any gameplay element that can be selected as a valid target for attacks.
member.param: The TargetableObject to register for targeting systems.

member.name: M:Map.RemoveTargetableObject(TargetableObject)
member.summary: Removes an object from the targetable tracking system, typically when it is destroyed or should no longer be considered a valid target. This prevents AI and homing projectiles from continuing to target defunct objects.
member.param: The TargetableObject to remove from targeting consideration.

member.name: M:Map.ReviveDeadUnits(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,TestVanDammeAnim,System.Boolean)

member.param: X position of the revival center
Y position of the revival center
Radius within which to revive units
Player number to assign to revived units
Maximum number of units to revive
Whether revived units should be player-controlled
The source object performing the revival
Whether hero units (Bros) can be revived (default true)
member.returns: True if at least one unit was successfully revived, false otherwise

member.name: M:Map.RollOntoUnits(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Causes units at the specified grid position to be rolled onto, applying the RollOnto effect to all non-heavy units in the area.
member.param: Grid column position
Grid row position
Direction of the roll to apply to affected units

member.name: M:Map.StartLevelEndExplosions
member.summary: Begins the local level-ending explosion sequence on this client.
member.remarks: This private method is called via RPC from StartLevelEndExplosionsOverNetwork(). It sets the explosionsHaveStarted flag and starts the DoLevelEndExplosions coroutine which continuously creates explosions across the screen. This method ensures the explosion sequence only starts once per level completion.

member.name: M:Map.StartLevelEndExplosionsOverNetwork
member.summary: Initiates the level-ending explosion sequence across all networked clients.
member.remarks: This method checks if explosions have already started to prevent duplicate triggering. If the map data is set to record destruction, it first makes all blocks ultra-tough to preserve the terrain structure during the ending sequence. The method then sends an RPC to all clients to synchronize the explosion start. The actual explosion sequence is handled by StartLevelEndExplosions() on each client.

Radius of the stun effect
Duration of the stun in seconds

Radius of the tear gas effect
Duration of the tear gas effect in seconds (default 9)

member.name: F:Map.enemyDeathListeners
member.summary: List of triggers that respond to enemy deaths. Listeners are registered via RegisterEnemyDeathListener and removed via RemoveEnemyDeathListener. Used for mission objectives, wave spawning, and event triggering based on enemy elimination. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.explosionsHaveStarted
member.summary: Tracks whether level end explosions have been initiated. Set to true when StartLevelEndExplosions is called to prevent multiple coroutines from running the continuous explosion effects. Used to ensure the explosion sequence only starts once per level.

member.name: F:Map.nearestDist
member.summary: Temporary storage for the nearest distance found during proximity searches. Used by various nearest entity search methods (GetNearestUnit, GetNearestCheckpoint, etc.) to track the shortest distance while iterating through candidates. Optimizes performance by avoiding repeated distance allocations.

member.name: F:Map.targetableObjects
member.summary: List of objects that can be targeted by AI and auto-aim systems. Objects are registered via RegisterTargetableObject and removed via RemoveTargetableObject. Used by GetNearestTargetableObject for finding valid targets within range, considering player allegiance and boss target priorities. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: M:Map.AddSlime(SlimeGroundCover,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,DirectionEnum)

The amount of slime damage/thickness to add to the surface.

The row index of the block to add slime to.
The direction face of the block where slime should be added (Up, Down, Left, or Right).
member.returns: True if slime was successfully added; false if the block is invalid, immune to slime, or doesn't have an open face.
member.remarks: Slime can only be added to solid blocks with an adjacent empty space. If slime already exists on the surface, the amount is added to it. Otherwise, a new SlimeGroundCover instance is created.

member.name: M:Map.AddTaggedObject(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.String)

The string identifier to associate with the object. Must not be null or empty.

member.name: M:Map.CallFakeHelicopter(UnityEngine.Vector2,System.Single)
