member.name: M:Map.CheckPersistBlocksPastLevelLoad
member.summary: Checks whether blocks should be persisted after a level load and either maintains or destroys them accordingly. This method is called after level transitions to handle the persistence state.
member.remarks: Only processes persistence if loading time optimizations are active. Sets hasPersistedPastLevelLoad to true if persistence is enabled, otherwise calls DestroyPersistantBlocks to clear any persisted blocks.

member.name: M:Map.ClearPersistenBlocksInstant
member.summary: Immediately clears all persisted blocks without waiting for a level transition. This provides a way to force-clear persistence state during gameplay.
member.remarks: Resets the hasPersistedPastLevelLoad flag and calls DestroyPersistantBlocks to remove all persisted blocks immediately.

member.name: M:Map.ConstrainToBlocks(UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constrains movement to prevent objects from passing through solid blocks, calculating collision responses and bounce directions. Handles multi-frame movements by breaking them into smaller steps.
member.param: The MonoBehaviour object being constrained (used for special handling of grenades).
The current X position of the object.
The current Y position of the object.
The collision radius of the object.
Input/Output: The attempted X movement. Modified to valid movement amount on collision.
Input/Output: The attempted Y movement. Modified to valid movement amount on collision.
Output: Set to true if horizontal movement should be reversed (bounce).
Output: Set to true if vertical movement should be reversed (bounce).
If true, only collides with ground layer; if false, includes other collision layers.
member.returns: True if a collision occurred and movement was constrained; false if movement is unobstructed.
member.remarks: Handles large movements (>16 units) by recursively breaking them into smaller steps. Checks collisions at destination position and adjusts movement to stop at block boundaries.

member.name: M:Map.Create4AmmoAndRevives(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a 2x2 arrangement of ammunition and revival crates at the specified position. The arrangement includes two ammo crates (top), one revive crate (bottom-left), and one damage crate (bottom-right).

The column index for block array placement
The row index for block array placement
Whether to run block setup logic (connections to adjacent blocks)
member.remarks: Sets the active theme to jungle theme for crate selection. Each crate is properly registered in the blocks array, networked, and initialized. If setupBlocks is true, establishes connections to adjacent blocks and runs FirstFrame initialization.

member.name: M:Map.CreateExitPortal(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Creates a hero level exit portal at the specified position, typically used for level completion.
member.param: The base position where the portal should be created.
member.remarks: The portal is instantiated at an offset position (x+16, y+112) from the provided coordinates to properly align with the game's grid system. The portal is registered with the networking system using a deterministic ID for multiplayer synchronization.

member.name: M:Map.CreateExitPortal(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Creates a hero level exit portal at the specified position. The portal is positioned with a vertical offset of 112 units and a horizontal offset of 16 units from the provided coordinates.
member.param: The base position where the portal should be created
member.remarks: The portal is instantiated from the exitPortalPrefabReference asset and registered with the game's networking system using a deterministic network ID. This ensures the portal is properly synchronized across all clients in multiplayer sessions.

member.name: M:Map.CreateRemoteControlCar(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates and networks a remote control explosive car at the specified position.
member.param: The x-coordinate for spawning the car
The y-coordinate for spawning the car
member.returns: The created RemoteControlExplosiveCar instance
member.remarks: This method instantiates a networked remote control car from the remoteCarPrefabReference asset. The car is created at the specified coordinates with identity rotation. The Networking.Instantiate call ensures the car is properly synchronized across all clients. These cars are typically used as player-controlled explosive devices in gameplay.

member.name: M:Map.CrossProduct(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the 2D cross product (scalar) of vectors formed by three points.
member.param: The origin point for both vectors
The end point of the first vector
The end point of the second vector
member.returns: The scalar cross product of vectors AB and AC
member.remarks: This method computes the 2D cross product (z-component) of vectors from point A to points B and C. The result's magnitude represents twice the area of the triangle formed by the three points, and its sign indicates the winding order (clockwise or counterclockwise). This is used in geometric calculations, particularly for determining which side of a line a point lies on and in distance calculations. Note the unusual array notation (e.g., pointB[0]) instead of pointB.x, which may be a decompilation artifact.

member.name: M:Map.DamageBackground(UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Damages background and foreground blocks within a circular radius. This method is used for explosive damage that affects the destructible terrain behind the main play area.
member.param: The MonoBehaviour that is causing the damage (used for damage attribution)
The amount of damage to apply to blocks
The radius of the damage effect in world units
The X coordinate of the damage center
The Y coordinate of the damage center
member.remarks: Calculates which grid cells fall within the damage radius and applies damage to both background and foreground blocks. Uses MapController.Damage_Networked to ensure damage is synchronized across all clients. The damage type is specifically set to DestroyBackground.

member.name: M:Map.DamageDoodadByTag(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Damages all doodads (environmental objects) with the specified tag. Handles both Unit components and generic damage message receivers.
member.param: The tag identifying which doodads to damage (case-insensitive).
The amount of damage to apply to each matching doodad.
member.returns: True if at least one doodad with the tag was found (even if it couldn't be damaged); false if no matching doodads exist.
member.remarks: Iterates through all doodads in MapData.DoodadList with matching tags. For objects with Unit components, calls the Damage method directly. For others, sends a "Damage" message with a DamageObject parameter.

member.name: M:Map.DestroyPersistantBlocks
member.summary: Destroys all persisted blocks and clears the persistence system. This removes both foreground and background persistent blocks and their container GameObject.
member.remarks: Iterates through all persistent block arrays and destroys each block's GameObject before clearing the arrays and destroying the persistent container. Also resets the hasPersistedPastLevelLoad flag.

member.name: M:Map.Distance(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the Euclidean distance between two 2D points using manual calculation. This method provides a basic distance calculation used internally for geometric operations.
member.param: The first point in 2D space
The second point in 2D space
member.returns: The Euclidean distance between the two points
member.remarks: This method manually calculates distance using the formula: sqrt((x2-x1) + (y2-y1)). It's primarily used by the LineToPointDistance2D method for calculating perpendicular distances from points to line segments.

member.name: M:Map.Distance(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the Euclidean distance between two 2D points using the standard distance formula.
member.param: The first point in 2D space.
The second point in 2D space.
member.returns: The distance between the two points as a float value.
member.remarks: This is a utility method used internally for various geometric calculations in the map system, particularly for line-to-point distance calculations. It uses the standard formula: sqrt((x2-x1)^2 + (y2-y1)^2).

member.name: M:Map.Distance(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the Euclidean distance between two 2D points using manual calculation. This method provides a basic distance calculation used internally for geometric operations.
member.param: The first point in 2D space
The second point in 2D space
member.returns: The Euclidean distance between the two points
member.remarks: This method manually calculates distance using the formula: sqrt((x2-x1) + (y2-y1)). It's primarily used by the LineToPointDistance2D method for calculating perpendicular distances from points to line segments.

member.name: M:Map.DoesForegroundBlockHaveBackground(GroundType)
member.summary: Determines if a foreground block type should have a background layer rendered behind it. Most solid blocks have backgrounds, while bridges, ladders, and decorative elements do not.
member.param: The ground type to check.
member.returns: True if this ground type should have a background; false for transparent or pass-through blocks like ladders, bridges, and decorative elements.

member.name: M:Map.DoesForegroundBlockHaveBackground(TerrainType)
member.summary: Determines if a foreground terrain type should have a background layer rendered behind it. Used during map generation to determine background placement.
member.param: The terrain type to check.
member.returns: True if this terrain type should have a background; false for transparent or pass-through terrain like ladders, bridges, and air.

member.name: M:Map.DontPersistBlocks
member.summary: Disables block persistence for the next level load. This prevents blocks from being maintained between level transitions, ensuring a fresh map state.
member.remarks: Sets the persistPastLevelLoad flag to false. This method should be called when you want to ensure all blocks are cleared and recreated on the next level load, typically when transitioning to a completely different area.

member.name: M:Map.DotProduct(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the dot product of vectors formed by three points, used for angle calculations.
member.param: The first point defining the start of the first vector
The second point, end of first vector and start of second vector
The third point defining the end of the second vector
member.returns: The dot product of vectors AB and BC
member.remarks: This helper method computes the dot product between two vectors formed by three sequential points. It creates vector AB (from A to B) and vector BC (from B to C), then returns their dot product. This is commonly used in distance calculations and determining angles between line segments, particularly in the line-to-point distance calculations used elsewhere in the map system.

member.name: M:Map.FindHoleToJumpThroughAndAppear(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Searches for a suitable floor opening where a character can jump through and appear from below. Used for dramatic entrance animations and spawn mechanics.
member.param: The X coordinate around which to search for jump-through points.
The Y coordinate around which to search for jump-through points.
When successful, contains the X coordinate where the character should appear (centered in the empty column).
When successful, contains the Y coordinate where the character should appear (one block below the floor).
When successful, contains the horizontal direction to jump: 1 for right, -1 for left.
member.returns: True if a suitable jump-through location was found; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Searches within 9 columns on each side and up to 3 rows above. A valid location must have a solid floor block with at least 4 empty blocks below on one side.

member.name: M:Map.FindLadderNearPosition(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Searches for a ladder block near the specified position and returns the optimal climbing position. Uses a default search range of 8 units, prioritizing ladders to the right of the position.
member.param: The X coordinate of the search origin position.
The Y coordinate of the search origin position.
When successful, contains the X coordinate where the character should be positioned to climb the ladder (centered on the ladder at blockX + 8).
When successful, contains the Y coordinate where the character should be positioned (same as yPos).
member.returns: True if a ladder was found within range; false if no ladder exists or the position is out of bounds.
member.remarks: Searches for all ladder types (normal, desert, city, metal, alien). The search prioritizes ladders in front (3/4 of range to the right) before checking behind (remaining 1/4 to the left).

member.name: M:Map.FindLadderNearPosition(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Searches for a ladder block near the specified position within a custom range and returns the optimal climbing position. Prioritizes ladders in front of the search position.
member.param: The X coordinate of the search origin position.
The Y coordinate of the search origin position.
The horizontal search range in grid units. The method searches from -range/4 to +range columns.
When successful, contains the X coordinate where the character should be positioned to climb the ladder.
When successful, contains the Y coordinate where the character should be positioned (same as yPos).
member.returns: True if a ladder was found within range; false if no ladder exists or the position is out of bounds.
member.remarks: The search is asymmetric: it first checks 3/4 of the range to the right (forward), then 1/4 to the left (behind). This prioritization helps AI units find ladders in their movement direction.

member.name: M:Map.FindLargeBlockDimensions(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,TerrainType,TerrainType[,])
member.summary: Analyzes a terrain region to find the dimensions of a contiguous area of the same terrain type. Used for optimizing terrain mesh generation by combining adjacent blocks.
member.param: The starting column position to analyze.
The starting row position to analyze.
Output parameter containing the leftmost column of the contiguous area.
Output parameter containing the bottom row of the contiguous area.
Output parameter containing the width of the contiguous area in columns.
Output parameter containing the height of the contiguous area in rows.
The terrain type to match when finding contiguous blocks.
The 2D array of terrain types to analyze.
member.remarks: Protected method that expands from the starting position in all four directions until it finds different terrain types or map boundaries. Validates that all corners match to ensure rectangular regions.

member.name: M:Map.FindStartLocation
member.summary: Determines the starting location for the level based on game mode and spawn point configuration. Handles different spawn strategies for various game modes.
member.returns: A Vector3 representing the world position where gameplay should begin.
member.remarks: For Suicide Horde mode, uses the first spawn point. For other modes, attempts to find spawn points or falls back to calculating a position based on map dimensions and highest solid block.

member.name: M:Map.GetAmmoCrateFrequency
member.summary: Calculates the spawn frequency for ammunition crates based on game mode and player progression. Higher values mean less frequent spawns.
member.returns: A float representing the spawn frequency multiplier for ammo crates.
member.remarks: Hardcore mode: 23x base frequency. Death match: 15x frequency. World map campaign: 30 minus (2 per unlocked pickup, max 15). Default: 23x. All values are multiplied by MapData.ammoCrateFrequencyMultiplier.

member.name: M:Map.GetBlockCenter(GridPoint)

member.remarks: This overload provides a convenient way to get world coordinates from a GridPoint object. It simply delegates to the GetBlockCenter(int, int) method using the gridPoint's column and row values. This is useful when working with grid-based game logic that needs to convert grid positions to world positions for spawning or positioning objects.

Reference parameter that will contain the world y coordinate

The column index in the grid

The row index in the grid

member.name: M:Map.GetCheckPointAirHeight(System.Int32)

member.name: M:Map.GetDoodadByTag(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a single GameObject by its tag, searching both the persistent doodad list and dynamically tagged objects. Returns the first match found.
member.param: The tag to search for (case-insensitive).
member.returns: The first GameObject found with the specified tag, or null if no object has that tag.
member.remarks: First searches the MapData.DoodadList for persistent level objects, then checks the dynamic taggedObjects dictionary. Used by triggers and scripts to find specific objects.

member.name: M:Map.GetDoodadsByTag(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all GameObjects with the specified tag, including both persistent doodads and dynamically tagged objects.
member.param: The tag to search for (case-insensitive).
member.returns: A List containing all GameObjects with the specified tag. Returns an empty list if no matches are found.
member.remarks: Searches both the MapData.DoodadList for level-placed objects and the taggedObjects dictionary for dynamically added objects. Unlike GetDoodadByTag, this returns all matches rather than just the first.

member.name: M:Map.GetGroundHeight(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Finds the height of the ground directly below the specified position using raycasting. Performs multiple raycasts to ensure accurate ground detection even near edges.
member.param: The X coordinate from which to cast rays downward.
The Y coordinate from which to start the raycast.
member.returns: The Y coordinate of the ground surface if found; 0 if no ground is detected below the position.
member.remarks: Performs three raycasts: at the exact position, 16 units to the right, and 16 units to the left. This ensures ground detection even when the character is partially off a platform. Uses groundLayerStrict for precise collision.

member.name: M:Map.GetLeafColor
member.summary: Gets the leaf color defined by the current map theme.
member.returns: The Color value for leaves in the active theme
member.remarks: This method returns the theme-specific leaf color used for vegetation rendering. Different themes (jungle, forest, etc.) can define unique leaf colors to match their visual style. The color is typically used by particle systems, vegetation sprites, or environmental effects to maintain consistent theming throughout the level.

member.name: M:Map.GetMaxCollumns

member.returns: The total number of columns in the map grid (Map.Width).

member.name: M:Map.GetMaxRows
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of rows in the current map, representing the map's height in grid units.
member.returns: The total number of rows in the map grid (Map.Height).
member.remarks: Provides a consistent interface for accessing map dimensions. The map uses a row-based grid system where each row is 16 units tall.

member.name: M:Map.GetSpawnPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the SpawnPoint object for the specified player number. Uses modulo arithmetic with spawnPointOffset to cycle through available spawn points if there are fewer spawn points than players.
member.param: The player number (0-based) requesting a spawn point.
member.returns: The SpawnPoint object for the player, or null if no valid spawn points exist or playerNum is negative.

member.name: M:Map.GetSpawnPointPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the world position of a spawn point for the specified player number. Uses modulo arithmetic with spawnPointOffset to cycle through available spawn points if there are fewer spawn points than players.
member.param: The player number (0-based) requesting a spawn position.
member.returns: The Vector3 position of the spawn point, or (-1000, -1000, -1000) if no valid spawn points exist or playerNum is negative.

member.name: M:Map.GetUnitXOffset
member.summary: Generates a pseudo-random horizontal offset for unit positioning.
member.returns: A horizontal offset value between -5 and +5 units with complex distribution
member.remarks: This method creates varied unit spawn positions to prevent overlap when multiple units spawn at the same location. It uses a deterministic sequence based on unitOffsetCount that combines multiple modulo operations to create an irregular but repeatable pattern. The formula produces offsets that cluster around certain values while still covering the full -5 to +5 range, creating natural-looking unit spread. The counter increments with each call, ensuring unique offsets for sequential spawns.

member.name: M:Map.HasSandStormTrigger
member.summary: Checks whether the current map contains any sandstorm or sandworm trigger actions. This is used to determine if desert-specific environmental effects should be prepared.
member.returns: True if the map contains sandstorm or sandworm triggers, false otherwise
member.remarks: Iterates through all triggers in the MapData and checks their actions for Sandstorm or CallSandworm types. These triggers create environmental hazards specific to desert-themed levels.

member.name: M:Map.HasThisMapGotAliens
member.summary: Checks whether the current map contains alien enemies. This is used to determine if alien-specific gameplay mechanics should be enabled.
member.returns: True if the map contains aliens, false otherwise
member.remarks: Returns the value of the hasAliens static field, which is set during map loading based on the presence of alien spawn points or alien-themed elements.

member.name: M:Map.InsideWall(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if a position is inside a wall or solid terrain using a reduced radius collision check.
member.param: The X coordinate of the position to check.
The Y coordinate of the position to check.
The size of the object. The actual check uses size/2 as the radius.
If true, only checks ground layers; if false, includes additional collision layers.
member.returns: True if the position overlaps solid terrain; false if the position is clear.
member.remarks: Uses half the provided size for the collision check, making it more permissive than IsOverGround. Useful for checking if objects are embedded in terrain.

member.summary: Checks if a position with the specified radius overlaps any ground blocks. Used for collision detection and grounding checks.

The Y coordinate of the center position to check.
The radius of the sphere to check for ground overlap.
If true, only checks against ground layers; if false, includes additional collision layers.
member.returns: True if the sphere at the specified position overlaps any ground; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Uses Physics.OverlapSphere to detect collisions. The strictlyGround parameter determines whether to use groundLayerStrict (Ground and IndestructibleGround only) or the broader groundLayer mask.

member.name: M:Map.IsTerrainCompatible(GroundType,GroundType)
member.summary: Determines if two ground types are compatible for terrain blending or connection. Compatible terrains can connect seamlessly without visual breaks.
member.param: The first ground type to compare.
The second ground type to compare.
member.returns: True if the ground types are compatible and can blend together; false if they should remain separate.

member.name: M:Map.IsTerrainTheSame(GroundType,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the terrain at the specified position matches the given ground type. Used for terrain consistency checks during modifications.
member.param: The ground type to compare against.
The column index to check.
The row index to check.
member.returns: True if the terrain at the position matches the source ground type; false if different or out of bounds.

member.name: M:Map.LineToPointDistance2D(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates the minimum distance from a point to a line or line segment in 2D space. This method supports both infinite lines and finite line segments.
member.param: The first point defining the line
The second point defining the line
The point to measure distance from
If true, treats the line as a finite segment; if false, treats it as an infinite line
member.returns: The minimum distance from pointC to the line/segment defined by pointA and pointB
member.remarks: For line segments, the method checks if the closest point on the line falls within the segment bounds. If not, it returns the distance to the nearest endpoint. Uses CrossProduct and DotProduct helper methods for calculations.

member.name: M:Map.LineToPointDistance2D(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates the shortest distance from a point to a line or line segment in 2D space.
member.param: The starting point of the line or line segment.
The ending point of the line or line segment.
The point to calculate the distance from.
If true, treats the line as a finite segment; if false, treats it as an infinite line.
member.returns: The shortest distance from pointC to the line or line segment.
member.remarks: When isSegment is true, the method checks if the closest point on the line falls outside the segment bounds and returns the distance to the nearest endpoint instead. Uses cross product for perpendicular distance calculation and dot product for segment boundary checks.

member.name: M:Map.LineToPointDistance2D(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates the minimum distance from a point to a line or line segment in 2D space. This method supports both infinite lines and finite line segments.
member.param: The first point defining the line
The second point defining the line
The point to measure distance from
If true, treats the line as a finite segment; if false, treats it as an infinite line
member.returns: The minimum distance from pointC to the line/segment defined by pointA and pointB
member.remarks: For line segments, the method checks if the closest point on the line falls within the segment bounds. If not, it returns the distance to the nearest endpoint. Uses CrossProduct and DotProduct helper methods for calculations.

member.name: M:Map.LoadArea
member.summary: Handles the loading and offset management for map areas during level transitions. Updates the load offset values based on whether the map is in editing mode.
member.remarks: Protected method that manages map area loading offsets. In normal gameplay, it preserves offset progression. In editing mode, all offsets are reset to zero. Part of the larger map loading system.

member.name: M:Map.MakeBlockPersist(Block)
member.summary: Marks a specific block for persistence by transferring it to the persistent blocks container. This is a helper method used by PersistBlocks to process individual blocks.
member.param: The block to make persistent
member.remarks: Simply calls the Persist method to reparent the block's GameObject to the persistent container.

member.name: M:Map.Persist(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Transfers a GameObject to the persistent blocks container by changing its parent. This ensures the object survives scene transitions when persistence is enabled.
member.param: The GameObject to make persistent
member.remarks: Reparents the GameObject to the PersistentBlocks.Instance transform, which is marked as DontDestroyOnLoad to survive scene changes.

member.name: M:Map.PersistBlocks
member.summary: Enables block persistence and transfers all current foreground and background blocks to the persistent storage system. This allows blocks to survive level transitions when loading time optimizations are active.
member.remarks: Creates a persistent GameObject container if needed and iterates through all map blocks, marking matching persistent blocks for retention. Respects the dontPersistedPastLevelLoadThisLevel flag to handle special cases where persistence should be skipped.

member.name: M:Map.PlaceGround(GroundType,System.Int32,System.Int32,Block[,]@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Places a ground block of the specified type at the given grid position. Handles block instantiation, theme application, and map state updates.
member.param: The type of ground block to place (Earth, Metal, Wood, etc.).
The column index where the block should be placed.
The row index where the block should be placed.
Reference to the 2D array of blocks being built/modified.
Whether to add the block to the global block registry (default true).
member.returns: The newly created Block instance, or null if placing an empty block type.
member.remarks: Updates highest solid block tracking for non-ladder blocks. Applies appropriate Z-depth offsets based on block type. Uses the active theme to determine which prefab to instantiate.

member.name: M:Map.PushBlock(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Attempts to push a block at the specified grid position with the given horizontal force. Blocks can only be pushed if editing mode is disabled and the block supports push mechanics.
member.param: The column index of the block to push.
The row index of the block to push.
The horizontal force to apply. Positive values push right, negative values push left.
member.returns: True if the block was successfully pushed; false if the block can't be pushed, is already broken, or editing mode is active.

member.name: M:Map.PushBlock(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Attempts to push a block by raycasting from a position in the specified direction. Uses physics raycasting to find pushable blocks along the ray.
member.param: The X coordinate to start the raycast from.
The Y coordinate to start the raycast from.
The horizontal force to apply. Positive values raycast right, negative values raycast left.
The maximum distance to check for pushable blocks.
member.returns: True if a block was found and successfully pushed; false if no pushable block was found or editing mode is active.

member.name: M:Map.RegisterCheckPoint(CheckPoint)
member.summary: Registers a checkpoint with the map's checkpoint system and assigns it a sequential ID based on the current count of checkpoints. Checkpoints serve as respawn locations and progress markers throughout a level. Initializes the checkpoints list if it doesn't exist.
member.param: The CheckPoint object to register, which will have its checkPointID set to the current checkpoint count.

member.name: M:Map.RegisterSpawnPoint(SpawnPoint)
member.summary: Registers a spawn point with the map's spawn system. Spawn points determine where players respawn after death or at the start of a level. Initializes the spawn points list if it doesn't exist.
member.param: The SpawnPoint object to register.

member.name: M:Map.RemoveCheckPoint(CheckPoint)
member.summary: Removes a checkpoint from the map's checkpoint tracking system. Note that this may invalidate checkpoint IDs for checkpoints registered after the removed one.
member.param: The CheckPoint object to remove.

member.name: M:Map.ReplaceCageWithAmmoAndRevives(Cage)
member.summary: Replaces a single cage with ammunition and revival crates at the same position. This helper method handles the transformation of individual cages.
member.param: The cage to replace with crates
member.remarks: Preserves the cage's position and column information before destroying it, then calls Create4AmmoAndRevives to spawn the replacement crates. The cage is properly collapsed and destroyed before replacement.

member.name: M:Map.ReplaceCagesWithAmmoAndRevives
member.summary: Replaces all cages in the current map with ammunition and revival crates. This is typically used in specific game modes or when transitioning to different gameplay scenarios.
member.remarks: Iterates through the cages list backwards and calls ReplaceCageWithAmmoAndRevives for each valid cage. This transformation affects all cages in the level simultaneously.

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromHorizontalSuperCheckPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures the map to start from a horizontal super checkpoint with a specific X-axis offset.
member.param: The horizontal offset in grid units for loading the level.
member.remarks: Used for horizontal level transitions where the player needs to spawn at a specific X coordinate. If the offset differs from the last load offset, it triggers a reset of persistent blocks. The offset is clamped to a minimum of 0 to prevent negative values.

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromHorizontalSuperCheckPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up a horizontal super checkpoint with a specific X-axis load offset. This is used for horizontal level transitions where the map needs to load at a specific horizontal position.
member.param: The horizontal offset for loading the level, clamped to non-negative values
member.remarks: If the offset differs from the last load offset, persistence is disabled for this level to ensure a clean transition. The offset determines where in the level the player spawns horizontally.

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromSuperCheckPoint
member.summary: Configures the map to start from a super checkpoint on the next level load.
member.remarks: Super checkpoints are special spawn points that persist across level transitions, typically used for major progression points or after boss battles. This method simply sets the flag without specifying offset values.

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromSuperCheckPoint
member.summary: Marks that the next level load should start from a super checkpoint. This affects spawn positioning and level initialization.
member.remarks: Sets the startFromSuperCheckPoint flag to true. Super checkpoints are special checkpoint types that typically mark major progression points or area transitions.

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromVerticalSuperCheckPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures the map to start from a vertical super checkpoint with a specific Y-axis offset.
member.param: The vertical offset in grid units for loading the level.
member.remarks: Used for vertical level transitions where the player needs to spawn at a specific Y coordinate. Similar to horizontal checkpoints, changing the offset resets persistent blocks. The offset is clamped to a minimum of 0.

member.name: M:Map.SetStartFromVerticalSuperCheckPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up a vertical super checkpoint with a specific Y-axis load offset. This is used for vertical level transitions where the map needs to load at a specific vertical position.
member.param: The vertical offset for loading the level, clamped to non-negative values
member.remarks: If the offset differs from the last load offset, persistence is disabled for this level to ensure a clean transition. The offset determines where in the level the player spawns vertically.

member.name: M:Map.SetTryReduceLoadingTimes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the loading time optimization system. When enabled, the map will attempt to persist certain blocks between level loads to reduce loading times.
member.param: True to enable loading time optimizations, false to disable them
member.remarks: This optimization system works in conjunction with the block persistence methods (PersistBlocks, DontPersistBlocks) to maintain certain map elements across level transitions.

member.name: M:Map.TryingToReduceLoadingTimes
member.summary: Checks whether the loading time optimization system is currently active. Returns true only if optimizations are enabled, the level editor is not active, and the asset pool is not disabled.
member.returns: True if loading time optimizations are active and available, false otherwise
member.remarks: This method verifies multiple conditions to ensure optimizations are appropriate for the current game state. It's used by various persistence-related methods to determine whether to maintain blocks between level loads.

member.name: M:Map.WasBlockEarth(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the original map data at the specified position contained earth-like terrain. Uses map load offsets to check the original terrain type before any modifications.
member.param: The column index to check (relative to current map offset).
The row index to check (relative to current map offset).
member.returns: True if the original terrain was earth-like (including various earth, stone, and background types); false otherwise.

member.name: M:Map.WasBlockOriginallyAir(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the original map data at the specified position was air or empty. Used to determine if a position was originally passable before modifications.
member.param: The column index to check (relative to current map offset).
The row index to check (relative to current map offset).
member.returns: True if the original terrain was air or empty; true for out-of-bounds positions.

member.name: M:Map.WasBlockOriginallySolid(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the original map data at the specified position contained solid terrain. Comprehensive check for all solid terrain types in the original map data.
member.param: The column index to check (relative to current map offset).
The row index to check (relative to current map offset).
member.returns: True if the original terrain was any solid type or position is out of bounds; false if originally empty or air.

member.name: F:Map.TileSize
member.summary: The size of a single tile in the map grid system, measured in world units. This constant defines the fundamental unit of measurement for the Map's grid-based coordinate system.
member.remarks: Set to 16 units, this value is used throughout the codebase for converting between grid coordinates and world positions. Related constants include HalfTileSize (8) for half-tile calculations.

member.name: F:Map.TileSize
member.summary: The standard tile size in pixels used throughout the map grid system.
member.remarks: This constant defines the base unit of the map's grid system. All block positions, collision checks, and grid calculations use this 16-pixel tile size as the fundamental measurement unit.

member.name: F:Map.TileSize
member.summary: The size of a single tile in the map grid system, measured in world units. This constant defines the fundamental unit of measurement for the Map's grid-based coordinate system.
member.remarks: Set to 16 units, this value is used throughout the codebase for converting between grid coordinates and world positions. Related constants include HalfTileSize (8) for half-tile calculations.

member.name: F:Map.barrierLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the MobileBarriers layer. Used to detect movable barriers and obstacles that can block movement or projectiles but may be pushable or destructible.

member.name: F:Map.cameraBlockers
member.summary: List of objects that block or influence camera movement. Camera blockers are registered via RegisterCameraBlocker and removed via RemoveCameraBlocker. Used by the camera system to prevent viewing certain areas or to create cinematic boundaries. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.checkPoints
member.summary: Static list tracking all checkpoint objects in the current map. Checkpoints are added via RegisterCheckPoint() and removed via DeregisterCheckPoint(). Used for respawn mechanics and progress tracking.

member.name: F:Map.defaultLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for Unity's Default layer. Used for general-purpose collision detection with objects that haven't been assigned to a specific gameplay layer.

member.name: F:Map.exitPortalPrefabReference
member.summary: Reference to the level exit portal prefab. Used by CreateExitPortal() to instantiate exit portals at specified positions. The portal is placed 112 units above the given position with a 16-unit horizontal offset.

member.name: F:Map.fragileLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the DirtyHippie layer. Despite the unusual name, this layer is used for fragile or easily breakable objects in the game world that can be destroyed by minimal force.

member.name: F:Map.groundAndDamageableObjects
member.summary: LayerMask combining Ground, IndestructibleGround, LargeObjects, and FLUI layers. Extended ground collision mask that includes damageable objects, used for comprehensive collision detection in combat and damage calculations.

member.name: F:Map.groundLayer
member.summary: LayerMask combining Ground, IndestructibleGround, and LargeObjects layers. Used for general ground collision detection including destructible terrain, permanent terrain, and large solid objects. This is the primary collision mask for most ground-based physics queries.

member.name: F:Map.groundLayerStrict
member.summary: LayerMask combining only Ground and IndestructibleGround layers, excluding LargeObjects. Used for strict terrain-only collision detection when large objects should be ignored, such as certain movement or placement checks.

member.name: F:Map.hangingLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the Hanging layer. Used to detect overhead bars, ropes, and other objects that units can hang from or traverse hand-over-hand.

member.name: F:Map.highestSolidBlock
member.summary: Tracks the Y coordinate of the highest solid block placed on the map. Updated during PlaceGround when placing solid blocks (excluding ladders and empty spaces). Used by CollapseTop to determine where to start collapsing terrain from the top. Minimum value is clamped to 11 during collapse operations.

member.name: F:Map.highestSolidBlockLadder
member.summary: Tracks the Y coordinate 5 blocks above the highest solid block. Updated alongside highestSolidBlock during PlaceGround operations. Set to highestSolidBlock + 5 when a new highest solid block is placed.

member.name: F:Map.ladderLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the Ladders layer. Used to detect climbable ladder objects that allow vertical movement when units interact with them.

member.name: F:Map.largeObjectsLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the LargeObjects layer only. Used to specifically detect collision with large environmental objects that are separate from terrain, such as vehicles, large props, or destructible structures.

member.name: F:Map.maxCollumnActive
member.summary: The rightmost column index currently active in the block deactivation system. Defaults to 256. Updated by RunDeactivationOffscreen() to optimize performance by deactivating off-screen blocks.

member.name: F:Map.maxUnitX
member.summary: Maximum X position of active units used for extending the visible area. The offscreen deactivation system tracks unit positions to ensure blocks near active units remain loaded. Reset to -100001f when recalculating boundaries and updated via ExtendDisableToUnitPosition.

member.name: F:Map.maxUnitY
member.summary: Maximum Y position of active units used for extending the visible area. The offscreen deactivation system tracks unit positions to ensure blocks near active units remain loaded. Reset to -100001f when recalculating boundaries and updated via ExtendDisableToUnitPosition.

member.name: F:Map.minCollumnActive
member.summary: The leftmost column index currently active in the block deactivation system. Updated by RunDeactivationOffscreen() to track which blocks should be active based on camera position.

member.name: F:Map.minRowActive
member.summary: The bottom row index currently active in the block deactivation system. Updated by RunDeactivationOffscreen() to track which blocks should be active based on camera position.

member.name: F:Map.minUnitX
member.summary: Minimum X position of active units used for extending the visible area. The offscreen deactivation system tracks unit positions to ensure blocks near active units remain loaded. Reset to 100001f when recalculating boundaries and updated via ExtendDisableToUnitPosition.

member.name: F:Map.minUnitY
member.summary: Minimum Y position of active units used for extending the visible area. The offscreen deactivation system tracks unit positions to ensure blocks near active units remain loaded. Reset to 100001f when recalculating boundaries and updated via ExtendDisableToUnitPosition.

member.name: F:Map.nearestCheckPoint
member.summary: Temporary storage for the nearest checkpoint found during proximity searches. Used by GetNearestCheckpoint methods to track the closest checkpoint while iterating through all checkpoints. This field optimizes performance during frequent checkpoint proximity checks.

member.name: F:Map.platformLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the Platform layer. Used to detect one-way platforms that units can jump through from below but stand on from above, common in platformer gameplay mechanics.

member.name: F:Map.spawnPointInvisiblePrefabReference
member.summary: Reference to the invisible spawn point prefab. Instantiated for spawn points that should function without visual indicators. Used via spawnPointInvisiblePrefabReference.Asset during map generation.

member.name: F:Map.spawnPointOffset
member.summary: Random offset applied to spawn point selection to vary player starting positions. Initialized to a random value between 0 and 55 during map setup. Used when calculating spawn positions by adding this offset to the player number before modulo operation with total spawn points.

member.name: F:Map.spawnPointPrefabReference
member.summary: Reference to the standard visible spawn point prefab. Instantiated when placing regular spawn points that show a visual indicator. Typically paired with an empty cage doodad placed above it.

member.name: F:Map.spawnPoints
member.summary: List of player spawn points in the map. Spawn points are registered via RegisterSpawnPoint. Used by GetSpawnPointPos and GetSpawnPoint to determine where players spawn, cycling through points based on player number and spawnPointOffset. Critical for multiplayer spawn distribution. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.startFromSuperCheckPoint
member.summary: Indicates whether the player should start from a super checkpoint position instead of normal spawn points. When true, uses superCheckpointStartPos for the player's starting location. Reset to false during ClearSuperCheckpointStatus.

member.name: F:Map.superCheckpointStartPos
member.summary: The grid position where players spawn when starting from a super checkpoint. Used in conjunction with startFromSuperCheckPoint to override normal spawn behavior. Both column and row are set to -1 when cleared, indicating no super checkpoint is active.

member.name: F:Map.switchesLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the Switches layer. Used to detect interactive switch objects that can trigger events, open doors, or activate mechanisms when interacted with by units.

member.name: F:Map.unitLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the Units layer. Used to detect collision with units (enemies, players, NPCs) for combat targeting, movement blocking, and interaction checks.

member.name: F:Map.unitOffsetCount
member.summary: Counter used by GetUnitXOffset() to generate pseudo-random X position offsets for units. Incremented each time an offset is requested to create variation in unit placement.

member.name: F:Map.victoryLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the Finish layer. Used to detect level completion triggers and victory zones that end the level when reached by players.

member.name: F:Map.waterLayer
member.summary: LayerMask for the Water layer. Used to detect water volumes for swimming mechanics, drowning checks, and water-specific physics interactions.

member.name: M:Map.BloodyDoodads(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies blood effects to decal doodads within a circular range of the specified position. Iterates through decal doodads up to the count of destroyable doodads and calls the Bloody() method on doodads within range, decreasing the iteration index when a doodad is bloodied to account for potential list modifications.
member.param: The X coordinate of the blood effect center.
The Y coordinate of the blood effect center.
The radius within which doodads will be bloodied.

member.name: M:Map.CallFakeHelicopter(UnityEngine.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Summons a fake helicopter to the specified position after a delay. The fake helicopter is a visual-only helicopter used for cinematic sequences that doesn't interact with gameplay.
member.param: The target position for the helicopter
The delay in seconds before the helicopter appears
member.remarks: Creates a single shared instance of HelicopterFake if one doesn't exist. The fake helicopter is typically used for background effects or scripted sequences where a full helicopter entity isn't needed.

member.name: M:Map.DamageBackground(UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Damages background and foreground blocks within a circular radius. This method is used for explosive damage that affects the destructible terrain behind the main play area.
member.param: The MonoBehaviour that is causing the damage (used for damage attribution)
The amount of damage to apply to blocks
The radius of the damage effect in world units
The X coordinate of the damage center
The Y coordinate of the damage center
member.remarks: Calculates which grid cells fall within the damage radius and applies damage to both background and foreground blocks. Uses MapController.Damage_Networked to ensure damage is synchronized across all clients. The damage type is specifically set to DestroyBackground.

member.name: M:Map.DamageDoodads(System.Int32,DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour)
member.summary: Damages destroyable doodads within a circular range, applying damage based on player permissions and doodad properties. Checks if doodads can be damaged by mooks (if playerNum is negative) or heroes, respects immunity flags, and tracks whether impenetrable doodads were hit.
member.param: The amount of damage to apply to doodads.
The type of damage being applied.
The X coordinate of the damage center.
The Y coordinate of the damage center.
The horizontal force component for the damage.
The vertical force component for the damage.
The radius within which doodads will be damaged.
The player number causing the damage (negative values indicate mook damage).
Output parameter set to true if an impenetrable doodad was hit.
The MonoBehaviour that caused the damage (optional).
member.returns: True if at least one doodad was damaged, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Map.DamageStaticDoodads(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour)
member.summary: Damages static doodads within a circular range by causing them to collapse. Iterates through the static doodads list in reverse order and collapses any doodads within the specified range.
member.param: The X coordinate of the damage center.
The Y coordinate of the damage center.
The horizontal force component (currently unused in implementation).
The vertical force component (currently unused in implementation).
The radius within which static doodads will be damaged.
The MonoBehaviour that caused the damage (optional, currently unused).
member.returns: True if at least one static doodad was damaged, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Map.DisturbAlienEggs(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Alerts alien eggs within a 64-unit radius of a position. Used to trigger alien egg reactions when players get too close.

The Y coordinate to check from
The player number disturbing the eggs (unused in current implementation)

member.name: M:Map.DisturbWildLife(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Disturbs wildlife and alerts units within hearing range of a sound. Wildlife uses hearing range multipliers, units check their hearing capabilities and player allegiance.

The Y coordinate of the disturbance

member.summary: Finds and returns the paired endpoint for a given zipline point.

member.returns: The other endpoint of the zipline, or null if no valid pair exists
member.remarks: This complex method searches through the map's doodad list to find zipline connections. It first locates the input point in the doodad list, then checks its TagAsGridPoint for a tagged connection. If found, it searches for another zipline at those coordinates. If no tag exists, it searches backwards through previous doodads for an unpaired zipline. This system allows both explicit zipline connections (via tags) and implicit pairing (sequential in the doodad list). The method ensures ziplines are properly connected in pairs for gameplay functionality.

member.name: M:Map.GetStaticDoodad(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a static doodad at the specified grid coordinates. Iterates through all registered static doodads to find one matching the given column and row position.
member.param: The column coordinate in the map grid to search. Note: Parameter name contains a typo ("collumn").
The row coordinate in the map grid to search.
member.returns: The Doodad at the specified grid position, or null if no static doodad exists at that location.

member.name: M:Map.PlaceDoodad(DoodadInfo)

Handles spawning of all doodad types including enemies, traps, checkpoints, cages, vehicles, decorations, and special objects. Applies variation selection, position adjustment, and game mode specific modifications.

member.name: M:Map.RegisterCameraBlocker(CameraBlockers)

member.name: M:Map.RegisterDestroyableDoodad(Doodad)

member.name: M:Map.ResetZiplines
member.summary: Resets all ziplines in the map and re-establishes their connections.
member.remarks: This method performs a complete reset of the zipline system in three passes: 1. Resets all zipline points to their default state 2. Connects ziplines that have explicit tag connections (TagAsGridPoint) 3. Connects remaining untagged ziplines in pairs based on their order in the doodad list The method ensures every zipline point calls SetupZipline() after finding its pair. The alternating counter in the third pass creates implicit pairs from sequential ziplines in the doodad list. This is typically called during map initialization or reset.

member.name: M:Map.SetOilAlight(UnityEngine.Vector2,UnityEngine.Vector3)

Starting position for the raycast

member.name: F:Map.LevelEndExplosionActiveList
member.summary: List of currently active HiddenExplosives objects creating level end explosion effects. Objects are moved here from the bank when MakeLevelEndExplosion is called and returned to the bank during map cleanup. Initialized with capacity of 10.

member.name: F:Map.LevelEndExplosionBank
member.summary: Pool of inactive HiddenExplosives objects used for level end explosion effects. Pre-populated with 10 instances during map initialization to avoid runtime instantiation. Objects are moved to the active list when triggered and returned to this bank when the map is destroyed.

member.name: F:Map.LevelEndExplosionBankSizeInc
member.summary: The initial size and increment value for the level end explosion object pool. Set to 10, this determines how many HiddenExplosives objects are pre-instantiated in the bank during initialization.

member.name: F:Map.acidPools
member.summary: List of acid pool hazards that damage units on contact. Acid pools are registered via RegisterAcidPool and removed via RemoveAcidPool. Used for environmental hazard mechanics and damage-over-time effects. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.alienTelepathyTriggers
member.summary: List of triggers for alien telepathy events. Triggers are registered via RegisterAlienTelepathyTrigger and removed via RemoveAlienTelepathyTrigger. Used for alien-specific gameplay mechanics and mind control effects. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.cages
member.summary: Static list tracking all cage objects containing prisoners or collectibles. Cages are registered via RegisterCage() and removed via RemoveCage(). Used for rescue objectives and collectible tracking.

member.name: F:Map.damageableScenery
member.summary: List of scenery objects that can take damage and be destroyed. Scenery is registered via RegisterDamageableScenery and removed via RemoveDamageableScenery. Used for destructible environment elements larger than doodads. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.decalDoodads
member.summary: List of decorative doodads that render as decals (e.g., blood splatters, scorch marks). Doodads are registered via RegisterDecalDoodad and removed via RemoveDecalDoodad. Used for visual environmental effects that don't affect gameplay. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.destroyableDoodads
member.summary: List of doodads that can be destroyed by damage (e.g., crates, barrels, destructible props). Doodads are registered via RegisterDestroyableDoodad and removed via RemoveDestroyableDoodad. Used for environmental destruction and chain reaction mechanics. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.entranceDoors
member.summary: Subset of teleportDoors that serve as entrance portals. Entrance doors are added when RegisterTeleportDoor is called with an entrance-type door and removed via RemoveTeleportDoor. Used for level transitions and spawn point mechanics. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.exitDoors
member.summary: Subset of teleportDoors that serve as exit portals. Exit doors are added when RegisterTeleportDoor is called with an exit-type door and removed via RemoveTeleportDoor. Used for level completion and transition mechanics. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.exitPortalNID
member.summary: Network ID for the level exit portal. Allocated deterministically during map setup and used to register the exit portal GameObject when created via CreateExitPortal. The portal spawns at the specified position offset by (16, 112) pixels.

member.name: F:Map.grassAndBlood
member.summary: List of grass and blood effect doodads. These are visual elements registered via RegisterGrassAndBloodDoodad and removed via RemoveGrassAndBloodDoodad. Used for organic environmental decoration and gore effects. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.jigglySlime
member.summary: List of jiggly slime doodads with physics-based movement. Slime doodads are registered via RegisterJigglySlime and removed via RemoveJigglySlime. Used for organic environmental effects with bouncy physics properties. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.mookDoors
member.summary: Static list of all MookDoor objects in the map. Doors are registered via RegisterMookDoor() and removed via DeRegisterMookDoor(). Used for managing interactive door mechanics that enemies can open or players can destroy.

member.name: F:Map.remoteCarPrefabReference
member.summary: Reference to the remote control explosive car prefab. This prefab reference allows the map to instantiate remote controlled explosive vehicles when required by map data or gameplay events.

member.name: F:Map.ropePrefabReference
member.summary: Reference to the Predabro rope prefab used for spawning rope objects in the map. This prefab reference allows the map to instantiate rope elements when needed for gameplay mechanics.

member.name: F:Map.staticDoodads
member.summary: List of static non-interactive doodads for decoration. Static doodads are registered via RegisterStaticDoodad and removed via RemoveStaticDoodad. Used for immutable environmental props that provide visual detail. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.switches
member.summary: List of all interactive switches in the map. Switches are registered via RegisterSwitch (which includes null-check initialization) and removed via RemoveSwitch. Used for puzzle mechanics and triggered events. The RegisterSwitch method initializes this list if null. Set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.teleportDoors
member.summary: Master list of all teleport doors regardless of type. Doors are registered via RegisterTeleportDoor and removed via RemoveTeleportDoor. This list contains all doors, while entranceDoors and exitDoors contain type-specific subsets. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.treeFoliage
member.summary: List of tree foliage objects for jungle/forest environments. Tree foliage is registered via RegisterTreeFoliage and removed via RemoveTreeFoliage. Used for environmental decoration with potential physics interactions. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: M:Map.CallFakeHelicopter(UnityEngine.Vector2,System.Single)

The delay in seconds before the helicopter enters.

member.name: M:Map.Create4AmmoAndRevives(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

The column index for block array placement
The row index for block array placement
Whether to run block setup logic (connections to adjacent blocks)

member.name: M:Map.Create4AmmoAndRevives(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

The column coordinate for block registration.
The row coordinate for block registration.
Whether to perform block setup and initialization.
member.remarks: Creates two ammo crates on top, one revival crate and one damage boost crate on bottom. Each crate is properly registered in the block grid and with the networking system. The jungle theme is temporarily set to ensure consistent crate types.

member.name: M:Map.IsMapOpenAboveCrate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the map area above a crate position is sufficiently open for spawn mechanics. Checks if there are fewer than 5 solid blocks in the upper portion of the map above the specified position.

The row index of the crate position
member.returns: True if the area above is considered open (less than 5 solid blocks), false if it's too enclosed
member.remarks: Used to determine suitable spawn locations for items or enemies from crates. Checks from 9 rows below the map height to the top, counting non-empty, non-ladder, and non-bridge ground types. Returns true if the position is out of bounds (considered open).

member.name: M:Map.RegisterCitizen(Citizen)
member.summary: Registers a citizen NPC with the map's unit tracking system. Citizens are non-combatant NPCs that can be rescued by players, react to danger, and contribute to level objectives or scoring.
member.param: The Citizen object to register for tracking.

member.name: M:Map.RegisterDisturbedWildLife(WildLife)
member.summary: Registers a wildlife creature as disturbed, indicating it has been startled or agitated by player actions, explosions, or other disturbances. Disturbed wildlife may flee, make noise, or exhibit other panic behaviors.
member.param: The WildLife object to register as disturbed.

member.name: M:Map.RegisterUnit(Unit,System.Boolean)

If true and the unit is a Mook, registers it with StatisticsController for kill tracking.

member.name: M:Map.RegisterWildLife(WildLife)
member.summary: Registers a wildlife creature with the map's tracking system. Wildlife includes passive animals like pigs, chickens, and other creatures that populate levels and can react to player actions or explosions.
member.param: The WildLife object to register.

member.name: M:Map.RemoveCitizen(Citizen)
member.summary: Removes a citizen from the map's unit tracking system, typically when they are rescued, killed, or otherwise removed from gameplay. This ensures they are no longer considered for AI targeting or rescue objectives.
member.param: The Citizen object to remove from tracking.

member.name: M:Map.RemoveDisturbedWildLife(WildLife)
member.summary: Removes a wildlife creature from the disturbed wildlife tracking list, typically when it has calmed down, been killed, or is no longer in a disturbed state. This allows the creature to return to normal behavior patterns.
member.param: The WildLife object to remove from disturbed tracking.

member.name: M:Map.RemoveUnit(Unit)
member.summary: Removes a Unit from the map's unit tracking system.
member.param: The Unit to remove.

member.name: M:Map.RemoveWildLife(WildLife)
member.summary: Removes a wildlife creature from the map's general tracking system, typically when the creature is killed, leaves the level, or is no longer needed for gameplay purposes.
member.param: The WildLife object to remove from tracking.

member.name: M:Map.ReplaceCageWithAmmoAndRevives(Cage)
member.summary: Replaces a single cage with ammunition and revival crates at the same position. This helper method handles the transformation of individual cages.
member.param: The cage to replace with crates
member.remarks: Preserves the cage's position and column information before destroying it, then calls Create4AmmoAndRevives to spawn the replacement crates. The cage is properly collapsed and destroyed before replacement.

member.name: M:Map.ReplaceCageWithAmmoAndRevives(Cage)
member.summary: Replaces a single cage with a 2x2 arrangement of ammunition and revival crates.
member.param: The cage to replace with power-up crates.
member.remarks: Called internally by ReplaceCagesWithAmmoAndRevives. Destroys the cage and creates four crates in its place: two ammo crates on top and one revival crate plus one damage boost crate on the bottom.

member.name: M:Map.ReplaceCagesWithAmmoAndRevives
member.summary: Replaces all cages in the current map with ammunition and revival crates. This is typically used in specific game modes or when transitioning to different gameplay scenarios.
member.remarks: Iterates through the cages list backwards and calls ReplaceCageWithAmmoAndRevives for each valid cage. This transformation affects all cages in the level simultaneously.

member.name: M:Map.ReplaceCagesWithAmmoAndRevives
member.summary: Replaces all existing cages in the level with ammunition and revival crates.
member.remarks: Iterates through all registered cages and replaces each one with a 2x2 arrangement of power-up crates. This is typically used for game modes or difficulty settings where prisoner rescue is replaced with resource collection.

member.name: M:Map.SpawnFaceBaneling(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)

The initial x velocity
The initial y velocity
member.returns: The spawned AlienClimber instance

member.name: M:Map.SpawnFaceHugger(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)

The y coordinate to spawn at
The initial x velocity
The initial y velocity
member.returns: The spawned AlienClimber instance

member.name: F:Map.alienEggs
member.summary: Static list tracking all alien egg explosives in the current map. Used to manage alien spawn points that can hatch facehuggers when disturbed or destroyed by player actions.

member.name: F:Map.citizens
member.summary: List of civilian NPCs that need rescuing or protection. Citizens are registered via RegisterCitizen and removed via RemoveCitizen. Used for rescue missions and civilian AI behavior. The registration method prevents duplicate entries. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.disturbedWildLife
member.summary: Static list of wildlife that have been disturbed by explosions or player actions. Wildlife are added via RegisterDisturbedWildLife() when startled and removed via RemoveDisturbedWildLife() when calmed or killed.

member.name: F:Map.heroWatchers
member.summary: List of objects that monitor or react to hero presence. Watchers are registered via RegisterHeroWatcher and removed via RemoveHeroWatcher. Used for triggering events, cinematics, or AI behaviors based on player proximity. The registration method prevents duplicate entries. Initialized in Awake() and set to null in OnDestroy().

member.name: F:Map.nearestUnit
member.summary: Temporary storage for the nearest unit found during proximity searches. Used by GetNearestUnit methods to track the closest unit while iterating through all units. This field is used for optimization to avoid allocating new variables during frequent proximity checks.

member.name: F:Map.units
member.summary: Static list containing all active Unit objects in the map. This is the primary registry for all enemies, NPCs, and other unit types. Units are added during spawn/creation and removed when destroyed. Used for AI targeting and game state management.

member.name: F:Map.wildLife
member.summary: Static list tracking all wildlife creatures in the map (pigs, chickens, etc). Wildlife are registered via RegisterWildLife() and removed via RemoveWildLife(). Separate from the disturbed wildlife tracking.

member.name: M:Map.ActivateNearbyAlienTelepathyTriggers(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Activates alien telepathy triggers within sensing range of the specified grid position.
member.param: The column index of the activation source
The row index of the activation source
The current chain reaction count for limiting propagation
member.remarks: This method iterates through all registered alien telepathy triggers and activates those within their defined sensing range. Each trigger has its own columnSenseRange and rowSenseRange values that determine its activation distance. When activated, triggers receive the source position and an incremented chain count, allowing for cascading activation effects. The method processes the list in reverse order for safe modification during iteration. This system is used for alien enemy coordination and environmental reactions.
