member.name: F:Sound.playingBossPulse
member.summary: Indicates whether boss pulse music is currently playing. Boss pulse music is looping background music used during boss encounters or special sequences. When true, it affects music volume calculations and prevents intensity-based music switching.

member.name: F:Sound.playingMusicLoud
member.summary: Indicates whether music should be played at increased volume. When true, music volume is multiplied by 1.25f. Used for dramatic sequences like the Star Spangled Banner or certain victory stings. Resets to false when switching to other music types.

member.name: M:Sound.PlaySoundEffect(UnityEngine.AudioClip[],System.Single)
member.summary: Plays a random sound effect from an array at the Sound instance's position. Returns immediately if array is empty. Otherwise selects a random clip and calls the single-clip overload with default pitch of 1.0.
member.param: Array of AudioClips to randomly select from
Volume level for playback

member.name: M:Sound.PlaySoundEffect(UnityEngine.AudioClip[],System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Plays a random sound effect from an array at the Sound instance's position with specified pitch. Returns immediately if array is empty. Otherwise selects a random clip and calls the single-clip overload with the specified pitch.
member.param: Array of AudioClips to randomly select from
Volume level for playback
Pitch multiplier for playback

member.name: M:Sound.PlaySoundEffect(UnityEngine.AudioClip,System.Single)
member.summary: Plays a sound effect at the Sound instance's position with default pitch. Simply calls the pitch-enabled overload with a pitch value of 1.0.
member.param: The AudioClip to play
Volume level for playback

member.name: M:Sound.PlaySoundEffect(UnityEngine.AudioClip,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Plays a sound effect at the Sound instance's position. Returns if clip is null or hasPlayedEffectSound is true. Creates the sound using PlayAudioClip with the Sound instance position, disabling reverb bypass and marking as an announcer sound. Parents the created AudioSource to the Sound instance and sets hasPlayedEffectSound to prevent multiple plays in the same frame.
member.param: The AudioClip to play
Volume level for playback
Pitch multiplier for playback

member.name: M:Sound.PlaySoundEffectAt(UnityEngine.AudioClip[],System.Single,UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Plays a random sound effect from an array of clips at a specific 3D position. Returns null if clips array is null or empty. Otherwise selects a random clip from the array and calls the single-clip overload with all provided parameters.
member.param: Array of AudioClips to randomly select from
Volume level for playback
3D position where the sound should originate
Pitch multiplier (default 1.0)
Whether to bypass reverb zones (default true)
Whether to bypass audio effects (default false)
Whether to prevent pooling this sound (default false)
Delay in seconds before playing (default 0)
member.returns: The AudioSource playing the sound, or null if clips array was invalid

member.name: M:Sound.PlaySoundEffectAt(UnityEngine.AudioClip,System.Single,UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Plays a sound effect at a specific 3D position. Returns null if clip is null or hasPlayedEffectSound is true (preventing multiple effect sounds in the same frame). Otherwise calls PlayAudioClip with the provided parameters to create a positioned sound effect.
member.param: The AudioClip to play
Volume level for playback
3D position where the sound should originate
Pitch multiplier (default 1.0)
Whether to bypass reverb zones (default true)
Whether to bypass audio effects (default false)
Whether to prevent pooling this sound (default false)
Delay in seconds before playing (default 0)
member.returns: The AudioSource playing the sound, or null if unable to play

member.name: M:Sound.PlaySoundEffectSpecial(UnityEngine.AudioClip[],System.Single)
member.summary: Plays a special sound effect from an array, selecting randomly. Returns immediately if array is empty. This method appears to bypass the hasPlayedEffectSound check by calling the regular PlaySoundEffect method, allowing special sounds to play even if a regular effect has already played this frame.
member.param: Array of AudioClips to randomly select from
Volume level for playback

member.name: M:Sound.PlaySoundEffectSpecial(UnityEngine.AudioClip,System.Single)
member.summary: Plays a special sound effect that bypasses normal effect sound restrictions. Returns if clip is null. Creates the sound using PlayAudioClip at the Sound instance position with reverb bypass enabled. Parents the AudioSource to the Sound instance. Unlike regular PlaySoundEffect, this doesn't check or set hasPlayedEffectSound.
member.param: The AudioClip to play
Volume level for playback

member.name: F:Sound.achievementSoundClip
member.summary: Audio clip intended for achievement unlock notifications. Currently not used in the codebase - appears to be a placeholder for an achievement system that was not implemented or was removed.

member.name: F:Sound.brodownMusic
member.summary: Audio clip for the special music played during BroDown game mode. Used in SetMusic() when GameModeController.GameMode is BroDown, overriding normal level music.

member.name: F:Sound.chainJangles
member.summary: Array of chain jangling sound effect clips. Currently unused in Sound.cs but likely used by chain-related game objects for ambient metal chain sounds.

member.name: F:Sound.chainSnap
member.summary: Chain snapping/breaking sound effect clip. Currently unused in Sound.cs but likely triggered when chain objects break or snap in the game world.

member.name: F:Sound.giveHalo
member.summary: Halo giving sound effect clip. Currently unused in Sound.cs but may be triggered when players receive holy/angelic power-ups or halos.

member.name: F:Sound.hasPlayedChargeSound
member.summary: A per-frame flag preventing multiple charging/power-up sound effects from playing simultaneously. Reset to false at the end of each LateUpdate cycle. Likely used by weapon charging systems or special ability code to ensure only one charge-up sound effect plays per frame, preventing audio distortion from overlapping charge sounds.

member.name: F:Sound.hasPlayedCreatureSound
member.summary: A per-frame flag preventing multiple creature/enemy sound effects from playing simultaneously. Reset to false at the end of each LateUpdate cycle. While not used within the Sound class itself, this flag is likely checked by creature/enemy code before playing sounds like roars or death cries, ensuring only one creature sound plays per frame to avoid cacophony.

member.name: F:Sound.hasPlayedEffectSound
member.summary: A per-frame flag preventing multiple general sound effects from playing simultaneously. Set to true when PlaySoundEffect() or PlaySoundEffectAt() successfully plays a sound, preventing additional effect sounds that frame. Reset to false at the end of each LateUpdate cycle. This throttling prevents audio distortion from overlapping similar sounds and maintains clean audio output during intense action.

member.name: F:Sound.hasPlayedExplosionSound
member.summary: A per-frame flag preventing multiple explosion sound effects from playing simultaneously. Reset to false at the end of each LateUpdate cycle. While not actively used in the current Sound class implementation, this flag is likely checked by other game systems before playing explosion sounds to avoid audio overload when multiple explosions occur in the same frame.

member.name: F:Sound.hasPlayedHeroSound
member.summary: A per-frame flag preventing multiple hero/player character sound effects from playing simultaneously. Reset to false at the end of each LateUpdate cycle (note: reset twice in the code, likely a minor bug). Expected to be checked by hero/bro code before playing sounds like grunts, special moves, or voice lines to maintain audio clarity.

member.name: F:Sound.hasPlayedSpeechSound
member.summary: A per-frame flag preventing multiple speech/dialogue sound effects from playing simultaneously. Reset to false at the end of each LateUpdate cycle. While not used within Sound class, this flag would be checked by dialogue or announcement systems to ensure only one speech clip plays per frame, preventing overlapping voice lines that would be unintelligible.

member.name: F:Sound.resurrectHoly
member.summary: Holy resurrection sound effect clip. Currently unused in Sound.cs but may be triggered by game events related to player resurrection or holy power-ups.

member.name: F:Sound.rogueforceBombardmentSiren
member.summary: Audio clip for the bombardment warning siren. Note: This field references RogueForce content which is incomplete/unavailable in current game builds. The TimePressureBombardment system that would use this is disabled.

member.name: M:Sound.GetPoolClip
member.summary: Retrieves a reusable audio source from the object pool. Returns null if the pool is empty. Otherwise takes the last item from _oneShotBank, removes it from the list, activates its GameObject, enables the component, and returns it for use.
member.returns: A ReusableOneShotSound from the pool, or null if pool is empty

member.name: M:Sound.PlayAudioClip(UnityEngine.AudioClip,UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Core method for playing audio clips with full control over positioning and effects. Creates or retrieves an AudioSource (from pool unless neverPool is true), configures all audio properties including 3D positioning, pitch adjustment (with special handling for announcer sounds and low currentPitch values), rolloff settings, and bypass flags. For positioned sounds, calculates distance-based volume falloff and stereo panning relative to the camera. Handles delayed playback and automatic cleanup timing based on clip length. Announcer sounds get special settings with no distance falloff and higher priority.
member.param: The AudioClip to play
3D position for the sound
Base volume level
Pitch multiplier (adjusted by currentPitch)
Whether to bypass reverb zones
Whether to bypass audio effects
Delay before playing in seconds
Whether this is an announcer sound with special settings
Whether to prevent pooling this AudioSource
member.returns: The configured AudioSource, or null if unable to create

member.name: M:Sound.Repool(ReusableOneShotSound)
member.summary: Static method that returns a ReusableOneShotSound to the object pool. Adds the sound back to the singleton instance's _oneShotBank list for future reuse.
member.param: The ReusableOneShotSound to return to the pool

member.name: F:Sound.OneShotPoolSize
member.summary: Defines the maximum number of pooled audio sources for one-shot sound effects. This constant sets the size of the reusable audio source pool at 64, though the actual pooling implementation and usage of this value is not directly visible in the provided code. The pool system helps optimize performance by reusing audio sources instead of creating new ones.

member.name: F:Sound._oneShotBank
member.summary: A pool of reusable audio source components for efficient sound effect playback. Initialized with 64 ReusableOneShotSound objects during Awake() to avoid runtime allocations. When playing a sound effect, an available source is pulled from this list, configured, and played. After the sound completes, it's returned to the pool via Repool(). This pooling system prevents garbage collection overhead from constantly creating/destroying GameObjects for short sound effects.

member.name: M:Sound.Dimmusic(System.Single)
member.summary: Temporarily dims the music volume for a specified duration. Sets the musicDimTime field which is used in Update to apply a volume reduction effect. The music volume gradually fades down and stays dimmed until the timer expires, creating a smooth ducking effect for emphasis on other audio.
member.param: The duration in seconds to keep the music dimmed

member.name: M:Sound.LowPassFilter(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a low-pass audio filter effect for a specified duration. Sets up the filter parameters and enables lowPassFading to create a muffled sound effect. The actual filtering is handled by RunLowPassFilter and continues until the duration expires. Commonly used for underwater effects or emphasis moments.
member.param: The filter intensity (0-1 range, where lower values create more muffling)
How long in seconds to maintain the low-pass filter effect

member.name: M:Sound.RunLowPassFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Configures and enables the low-pass filter with a target cutoff frequency based on the intensity parameter. When m is 1.0 or higher, sets the target frequency to 10000Hz for minimal filtering. Lower m values reduce the target frequency proportionally (10000 * m), creating stronger muffling effects. Always enables the filter and sets lowPassFading to true to trigger gradual transitions.
member.param: The filter intensity multiplier (1.0 = minimal effect, lower values = more muffling)

member.name: M:Sound.RunPitch
member.summary: Handles the gradual pitch shifting and low-pass filter effects over time. When shiftingPitch is active, smoothly transitions currentPitch toward desiredPitch at 0.5 units per second. Applies the pitch to all music AudioSources (main, low intensity, high intensity) as (1 + currentPitch) / 2. Also manages the low-pass filter effect based on pitch and lowPassTimeOut, creating a muffled effect at extreme pitch values.

member.name: M:Sound.SetMusicVolume(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the volume of the currently playing music based on player options. Updates the music AudioSource volume to match the PlayerOptions.Instance.musicVolume setting, clamped between 0 and 1. When not in a menu screen, also updates the currentIntensityMusicVolume field to track the gameplay music volume.
member.param: The volume value parameter (currently unused - method always uses PlayerOptions.Instance.musicVolume instead)

member.name: M:Sound.SetPitch(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets a target pitch value for gradual pitch shifting of all music tracks. Enables smooth pitch transitions by setting desiredPitch and activating the shiftingPitch flag. The actual pitch change occurs over time in RunPitch(), creating a time-slowing or time-speeding effect on the audio.
member.param: The target pitch value (1.0 is normal speed, lower values slow down, higher values speed up)

member.name: M:Sound.SetPitchNearInstant(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the pitch with a faster transition than SetPitch. Immediately adjusts currentPitch to 75% of the target value before enabling gradual shifting to the final pitch. Used for more responsive pitch changes while still maintaining some smoothness in the transition.
member.param: The target pitch value to transition to

member.name: M:Sound.StartDippingMusicVolume(System.Single)
member.summary: Begins temporarily reducing the music volume by setting a multiplier value. This creates a "ducking" effect where music volume is lowered (typically during important sound effects or dialogue). The actual volume reduction is applied during Update when multiplying with dippingMusicVolumeM.
member.param: The volume multiplier to apply (0-1 range, where lower values reduce volume more)

member.name: M:Sound.StopDippingMusicVolume
member.summary: Stops the music volume dipping effect by resetting the dippingMusicVolumeM multiplier back to 1.0. This restores the music to its normal volume level after a temporary reduction.

member.name: M:Sound.SuddenLowPass(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies an immediate low-pass filter effect at the Sound instance's position. This is a convenience overload that calls the position-based version using the Sound transform position. Creates an instant muffled effect without gradual transition.
member.param: The filter intensity (0-1 range, where lower values create more muffling)

member.name: M:Sound.SuddenLowPass(System.Single,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Applies an immediate low-pass filter effect with distance-based attenuation. Only applies if useSuddenLowPass is enabled and not already fading. Calculates distance from the sound position to the effect position and reduces the filter intensity based on lowPassMinRange and lowPassMaxRange. Sets the audio low-pass filter cutoff frequency for an instant muffled effect, commonly used for explosions or impacts.
member.param: The base filter intensity (0-1 range)
The world position where the effect originates (used for distance calculations)

member.name: F:Sound.audioLowPass
member.summary: Reference to the AudioLowPassFilter component used for muffled sound effects during explosions or dramatic moments. When enabled, this filter reduces high frequencies to create an underwater or shell-shocked audio effect. The cutoff frequency is dynamically adjusted between the target frequency and frequency loss values. Automatically disabled when the effect completes or when cutoff frequency exceeds 3000Hz to save processing power.

member.name: F:Sound.currentPitch
member.summary: Current pitch multiplier applied to music playback. Smoothly interpolates towards desiredPitch when shiftingPitch is true. Affects all music sources and some sound effects. Default is 1.0 (normal pitch).

member.name: F:Sound.desiredPitch
member.summary: Target pitch value that currentPitch should transition to. Used for smooth pitch shifting effects on music and sound. Default is 1.0 (normal pitch). Values below 1 lower pitch, above 1 raise pitch.

member.name: F:Sound.dippingMusicVolumeM
member.summary: Music volume multiplier for temporary volume reduction ("dipping"). Defaults to 1.0f (no reduction). Can be set via StartDippingMusicVolume() to reduce music during important sound effects or dialogue, then restored with StopDippingMusicVolume().

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassFading
member.summary: Whether the low-pass filter is currently transitioning between frequencies. When true, the Update method interpolates lowPassFreqCurrent towards lowPassFreqTarget each frame. Set to false when the transition completes.

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassFreqCurrent
member.summary: Current low-pass filter cutoff frequency in Hz. Smoothly interpolates towards lowPassFreqTarget during filter fading. Higher values mean less filtering (more treble frequencies pass through). Default is 10000Hz (minimal filtering).

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassFreqLoss
member.summary: Amount of frequency reduction applied to the low-pass filter cutoff. Subtracted from lowPassFreqCurrent when setting the actual filter cutoff frequency. Used for sudden low-pass effects like explosions. Gradually diminishes based on lowPassFrequencyJitterDampening.

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassFreqTarget
member.summary: The target cutoff frequency in Hz for the low-pass filter effect. Default is 10000Hz (minimal filtering). During filter effects, this is set to lower values like 12500Hz for sudden impacts or calculated values for pitch-based filtering. The actual filter frequency lerps towards this target at different rates (5f/second when increasing, 12f/second when decreasing) to create smooth transitions. Values below 3000Hz create heavily muffled audio.

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassFrequencyJitterDampening
member.summary: Dampening factor for reducing lowPassFreqLoss over time. Higher values cause the frequency loss to diminish more quickly, returning the audio to normal faster after sudden filter effects. Default is 12.

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassM
member.summary: Multiplier for low-pass filter effects during timeout periods. Values between 0 and 1 control filter intensity (0 = maximum filtering, 1 = no filtering). Gradually returns to 1 when lowPassTimeOut expires. Default is 1.

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassMaxRange
member.summary: Maximum effective range for sudden low-pass filter effects. Beyond this distance, no filtering is applied. Used with lowPassMinRange to create a gradual falloff zone where filter intensity decreases with distance. Default is 300 units.

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassMinRange
member.summary: Minimum distance in units before sudden low-pass effects begin to apply. Sounds within this range receive full filter effect. Used in conjunction with lowPassMaxRange to calculate distance-based filter falloff. Default is 160 units.

member.name: F:Sound.lowPassTimeOut
member.summary: Duration in seconds for temporary low-pass filter effects. When positive, maintains the low-pass filter with lowPassM multiplier. When reaching zero, the filter gradually returns to normal. Set to -1 to disable timeout-based filtering.

member.name: F:Sound.musicDimTime
member.summary: The remaining time in seconds for temporary music volume reduction (dimming). When greater than 0, music volume is reduced by a factor calculated as (1 - min(musicDimTime * 4, 0.9)), creating a quick dip in volume. Used for emphasis during special moments like announcements or dramatic effects. The dim effect gradually fades back to normal volume as the timer counts down to zero.

member.name: F:Sound.shiftingPitch
member.summary: Whether pitch is currently transitioning between values. When true, RunPitch interpolates currentPitch towards desiredPitch at 0.5 units per second. Also triggers low-pass filtering based on pitch value.

member.name: F:Sound.useSuddenLowPass
member.summary: Whether sudden low-pass filter effects (like explosions) are enabled. When true, allows SuddenLowPass method to apply immediate frequency reduction based on distance from effect source. Default is true.

member.name: F:Sound.wordTime
member.summary: A timing constant set to 0.4 seconds, though it appears to be unused in the current implementation. Based on the field name and value, this was likely intended to control timing for speech or word-based audio effects, possibly for lip-sync or dialogue pacing. The field remains in the code but has no active references in the Sound class methods.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.Awake
member.summary: Unity Awake method that initializes the sprite's mesh components and texture. Gets MeshFilter and MeshRenderer components, destroys any existing shared mesh, extracts texture from material, starts the animation pump if needed, and creates normals array if requested.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.Clear
member.summary: Resets the sprite to default state. Disables billboarding, sets color to white, resets offset to zero, and clears the animation complete delegate.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.Init
member.summary: Initializes the sprite mesh with vertices, UVs, colors, and triangles. Creates a new dynamic mesh if needed, sets up winding order, calculates UVs with bleed compensation, configures pixel-perfect rendering if enabled, and applies initial size and color.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.OnDisable
member.summary: Unity OnDisable callback that temporarily removes the sprite from the animation system when disabled. Preserves the animating state so it can be restored when re-enabled.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.OnEnable
member.summary: Unity OnEnable callback that re-adds the sprite to the animation system if it was animating when disabled. Only operates in play mode to avoid editor issues.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.Start
member.summary: Unity Start method that completes sprite initialization. Stores the initial UV rectangle, calculates pixels per UV unit from texture dimensions, and sets up the camera reference for pixel-perfect rendering calculations.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.AddToAnimatedList
member.summary: Adds this sprite to the global animation pump for frame updates. Starts the animation pump if not already running and marks the sprite as animating.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.Copy(SpriteBase)
member.summary: Copies configuration from another sprite including material, texture, plane orientation, winding order, offset, anchor method, resize settings, pixel perfect flag, and color. Updates texture dimensions for UV calculations.
member.param: Source sprite to copy settings from

member.name: M:SpriteBase.IsAnimating
member.summary: Checks whether this sprite is currently animating.
member.returns: True if the sprite is in the animation update list, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.PauseAnim
member.summary: Pauses the sprite animation by removing it from the animation update list. The animation state is preserved and can be resumed later.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.RecalcTexture
member.summary: Refreshes texture reference from the current material's main texture. Updates pixel dimensions used for UV coordinate calculations. Called when material or texture changes.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.RemoveFromAnimatedList
member.summary: Removes this sprite from the global animation pump, stopping frame updates. Marks the sprite as no longer animating.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.RevertToStatic
member.summary: Reverts the sprite to its static (non-animated) state. Stops any active animation, recalculates UVs, applies bleed compensation, and optionally resizes based on pixel-perfect or auto-resize settings.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetAnimCompleteDelegate(SpriteBase.AnimCompleteDelegate)
member.summary: Sets a delegate to be called when the current animation completes. Used for triggering events or transitioning to other animations when an animation cycle finishes.
member.param: Delegate to invoke when animation completes, or null to clear

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetColor(UnityEngine.Color)
member.summary: Sets the vertex color for all four vertices of the sprite. Color is multiplied with texture in the shader for tinting effects.
member.param: Color to apply to all vertices

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetSpriteResizedDelegate(SpriteBase.SpriteResizedDelegate)
member.summary: Sets a delegate to be called whenever the sprite is resized. Useful for updating dependent systems when sprite dimensions change due to UV updates or manual resizing.
member.param: Delegate to invoke when sprite is resized, receives new width, height, and sprite reference

member.name: M:SpriteBase.StepAnim(System.Single)
member.summary: Virtual method for advancing sprite animation by the specified time delta. Base implementation returns false. Derived classes override this to implement actual animation logic.
member.param: Time elapsed since last animation step in seconds
member.returns: Always returns false in base implementation. Derived classes return true if animation continues, false if complete

member.name: M:SpriteBase.StopAnim
member.summary: Virtual method that stops the sprite animation. Base implementation is empty - override in derived classes to implement custom animation stopping behavior.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.TransformBillboarded(UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Transforms the sprite to face a specific transform (billboard effect). Currently empty in base class, likely implemented in derived classes for camera-facing sprites.
member.param: Transform to face towards

member.name: P:SpriteBase.MeshRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the MeshRenderer component used to render this sprite. Provides direct access to rendering properties like materials and shadows.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.animCompleteDelegate
member.summary: Delegate invoked when an animation completes playback. Set via SetAnimCompleteDelegate method and called by derived classes (PackedSprite, SpriteSM) when they finish playing an animation sequence. Allows external code to respond to animation completion events for state transitions or chaining animations.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.animating
member.summary: Indicates whether the sprite is currently playing an animation. When true, the sprite is registered with the SpriteAnimationPump for regular StepAnim updates. Managed by AddToAnimatedList/RemoveFromAnimatedList methods and preserved across OnDisable/OnEnable cycles.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.defaultAnim
member.summary: The index of the animation to play by default. Used in conjunction with playAnimOnStart to automatically begin animation playback when the sprite initializes. Also used as the fallback animation when an animation completes with the Play_Default_Anim end action. Must be a valid index within the animations array.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.framesToAdvance
member.summary: The number of animation frames to advance in the current update, calculated as timeSinceLastFrame / timeBetweenAnimFrames. Allows animations to catch up if multiple frames worth of time have elapsed since the last update, ensuring smooth playback even with variable frame rates.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.playAnimOnStart
member.summary: When true, automatically plays the default animation when the sprite starts. Used by derived classes like PackedSprite and SpriteSM to trigger initial animation playback during their Start method if a valid defaultAnim index is specified and the application is playing.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.resizedDelegate
member.summary: Delegate invoked when the sprite is resized via SetSize method. Receives the new width, height, and a reference to the sprite being resized. Allows external code to respond to size changes for layout updates or dependent object adjustments. Set via SetSpriteResizedDelegate method.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.timeBetweenAnimFrames
member.summary: The duration in seconds between animation frames, calculated as 1/framerate. Used with timeSinceLastFrame to determine when to advance the animation. Set by derived classes when playing animations to control playback speed.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.timeSinceLastFrame
member.summary: Accumulates elapsed time since the last animation frame change. Used by derived animation classes to determine when to advance to the next frame based on the animation framerate. Reset to zero (minus overflow) each time a frame advances.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.CalcEdges
member.summary: Calculates the top-left and bottom-right corner positions based on the current anchor method. Supports nine anchor points (corners, edges, and center) for flexible sprite positioning.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.CalcSize
member.summary: Calculates sprite dimensions based on rendering mode. In pixel-perfect mode, calculates size from screen pixels and orthographic camera size. In auto-resize mode, scales proportionally with UV changes. Updates sprite size after calculation.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.RefreshVertices
member.summary: Recalculates and updates all vertex positions with shear and skew effects applied. Used for creating slanted or distorted sprites while maintaining proper UV mapping.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetSize(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the sprite size and updates vertex positions based on the current plane orientation. Routes to appropriate size setting method (SetSizeXY, SetSizeXZ, or SetSizeYZ) and invokes resize delegate if set.
member.param: New width of the sprite in world units
New height of the sprite in world units

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetSizeXY(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Updates sprite vertices for XY plane orientation (standard 2D sprite facing camera). Calculates edge positions based on anchor point and updates all four vertices with proper offset application.
member.param: Width of the sprite in world units
Height of the sprite in world units

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetSizeXZ(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Updates sprite vertices for XZ plane orientation (ground/ceiling sprite). Positions vertices in the horizontal plane with Y as the up axis.
member.param: Width of the sprite in world units
Height (depth) of the sprite in world units

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetSizeYZ(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Updates sprite vertices for YZ plane orientation (wall sprite facing sideways). Positions vertices in the YZ plane with X as the normal direction.
member.param: Width of the sprite in world units
Height of the sprite in world units

member.name: F:SpriteBase.colors
member.summary: Array of 4 vertex colors for the sprite quad. All elements set to same color value by SetColor(). Allows per-vertex tinting if needed. Applied to mesh.colors for rendering.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.faces
member.summary: Triangle indices array defining two triangles (6 indices) that form the sprite quad. Order determined by SetWindingOrder() - CCW uses [0,1,3,3,1,2] and CW uses [0,3,1,3,2,1].

member.name: F:SpriteBase.mesh
member.summary: The dynamically created Mesh object for this sprite. Created in Init() with MarkDynamic() for frequent updates. Stores vertices, UVs, colors, and triangle data for rendering the sprite quad.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.meshFilter
member.summary: Reference to the MeshFilter component attached to this GameObject. Initialized in Awake() and used to assign the dynamically created mesh. Required component for sprite rendering.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.meshRenderer
member.summary: Reference to the MeshRenderer component attached to this GameObject. Initialized in Awake() and exposed via MeshRenderer property. Used to access material and texture information.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.normals
member.summary: Optional array of vertex normals for lighting calculations. Only created when createNormals is true. All normals face backward (Vector3.back) for typical 2D sprite lighting.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.texture
member.summary: Reference to the main texture used by this sprite. Retrieved from material's _MainTex property in Awake() and RecalcTexture(). Used for pixel-to-UV calculations and dimension calculations.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.uvs
member.summary: Primary UV coordinates array for the 4 sprite vertices. Updated by UpdateUVs() based on uvRect and winding order. Defines which part of the texture maps to each vertex.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.uvs2
member.summary: Secondary UV coordinates array for special effects. Set by SetUV2() to standard 0-1 quad values regardless of primary UVs. Can be used by shaders for effects independent of texture mapping.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.vertices
member.summary: Array of 4 vertices defining the sprite quad corners. Updated by SetSizeXY/XZ/YZ and RefreshVertices() methods. Order depends on winding setting. Applied to mesh for rendering.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.CalcUVs
member.summary: Virtual method for calculating UV coordinates. Base implementation is empty. Derived classes override this to implement specific UV calculation logic for different sprite types.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.PixelCoordToUVCoord(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Converts pixel coordinates to UV coordinates with Y-axis flipping for Unity's UV system. Unity UVs have origin at bottom-left while textures have origin at top-left.
member.param: Pixel coordinates to convert.
member.returns: UV coordinates with flipped Y axis.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.PixelCoordToUVCoord(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts integer pixel coordinates to UV coordinates with Y-axis flipping for Unity's UV system.
member.param: X pixel coordinate.
Y pixel coordinate.
member.returns: UV coordinates with flipped Y axis.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.PixelSpaceToUVSpace(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Converts pixel coordinates to UV space (0-1 range) based on texture dimensions.
member.param: Pixel coordinates to convert.
member.returns: UV coordinates in 0-1 range, or Vector2.zero if no texture is assigned.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.PixelSpaceToUVSpace(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts integer pixel coordinates to UV space (0-1 range) based on texture dimensions.
member.param: X pixel coordinate.
Y pixel coordinate.
member.returns: UV coordinates in 0-1 range.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetBleedCompensation
member.summary: Applies the current bleed compensation values to adjust UV coordinates. Bleed compensation prevents texture bleeding by inset the UV rectangle.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetBleedCompensation(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets and applies bleed compensation with specified pixel values. Bleed compensation prevents texture bleeding at sprite edges.
member.param: Horizontal bleed compensation in pixels.
Vertical bleed compensation in pixels.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetBleedCompensation(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets and applies bleed compensation from a Vector2. Converts pixel values to UV space and insets the UV rectangle to prevent texture bleeding.
member.param: Bleed compensation values in pixels (x and y).

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetUV2
member.summary: Sets secondary UV coordinates (UV2) for shader effects. Always uses normalized 0-1 coordinates regardless of primary UV settings, useful for effects that need full texture coverage.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetUVs(UnityEngine.Rect)
member.summary: Sets the UV rectangle for texture mapping. Applies bleed compensation and optionally recalculates size for pixel-perfect or auto-resize sprites.
member.param: The UV coordinate rectangle (0-1 range).

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetUVsFromPixelCoords(UnityEngine.Rect)
member.summary: Sets UV coordinates from pixel coordinates on the texture. Converts pixel coordinates to UV space (0-1 range) and applies settings.
member.param: Rectangle defining the sprite area in texture pixels.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.UpdateUVs
member.summary: Updates the UV coordinates of all four vertices based on current UV rectangle and winding order. Handles both clockwise and counter-clockwise winding to ensure proper texture display.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.bleedCompensationUV
member.summary: UV space inset calculated from bleedCompensation pixel values. Used internally by SetBleedCompensation() to adjust uvRect boundaries, preventing texture bleeding by moving UV coordinates inward from texture edges.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.bottomRight
member.summary: Calculated bottom-right corner position of sprite in local space. Set by CalcEdges() based on sprite dimensions and anchor method. Used as reference point for vertex calculations in SetSize methods.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.pixelsPerUV
member.summary: Stores the texture dimensions as pixels per UV unit. The x component contains the texture width in pixels and the y component contains the texture height. This value is automatically updated whenever the texture changes and is used to convert between pixel coordinates and UV coordinates during sprite rendering calculations.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.prevUVRect
member.summary: Previous frame's UV rectangle used for auto-resize calculations. When autoResize is enabled, CalcSize() compares current uvRect to this value to proportionally scale sprite dimensions when UV region changes.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.topLeft
member.summary: Calculated top-left corner position of sprite in local space. Set by CalcEdges() based on sprite dimensions and anchor method. Used as reference point for vertex calculations in SetSize methods.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.uvRect
member.summary: Rectangle defining the texture coordinates for this sprite in UV space (0-1 range). Modified by SetUVs(), SetUVsFromPixelCoords(), and SetBleedCompensation(). Used by UpdateUVs() to set mesh UV coordinates.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetAnchor(SpriteBase.ANCHOR_METHOD)
member.summary: Sets the anchor point for sprite positioning. Determines which part of the sprite aligns with its transform position.
member.param: The anchor method defining the alignment point.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetCamera(UnityEngine.Camera)
member.summary: Sets the camera reference for pixel-perfect calculations. Updates screen size from camera's pixel dimensions and recalculates sprite size to maintain pixel-perfect appearance.
member.param: Camera to use for pixel-perfect calculations, returns immediately if null

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetOffset(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets an additional position offset applied to the sprite vertices. Useful for fine-tuning sprite positioning.
member.param: The 3D offset to apply to sprite vertices.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetPlane(SpriteBase.SPRITE_PLANE)
member.summary: Sets the orientation plane for the sprite mesh (XY, XZ, or YZ). Rebuilds the mesh vertices for the new plane orientation.
member.param: The sprite plane orientation to use.

member.name: M:SpriteBase.SetWindingOrder(SpriteBase.WINDING_ORDER)
member.summary: Sets the triangle winding order for the mesh faces. Clockwise (CW) renders the front face, counter-clockwise (CCW) renders the back face.
member.param: The winding order to apply (CW or CCW).

member.name: F:SpriteBase.anchor
member.summary: The anchor point determining sprite alignment with its transform position. Default is MIDDLE_CENTER for centered sprites.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.autoResize
member.summary: Enables automatic sprite resizing when UV coordinates change. When true and UV rect changes, sprite dimensions are scaled proportionally to maintain the same aspect ratio as the texture region. Checked in CalcSize(), Copy(), and UV update methods.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.billboarded
member.summary: Flag indicating if sprite should face the camera (billboard mode). Currently only set/cleared but not actively used in base implementation - likely utilized by derived classes or external systems.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.bleedCompensation
member.summary: Pixel-based inset values to prevent texture bleeding at sprite edges. Applied to UV coordinates to slightly shrink the sampled area.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.color
member.summary: Vertex color applied to all four sprite vertices for tinting. Defaults to white (no tint). Updated via SetColor() which applies this color to the colors array and mesh.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.createNormals
member.summary: Controls whether mesh normals are generated. When true, creates a normals array with all vertices facing backward (Vector3.back) during Awake() and applies them during Init(). Used for sprites that need proper lighting.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.curCamera
member.summary: Reference to the current camera used for pixel-perfect calculations. Set by SetCamera() method. Used to get orthographic size for converting between world units and screen pixels.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.height
member.summary: The height of the sprite in world units. Used for mesh vertex calculation and size-based operations.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.offset
member.summary: 3D position offset applied to all sprite vertices. Added to calculated vertex positions in SetSizeXY/XZ/YZ methods to shift the entire sprite mesh. Can be updated via SetOffset() method.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.pixelPerfect
member.summary: Enables pixel-perfect sprite rendering mode. When true, sprite dimensions are automatically calculated based on camera orthographic size and screen dimensions to ensure 1:1 pixel mapping. Used in Init(), CalcSize(), and throughout rendering pipeline.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.plane
member.summary: The orientation plane for the sprite mesh. Determines whether the sprite is rendered on the XY (default 2D), XZ (ground), or YZ plane.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.screenSize
member.summary: Static screen dimensions in pixels shared across all sprites. Updated by SetCamera() with camera's pixel width/height. Used in CalcSize() for pixel-perfect calculations with orthographic camera size.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.shearAmount
member.summary: Horizontal shear factor for skewing sprite vertices. Applied to top vertices when RefreshVertices() is called, creating a parallelogram effect by offsetting the top edge horizontally by this amount multiplied by sprite width.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.skewAmount
member.summary: Vertical skew factor for tilting sprite vertices. Applied when RefreshVertices() is called - subtracts from top-left vertex Y and adds to top-right vertex Y, creating a tilted appearance.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.width
member.summary: The width of the sprite in world units. Used for mesh vertex calculation and size-based operations.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.winding
member.summary: The triangle winding order for mesh faces. CW (clockwise) shows the front face, CCW (counter-clockwise) shows the back face. Default is CW.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.worldUnitsPerScreenPixel
member.summary: The conversion factor between world units and screen pixels for pixel-perfect rendering. Calculated as (camera orthographic size * 2) / screen height when pixelPerfect is enabled. This value ensures sprites are rendered at exact pixel boundaries without filtering artifacts, maintaining the crisp pixel art aesthetic.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.i
member.summary: General purpose loop iterator variable. Used by derived classes as a temporary variable during various operations. Not used directly in SpriteBase but provided as a protected member for subclass convenience.

member.name: F:SpriteBase.tempUV
member.summary: Temporary UV coordinate storage used during calculations. Used in CalcSize for auto-resize UV ratio calculations and in SetUVsFromPixelCoords for pixel-to-UV conversions. Avoids allocation of new Vector2 objects during frequent operations.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Awake
member.summary: Unity Awake callback that initializes the sprite system. Creates normals, gets the mesh renderer component, initializes the animations array if null, builds all UV animations, and calls base initialization. This ensures all sprite components are properly set up before Start is called.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.OnDrawGizmos
member.summary: Unity editor callback that monitors sprite changes during edit mode. Creates and maintains a SpriteMirror instance to detect property changes, automatically reinitializing the sprite when modifications are detected to ensure real-time preview updates in the editor.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Start
member.summary: Unity Start callback that plays the default animation if configured. Checks if playAnimOnStart is true, defaultAnim is within the animations array bounds, and the application is playing (not in editor mode). This allows sprites to automatically start animating when the game begins.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Clear
member.summary: Clears the sprite state by calling base clear functionality and stopping any current animation. If an animation is playing, it pauses the animation and sets the current animation reference to null. This effectively resets the sprite to its initial non-animated state.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Copy(SpriteBase)
member.summary: Copies all settings from another SpriteSM instance. Copies base sprite properties, lower left pixel, pixel dimensions, bleed compensation, and size settings. Also duplicates the entire animations array and rebuilds all UV animations for this sprite. This creates a complete duplicate of the source sprite's visual configuration.
member.param: The source sprite to copy settings from. Must be a SpriteSM instance.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetTextureDefaults
member.summary: Sets the sprite to use the full texture dimensions as defaults. Recalculates the texture reference, sets the lower left pixel to (0, texture.height), sets the sprite size to match the texture dimensions, updates pixel dimensions, calculates UVs, and updates the mesh UVs. This is useful for initializing a sprite to display an entire texture without manual configuration.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.lockWidthAndHeight
member.summary: When true, forces the sprite's world size to exactly match its pixel dimensions. Overrides autoResize behavior and ensures 1:1 pixel-to-unit scaling regardless of other size calculation settings.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.meshRender
member.summary: Cached reference to the Renderer component on this GameObject. Used for accessing the material and texture during trim operations and pixel sampling. Initialized during Awake.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.mirror
member.summary: SpriteMirror instance used exclusively in the editor to detect property changes. Stores a snapshot of sprite properties and compares them each frame to automatically reinitialize the sprite when modifications occur.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.refreshMeshNow
member.summary: Editor flag that forces an immediate mesh update when set to true. Used in editor scripts to trigger sprite recreation after property changes without waiting for the next update cycle.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.CalcUVs
member.summary: Calculates the UV coordinates for the sprite based on pixel coordinates. Converts the lower left pixel position to UV space and sets the UV rect's position. Then converts pixel dimensions to UV space and sets the UV rect's size. This mapping allows the sprite to display the correct portion of its texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetLowerLeftPixel(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the lower left pixel coordinate of the sprite on the texture and recalculates all UV mappings. Updates the UV rect position and size based on the new pixel coordinates, applies bleed compensation, and optionally recalculates the sprite size if auto-resize or pixel-perfect mode is enabled.
member.param: The pixel coordinates of the lower left corner on the texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetLowerLeftPixel(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the lower left pixel coordinate of the sprite on the texture using individual X and Y values. This is a convenience overload that creates a Vector2 and calls the main SetLowerLeftPixel method.
member.param: The X pixel coordinate on the texture.
The Y pixel coordinate on the texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetLowerLeftPixel(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the lower-left corner position of the sprite within the texture in pixel coordinates. Recalculates UV coordinates, applies bleed compensation, and optionally resizes the sprite based on autoResize or pixelPerfect settings.
member.param: The pixel coordinates of the lower-left corner in texture space.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetLowerLeftPixel(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the lower-left corner position of the sprite within the texture using individual x and y pixel coordinates. Wrapper method that creates a Vector2 and calls the main SetLowerLeftPixel method.
member.param: The x pixel coordinate of the lower-left corner.
The y pixel coordinate of the lower-left corner.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetPixelDimensions(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the pixel dimensions of the sprite on the texture and updates UV coordinates accordingly. Converts pixel space to UV space, updates the UV rect size, applies bleed compensation, and optionally recalculates sprite size for auto-resize or pixel-perfect modes. If lockWidthAndHeight is true, also updates the sprite's world size to match pixel dimensions.
member.param: The width and height in pixels on the texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetPixelDimensions(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the pixel dimensions of the sprite on the texture using individual width and height values. This is a convenience overload that creates a Vector2 and calls the main SetPixelDimensions method.
member.param: The width in pixels on the texture.
The height in pixels on the texture.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetPixelDimensions(UnityEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the pixel dimensions of the sprite region within the texture. Updates UV coordinates to match the new dimensions, applies bleed compensation, and optionally updates the sprite's world size based on lockWidthAndHeight, autoResize, or pixelPerfect settings.
member.param: The width and height in pixels of the sprite region.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.SetPixelDimensions(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the pixel dimensions of the sprite region within the texture using integer width and height values. Wrapper method that creates a Vector2 and calls the main SetPixelDimensions method.
member.param: The width in pixels of the sprite region.
The height in pixels of the sprite region.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.lowerLeftPixel
member.summary: The pixel coordinates of the lower-left corner of this sprite's region within the texture. Used as the starting point for UV coordinate calculations and determines which part of the texture is displayed.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.pixelDimensions
member.summary: The width and height in pixels of this sprite's region within the texture. Combined with lowerLeftPixel to define the complete rectangular area of the texture that this sprite displays.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.ExpandDown
member.summary: Expands the sprite area downward until no more non-transparent pixels are found. Checks each row below the current area, testing all pixels in that row. If any pixel has alpha greater than alphaBias, expands the area to include that row. Updates pixel dimensions, lower left position, size, and UVs to reflect the expanded area.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.ExpandLeft
member.summary: Expands the sprite area to the left until no more non-transparent pixels are found. Checks each column to the left of the current area, testing all pixels in that column. If any pixel has alpha greater than alphaBias, expands the area to include that column. Updates pixel dimensions, lower left position, size, and UVs to reflect the expanded area.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.ExpandRight
member.summary: Expands the sprite area to the right until no more non-transparent pixels are found. Checks each column to the right of the current area, testing all pixels in that column. If any pixel has alpha greater than alphaBias, expands the area to include that column. Updates pixel dimensions, size, and UVs to reflect the expanded area.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.ExpandUp
member.summary: Expands the sprite area upward until no more non-transparent pixels are found. Checks each row above the current area, testing all pixels in that row. If any pixel has alpha greater than alphaBias, expands the area to include that row. Updates pixel dimensions, size, and UVs to reflect the expanded area.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Trim
member.summary: Automatically trims transparent pixels from all sides of the sprite to create a tight bounding box. Snaps the sprite position to 0.5 unit intervals, reduces the sprite to a 2x2 pixel area at the center, then iteratively expands outward until non-transparent pixels are found. Finally trims any remaining transparent edges. This creates the smallest possible sprite that contains all visible pixels.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.TrimBottom
member.summary: Trims transparent pixels from the bottom of the sprite. Iterates through rows from bottom to top, checking all pixels in each row. Stops when a row contains any pixel with alpha greater than alphaBias. Updates the sprite's size, dimensions, lower left position, and UVs to exclude the trimmed area.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.TrimRight
member.summary: Trims transparent pixels from the right side of the sprite. Iterates through columns from right to left, checking all pixels in each column. Stops when a column contains any pixel with alpha greater than alphaBias. Updates the sprite's dimensions and UVs to exclude the trimmed area.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.TrimTop
member.summary: Trims transparent pixels from the top of the sprite. Iterates through rows from top to bottom, checking all pixels in each row. Stops when a row contains any pixel with alpha greater than alphaBias. Updates the sprite's size, dimensions, and UVs to exclude the trimmed area.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Trimleft
member.summary: Trims transparent pixels from the left side of the sprite. Iterates through columns from left to right, checking all pixels in each column. Stops when a column contains any pixel with alpha greater than alphaBias. Updates the sprite's position, dimensions, and UVs to exclude the trimmed area.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.alphaBias
member.summary: Alpha threshold value (0.2) used during trim operations. Pixels with alpha values below this threshold are considered transparent and will be trimmed. Higher values result in more aggressive trimming.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.trim
member.summary: Editor flag that enables automatic transparent pixel trimming. When true, the sprite boundaries are automatically adjusted to exclude fully transparent edges, optimizing the sprite size.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.AddAnimation(UVAnimation_Multi)
member.summary: Adds a new UV animation to the sprite's animation collection. Creates a new array with one additional slot, copies all existing animations, and adds the new animation at the end. This allows dynamic addition of animations at runtime.
member.param: The UV animation to add to the sprite.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.GetAnim(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an animation by name from the animations array. Searches through all configured animations and returns the first match found.
member.param: The name of the animation to retrieve.
member.returns: The UVAnimation_Multi with the specified name, or null if not found.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.GetCurAnim
member.summary: Returns the currently playing animation. Used to check animation state or access animation properties during playback.
member.returns: The current UVAnimation_Multi instance, or null if no animation is playing.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.PlayAnim(UVAnimation_Multi)
member.summary: Starts playing the specified UV animation from the beginning. Resets the animation, calculates frame timing based on the animation's framerate, and begins stepping through frames. For single-frame animations, immediately triggers the completion delegate. Adds the sprite to the animated list if it has multiple frames and isn't already animating.
member.param: The animation to play.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.PlayAnim(System.Int32)
member.summary: Plays an animation by its index in the animations array. Validates the index is within bounds before playing the animation at that position.
member.param: The zero-based index of the animation to play.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.PlayAnim(System.String)
member.summary: Plays an animation by its name. Searches through all animations to find one with a matching name and plays the first match found. Does nothing if no animation with the specified name exists.
member.param: The name of the animation to play.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.PlayAnimInReverse(UVAnimation_Multi)
member.summary: Starts playing the specified UV animation in reverse from the end. Resets the animation, sets it to play in reverse mode, calculates frame timing, and begins stepping backwards through frames. Handles single-frame animations and animation list management the same as forward playback.
member.param: The animation to play in reverse.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.PlayAnimInReverse(System.Int32)
member.summary: Plays an animation in reverse by its index in the animations array. Validates the index is within bounds before playing the animation at that position in reverse.
member.param: The zero-based index of the animation to play in reverse.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.PlayAnimInReverse(System.String)
member.summary: Plays the animation with the specified name in reverse direction. Searches through all animations in the animations array to find a match by name, then configures it to play backwards with the same framerate and animation settings as normal playback.
member.param: The name of the animation to play in reverse.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.StepAnim(System.Single)
member.summary: Advances the current animation by the specified time and updates the sprite's UV coordinates. Calculates frames to advance based on elapsed time and frame rate. Handles animation completion according to the animation's end action (do nothing, revert to static, or play default). Triggers animation complete delegate when appropriate. Updates bleed compensation and recalculates size if in auto-resize or pixel-perfect mode.
member.param: The time in seconds to advance the animation.
member.returns: True if the animation is still playing, false if it has completed.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.StopAnim
member.summary: Stops the currently playing animation and reverts the sprite to its static state. Removes the sprite from the animation update list, resets the current animation's frame counter, and restores the original UV coordinates.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.UnpauseAnim
member.summary: Resumes playback of a previously paused animation. If a current animation exists, re-adds the sprite to the animated update list to continue frame stepping.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.animations
member.summary: Array of all UV animations configured for this sprite. Each animation contains frame data, timing, and playback settings. Animations are identified by name and can be played, stopped, or reversed through the animation control methods.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.curAnim
member.summary: The currently playing animation instance. Null when no animation is active. Used by the animation system to track frame progression, handle animation events, and determine when animations complete.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.CheckReadbility
member.summary: Placeholder method for checking texture readability. Currently has no implementation but is called before pixel read operations. This may have been intended for runtime texture readability validation.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.GetPixel(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the color of a pixel at the specified texture coordinates. Returns transparent black if the material, texture, or coordinates are invalid. Checks texture readability, validates coordinates are within texture bounds, and returns the pixel color. Note that Y coordinates are flipped since Unity textures have origin at bottom-left.
member.param: The X coordinate on the texture in pixels.
The Y coordinate on the texture in pixels (bottom-left origin).
member.returns: The color of the pixel at the specified coordinates, or transparent black if invalid.

member.name: M:SpriteSM.Snap(System.Single)
member.summary: Snaps a value to the nearest interval as defined by roundInterval. Divides the value by the interval, rounds to the nearest integer, then multiplies back by the interval. This is used for pixel-perfect positioning and sizing.
member.param: The value to snap to the grid.
member.returns: The value snapped to the nearest interval.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.round
member.summary: Enables position rounding for pixel-perfect alignment. When true, sprite positions are snapped to intervals defined by roundInterval to prevent sub-pixel rendering artifacts.

member.name: F:SpriteSM.roundInterval
member.summary: The rounding interval in pixels used when round is enabled. Positions are snapped to multiples of this value. Default value of 1 provides standard pixel-perfect alignment.

member.name: M:StatisticsController.Awake
member.summary: Initializes the singleton instance and creates a new LevelStats object for tracking current level statistics. Sets initial destruction count to 0.

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotOnGUI
member.summary: Debug GUI display method (despite misleading name). Shows current level statistics including destruction count, kills/total enemies, formatted time, rescues/cages, brutality score, and brutality meter with scrollbar. Not actually disabled.

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotifyPause(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handles pause state notifications for time tracking. Records pause start time when paused. Placeholder for pause duration calculation when unpaused (currently unused).
member.param: True when game is paused, false when resumed

member.name: M:StatisticsController.Start
member.summary: Initializes statistics tracking for the level start. Resets elapsed time to 0, sets brutality and time percentiles to -1, initializes brutality grace period to 6 seconds, resets brutality level to 0, and loads existing campaign brutality totals if brutality scoring is enabled for the current campaign.

member.name: F:StatisticsController.pauseTime
member.summary: Tracks the timestamp when the game was paused. Set to current Time.time when paused, used for pause duration tracking. Initialized to -1f indicating no pause has occurred yet.

member.name: M:StatisticsController.DeserializeStats(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserializes received statistics data from network. Unpacks byte stream to populate current stats including all kill/alert counters, elapsed time, and level attempts. Creates new LevelStats if needed.
member.param: The serialized statistics data to unpack

member.name: M:StatisticsController.PackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Packs the current elapsed time into a network stream for multiplayer synchronization
member.param: The Unity network stream to serialize data to
member.returns: The modified stream after serialization
member.remarks: This method ensures all players have synchronized elapsed time. If no currentStats exists or instance is null, sends 0 as default time value

member.name: M:StatisticsController.SerializeStats
member.summary: Serializes current level statistics for network transmission. Packs destruction, kills, rescues, alert states, knife kills, unaware kills, elapsed time, and level attempts into byte array. Uses current stats or falls back to last level stats.
member.returns: Serialized statistics data as byte array

member.name: M:StatisticsController.UnpackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Unpacks elapsed time from a network stream during multiplayer synchronization
member.param: The Unity network stream to deserialize data from
member.returns: The stream after deserialization
member.remarks: Updates the current statistics elapsed time with the received value from the network

member.name: M:StatisticsController.CacheStats
member.summary: Caches the current level statistics for later aggregation (used by super checkpoints). If no cached stats exist, stores the current stats directly. If cached stats already exist, adds the current stats to them. Creates a new empty LevelStats object for continued tracking.

member.name: M:StatisticsController.CalcAndSubmitCampaignScore
member.summary: Calculates total campaign statistics and submits them to leaderboards. Iterates through all level scores to sum brutality and time, then submits to Playtomic if using Badumna connection. Called at campaign completion.

member.name: M:StatisticsController.CalculateTotalTime
member.summary: Calculates and synchronizes the total elapsed time across all players. Gets time from current or last level stats and sends RPC to all players if host. Ensures consistent time tracking in multiplayer.

member.name: M:StatisticsController.ClearCachedStats

member.name: M:StatisticsController.GetCampaignTotalBrotality

member.name: M:StatisticsController.GetCampaignTotalTime

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotifyKnifedMook(Mook)

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotifyMookDeath(Mook)

Increments kill count, updates brutality score based on kill timing (combo multiplier if kills within 0.5 seconds), sets brutality grace periods, adds 1 brutality point and 1 music intensity, updates last kill time, and tracks stealth kills if the mook was unaware.

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotifyMookHeardSound(Mook)

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotifyMookSeenBro(Mook)

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotifyRescue

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotifyTankDeath(Tank)

Updates vehicle death counters in world map saves, sets last kill time, adds 10 brutality points and 4 music intensity, and sets brutality grace period to 5 seconds (then immediately to 1 second). Tracks as vehicle type in campaign statistics.
member.param: The tank that was destroyed

member.name: M:StatisticsController.NotifyTruckDeath(Tank)
member.summary: Records a truck death for statistics and world map campaign tracking. Updates vehicle death counters in world map saves, sets last kill time, adds 5 brutality points and 3 music intensity, and sets brutality grace period to 4 seconds (then immediately to 1 second). Tracks as vehicle type in campaign statistics.
member.param: The truck (Tank instance) that was destroyed

Handles grace period countdown, brutality decay rates based on level (3-50 per second), applies decay multipliers for extended inactivity (up to 3x), manages music intensity fadeout, calculates brutality meter display value, updates brutality level thresholds, and tracks elapsed time when unpaused.

member.summary: Unity lifecycle callback when the GameObject is destroyed. Calls base implementation for cleanup.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RegisterUnit
member.summary: Registers this unit with the Map system for game tracking and management.

member.summary: Network synchronization method that updates the unit's position. Calls base synchronization and updates position based on current transform.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetDefaultGroundLayer
member.summary: Sets up the default ground collision layer mask including Ground, LargeObjects, and IndestructibleGround layers for ground detection and collision checking.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetDeltaTime
member.summary: Updates the frame delta time with clamping to prevent large time steps. Stores previous frame time and clamps current time to maximum of 0.0334 seconds.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetHighFiveBoostDeltaTime
member.summary: Sets modified delta time during high-five boost effects. Applies different time multipliers based on time scale and special boost conditions.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetStrictGroundLayer
member.summary: Sets up a strict ground collision layer mask including only Ground and IndestructibleGround layers, excluding LargeObjects for more restrictive ground detection.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Start
member.summary: Unity lifecycle method that handles game mode-specific initialization. Configures special ammo based on game mode (deathmatch, procedural generation, campaign), sets up sound system, avatar states, and initial invulnerability.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Update
member.summary: Core Unity lifecycle method that executes the main update loop for TestVanDammeAnim each frame. Processes essential character systems in this execution order: 1. **Acid coverage effects** - Visual and damage processing for acid-covered characters 2. **Delta time management** - Frame timing with high-five boost support 3. **Input processing** - Handle player input or trigger action control 4. **Status effect timers** - Stun, freeze, zombie revival, and death counters 5. **Animation frame management** - Sprite frame advancement and timing 6. **Movement calculation and execution** - Core physics and movement processing 7. **Special movement states** - Impaled, strung-up, or platform movement 8. **Combat systems** - Weapon management, firing, and melee processing 9. **Hero-specific systems** - Checkpoints, rescues, enemy alerting, item pickup 10. **Invulnerability management** - Temporary invincibility and revival timing 11. **Alien infection system** - Insemination mechanics and chest-bursting 12. **Environmental effects** - Ducking, grass interaction, boundary checks 13. **Audio and visual effects** - Wall dragging sounds, trails, freeze shaders 14. **Player management** - Kick system and recall mechanics 15. **Parachute system** - Deployment timing and physics modification This method coordinates all core character functionality and represents the main execution loop for character behavior.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CancelMelee
member.summary: Cleanly exits melee state and resets all melee-related variables. Clears all melee flags, removes target reference, and intelligently determines next action state based on current conditions (preserves ladder climbing, sets jumping if airborne, running if moving, or idle).

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CheckBustCage
member.summary: Checks if there's a cage in front of the player that can be broken. Performs a raycast within 16 units to detect cage components.
member.returns: True if a cage is found that can be busted, false otherwise

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CheckPlasmaDeath(System.Single@,System.Single@)

member.param: Reference to horizontal gib velocity, modified for plasma deaths
Reference to vertical gib velocity, modified for plasma deaths
member.returns: True if plasma death effects were triggered, false otherwise

Crush damage creates a spread pattern, OutOfBounds uses larger spread, and BittenBySandworm creates directional effects. Generates frozen particles if the character was frozen, plays gib sounds, and sprays blood effects.

Base horizontal velocity for effects
Base vertical velocity for effects

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CreateGibs(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Default gib creation method that generates standard gib pieces with velocity. Uses the character's material for gib textures and applies an upward bias to gib velocity for more dramatic effect.
member.param: Horizontal velocity for gib pieces
Vertical velocity for gib pieces

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Damage(System.Int32,DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Core damage handling method that processes all incoming damage to the character. Handles special cases like inseminator unit redirection, parachute destruction (grants 1.33s invulnerability), instant-gib damage types, acid coverage, skeleton creation, and damage reduction based on game mode. Creates appropriate visual effects (blood, impact effects) and manages death state including revival mechanics. Triggers death sequence if health drops below zero.
member.param: Amount of damage to apply
Type of damage being applied (affects reactions and effects)
Horizontal impulse force from damage
Vertical impulse force from damage
Direction of incoming damage (-1 left, 1 right)
The MonoBehaviour that caused the damage (for kill tracking)
X coordinate where damage was applied
Y coordinate where damage was applied

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.DealWithBounce(DamageType@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Handles bounce damage differently based on whether the unit is a player or enemy. For players in non-competitive modes, nullifies all damage and applies a 0.25 second blind effect instead. For enemies or players in DeathMatch/BroDown modes, changes the damage type to Crush.
member.param: Reference to the damage type, may be changed to Crush
Reference to the damage amount, set to 0 for players in non-competitive modes

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Death(System.Single,System.Single,DamageObject)
member.summary: Handles the complete character death sequence. Cancels active melee attacks, deactivates parachute, stops network syncing, clears revival sources, stops player UI bubbles, reports kills for scoring, reduces lives if applicable, applies death velocity modifications, deactivates weapons, creates blood effects, releases held objects, disables collision, and saves death GIFs for player characters. This is the main death orchestration method.
member.param: Horizontal velocity to apply on death
Vertical velocity to apply on death
DamageObject containing information about what killed the character

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.DestroyRemoteProjectile
member.summary: Destroys a remotely controlled projectile. Clears controlling flag and calls Death() on the projectile.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.FallDamage(System.Single)
member.summary: Virtual method for handling fall damage based on fall velocity. Empty implementation for subclasses to calculate and apply fall damage.
member.param: The vertical velocity at impact

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.FindNearbyMook
member.summary: Searches for a nearby mook that can be interacted with. Prioritizes skinned mook on the player's back, otherwise searches for mooks within 30 unit radius behind the player.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.FireWeapon(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Fires weapon projectile at specified position and velocity. Sets gun animation frame, creates muzzle flash, spawns projectile, and triggers fire events.
member.param: X position for projectile spawn
Y position for projectile spawn
X velocity for projectile
Y velocity for projectile

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Gib(DamageType,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Destroys the character into gibs (gore pieces) if gibbing is allowed. Releases held objects, sets appropriate death type, creates gib visual effects, sends network RPC to synchronize gibbing, saves death GIFs for heroes, handles special plasma death effects, and disconnects any attached face huggers.
member.param: Type of damage that caused the gibbing
Horizontal velocity for gib pieces
Vertical velocity for gib pieces

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.GibRPC(DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Network RPC handler for synchronizing gibbing across all connected players. Updates the character position for out-of-bounds deaths and calls the local Gib method to ensure consistent visual effects across the network.
member.param: Type of damage that caused the gibbing
Horizontal velocity for gib pieces
Vertical velocity for gib pieces
X position for out-of-bounds gibbing
Y position for out-of-bounds gibbing

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.IsLockedInMelee
member.summary: Checks if character is locked in melee animation. Used to prevent other actions during melee attacks.
member.returns: True if doing melee and cannot do independent animations, false otherwise

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Knock(DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies knockback force to the character from damage or explosions. Clears any impalement state and ignores knockback if frozen. Applies half the horizontal knockback force and uses different vertical limits for heroes (300) versus enemies (400). Automatically deactivates parachute if knocked upward.
member.param: Type of damage causing the knockback
Horizontal knockback force (half is applied)
Vertical knockback force
Whether to force the character into a tumbling state (currently unused)

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.KnockSimple(DamageObject)
member.summary: Simplified knockback method using a DamageObject for consistent force application. Ignores knockback if frozen and applies blast forces with the same velocity clamping as SetVelocity method.
member.param: DamageObject containing knockback force information

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.ReleaseAlien(Mook,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: RPC method that handles alien release from chest bursting. Applies fire damage to spawned alien if specified.
member.param: The alien unit being released
X velocity for alien spawn
Y velocity for alien spawn
Whether the alien should be set on fire
Index of player that witnessed the spawn

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.ReleaseGrenadeRPC(Grenade,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: RPC method for releasing grenades across network. Handles grenade physics and positioning.
member.param: Grenade object to release
X velocity for grenade
Y velocity for grenade
X position for grenade release
Y position for grenade release

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.ReleaseHeldObject(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases currently held object (grenade or mook) with appropriate physics and networking. Handles both throwing and dropping scenarios.
member.param: Whether object is being thrown (true) or dropped (false)

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunFiring
